text: Excellent customer service and outstanding job on my headlights. They look new!  Highly recommend Like Nu. Thanks again, Jamie. Bringing you more work soon.

text: Ms. Jamie and Mr. Carter were so nice patient and receptive when I described how I wanted my 88 pickups seat refinished. Used some custom materials and gave them a pretty  good description of what I wanted and they knocked it out of the park ! They even recovered and  foamed my 3 wheeler seat!!! Amazing service!

name: Amanda Baker
text: Jamie and her team do a fantastic job. They replaced the headliner in my 2007 Honda Accord and it looks great. She laid out the costs so there were no hidden fees at the end, and her rates were very competitive. They have a quick turnaround time so that you aren't without your car for too long.  And the shop cat was adorable as well :-)

name: Angela Hurst
text: THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO!Affordable and awesome!! Jamie is so sweet and so helpful.  She taught us how to solve our issue in the future (saving us money on future visits). The moment we stepped out of our vehicle we were greeted and treated like family...lol...it was a pleasant experience.  Thank you for all your help!!

text: Definitely a friendly place. Mrs.Jamie is very upfront and cares bout the service they provide.

name: donnie edwards
text: OMG!!!! I don’t even know where to start. First I want to thank my coworker for recommending Like Nu. I took my 2008 Cadillac CTS to get a hole repaired in my leather driver seat that was caused by a broken frame. When I went to pick up the car and saw the seat, all I could say is”WOW”.!!!! I can’t even describe the great lengths she went to repair the seat. Not only does the leather look amazing, the frame was fixed and the electric seat works again!!! The prices are very fair and the work is A-1. Jamie and her team are the the greatest at what they do. I would recommend this place to anyone that wants quality work. Thanks again,Jamie.😃😃P.S , very nice family at LIKE NU!!

name: J R
text: Took my truck here in Oct of 2020 and they forgot to reconnect the sway bar up front, which I fixed. Then gave them a second chance with my wife's car and just discovered they only replaced 3 of the 5 lug bolts on one wheel. Now I have to buy new lug bolts. Go somewhere else if you want the job done correctly.

resp.text: Our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! I see that we have already opened a customer service ticket, we will be back in touch soon!

name: Amanda
text:
As a woman I can say that I have never had a good experience in places when getting my car serviced.  I am spoken down to, given hidden charges, and just treated with general disrespect.
But this was absolutely not the case coming here. Ricky was incredibly nice and spoke to me like an actual human being. I told him what I needed and what time I needed it done. Not only was it done in the exact time I needed, he called to verify what we discussed and verify the price. He did not try to sell my anything unnecessary. And the price wasn't a penny over what he told me. It was an amazing experience and it will be the only place I get my car serviced for the foreseeable future. Thank you for your respect and impeccable service.

resp.text: Thanks for the stars, Amanda! Glad the team was able to take such great care of you. Take care!

name: Kevin Stephens
text: This review is more for an employee than the store itself. Not to take away from the store, though, the store is great. Tire Tech, Ricky, deserves a large amount of praise. That gentleman works his behind off. Every time I’m in the store, he’s there. Working hard. He’s got a fantastic attitude and a general willingness to help. If someone from Tire Discounters sees this, give that man a raise.

resp.text: Awww, thank you for the 5-star review and the kind comments Ricky. We are so glad you had a great experience Kevin, we do what we do for customers just like you. Please come back and see us again when you need us and stay safe out there!

name: Claire Tomlin
text:
Fantastic service! They helped me with my tire issue and Ima go back to them for all my tire needs!

Pros: Honest and down to earth; easy to talk to!

Cons: a bit standoffish at first but it may have been the weather (Torrential downpour)

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Claire! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

name: William Swinson
text: Joseph the manager and his staff have been phenomenal. Great prices and the service is simply outstanding. He and his team helped me solve a major problem that 2020+ Ram 1500 have major complaints about due to tire shimmy at certain speeds. They fixed the entire problem by performing a “dynamic balancing” splitting the needed weights and road force validation. So these folks saved me from a problem that most folks can’t figure out. Truck runs smooth as silk now and these guys were a pleasure to work with. I will NEVER NEVER take my vehicles anywhere else. You guys just made me a customer for life. Just so you know, I make a living teaching organizations how to be efficient and “customer-centric” and these guys rock !!!! Thanks guys!!!!! Ed

resp.text: That’s how we roll, William! Glad we were able to take such good care of you. Thanks, and we’ll see you again down the road!

name: Ryan Cass
text: For the last 5 years I’ve been taking my Camry to NTB in Huntsville and they were fine until they started trying to up sell me on stuff I didn’t need and their prices kept going up with the staff becoming less and less friendly too. When Tire Discounters opened up on Winchester road I looked forward to trying them out since they are much closer and after having some work done on my other vehicles I knew this would be the right place to get a fresh set of tires. They had a great sale going on for Pirelli’s and they are driving great, hopefully they maintain their friendly service and good prices because this is where I’ll be going for the life of my new tires.

resp.text: We rock so you can roll! We're the authority in customer service and auto safety, Ryan. See ya in 5000 miles for your 1st of many free lifetime tire care visits. We want to take make sure we take good care of those new puppies.

resp.text: That's how we roll! We are the authority in auto safety, Kim. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

name: Terry Smith
text: Only 1 tech there.  2 went home the day we were there. Who knows why.  We had appt to get a flat fixed and by 1230 we were ready to make earliest appt. Next day.  The woman said we should have made appt anyway.  Well we did... we told her when we walked through the door. So she looked and got pretty nervous.  They got us in ASAP ands we finally got the tire fixed.  Overall we will use our tire discounters on W72 and county line. We were out of town and Hampton Cove was thre closest. Good luck if you use them.

resp.text: Terry, our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! We definitely care about your experience and we'd like to connect to learn more. If you would like to discuss, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com so we can get back in touch with you. Please include a copy of your review for reference, we hope to hear back from you soon! Thank you and stay safe!

name: Madison
text: My day started out with a flat tire on my car. I took my car here and the nice staff at tire discounters did not hesitate to fix my tire for me! 10/10 would be back again.

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Madison! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

name: Dan Nguyen
text: Awesome service! The staff is very  quick, attentive and professional. They patched my SUV for FREE and cleaned the wheels. We were just about to head out for a road trip so this was great. I'll definitely be coming back when those tires need to be replaced.

resp.text: Rockin' and rollin'! Glad we could keep ya rollin' safely, Dan. Hope you enjoyed your trip and we'll see ya again when ya need us.

name: Stefanie Terrell
text: Do not take your vehicle here unless you’d like something coincidentally to happen requiring an additional repair. My husband took his vehicle here for a tire patch which resulted in him being told he needed new tires due to uneven wear. He received a quote and agreed to pursue the new tire service. During service, he was told that his alignment was extremely off; although he had taken his vehicle to the dealership for routine maintenance. They drove his vehicle to our house (courtesy drop-off) and didn’t even mention that the vehicle was making a grinding noise when accelerating and slowing down (4WD issue). Deceitful and dishonest. Their management told my husband that this was a coincidence and a known issue with the make and model of his vehicle. Then proceeded to give him a quote to repair. BUYER BEWARE

resp.text: We have strict policies in place to never oversell unnecessary items and follow MAP guidelines when making any product or service recommendations. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concerns, Stefanie. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? We look forward to connecting.

text: I took my car in for a windshield replacement and noticed that the rear view mirror cover was damaged in the process. Nobody said anything to me about it, they just tried to get it back in place but it kept falling down. When I called to report it, they said they would order another one and replace it when I took my car in for its next oil change. When that time came, my husband took the morning off and drove  the car the hour and a half drive it takes to get to this dealership. My husband was told the rear view mirror cover had been replaced but when I got my car back, I noticed it had NOT been replaced. I called the service department and was told that it had indeed been replaced. When I inquired as to how the service tech then managed to break TWO covers and not mention it, I was told they would need to get back to me. When they called me back, I was told the the part had never actually been ordered and that they would order it and ship it to my house so I could replace it myself. This is not the first time I have had issues with dishonesty when dealing with the service department at this dealership. I had issues with them not being honest when I took my former BMW in for service as well. It’s the closest dealership to me and still an hour and a half away. It’s a shame that honesty and integrity mean nothing to them. The fact that they just pushed the cover back up and tried to pass it off as “fixed” tells a lot about the care and pride they put in to their work. This car company seems to be going down hill fast. Their car prices have gone up but their service is minimal at best. I paid a lot of money for my car AND for the service I’m not receiving.

text: Took an after market radio there to be installed in place of another after market radio already installed. The owner himself installed it and he did it in less than 15 minutes. I was in a rush so left and came back another day. Dude tells me the new system didn't have an back up camera input. Yea Right. I wouldn't have bought the system if that was the case. I take it to an Audio shop that I use all the time to get all my stuff installed including the other after market radio that was replaced by the new one. They call me to the back and show me where the wires where just thrown in the back of the dash versus using just 1 cable tie and where on the back of the system, it clearly has a wire and and input that says CAM. Not to mention they gave me a dash kit that fit the radio so you can't see the gap between the head unit and the dash board. I've gotten a lot of cars tinted here by other workers, but never had the manager himself work on my car and never got electronics installed here and will never again. How you own a shop but your workers do a better job than you? Hope ya enjoy that over priced $ 75 cux it's the last dime you getting outta me.

name: Patrick Facchine
text:
DON'T GO HERE!!! GO ANYWHERE ELSE! !

If you don't feel like reading the entire review I understand so the short version is this.
My truck left there worse than it went in and I paid them almost $300 to do that. Lights now don't work, instrument lights don't work, if I turn the AC on after starting the truck it resets the audio system. Wires hanging, trash left in the truck and really, REALLY poor service and lack of respect. When I told the owner about the problems and that I simply wanted a refund for labor only  because I don't feel comfortable letting them back into my wiring he said "good luck bro! Try and get your money back and I'll sue YOU!".
I never want back because after checking the receipt it clearly says no refunds which makes sense when you do work like this.

The quality of workmanship AND professionalism was and still is the worst I've ever encountered.
I have NEVER written a review and I'm 30 years old and have dealt a lot in business. The fact that I'm writing this review is an extreme for me.

The stereo system they " installed " for me is very cut and dry.  I supplied the head unit, subwoofer and amp for '02 Tahoe. When I called to make an appointment they said come in first thing Monday (I called on Friday ) and this wasn't a problem for me.
When I called Monday morning to find out why my fiance was waiting in the parking lot for 45 minutes just to see someone they told me they're audio guy doesn't work Mondays but "they'll make it work".
After 4 hours of "installing" she finally left. When I got home from work and inspected the work I found the following:

1) Wires freely hanging run across my pedals.
2) The sub and amp were installed on the wrong side of the vehicle after being told 5 times and told to 3 different employees where to put it. I even set it up on the side I wanted it on and they put it opposite.
3) I was told they tune the system before it leaves the shop. They're " tuning " involved them turning everything to the maximum capacity and leaving it. Dangerous to any electronics.
4) They didn't have the materials needed to do a professional installation on my head unit (which is a $650 Kenwood double din) so I still have spaces beside the unit and looks like ass and nothing like a factory install like they assured me it would.
6) Left trash wire and clippings all through out my truck. When I mentioned this the OWNER told me "there was already trash there." There wasn't. I keep a clean truck. And when I mentioned the poorly ran wiring he told me it couldn't be because he did the wiring HIMSELF! !

I could list more but you get the idea and as I said I don't write reviews. Please take my advise and do not use this place. It's now costing me double to have someone else fix their handy work.

name: Sean Copenhaver
text:
So there I was, just dropped the kids off at school with minutes to spare, running a little behind on my way into work, and with my tire low on air the entire time! It truly felt like a Monday indeed. The caution light erupts to life on my dashboard nearly blinding me, my rear driver side tire...is low on air. *Que dramatic music*
I pull into the nearest mechanic shop and park right in front of the first available bay. They were all open and currently being mopped by the staff. Before I have a chance to throw the car in park, there is a young man walking my way. With the car now in park, I step out of the car and he greets me with a warm smile and a "Good Morning to ya, what can we help with?", but before I have a chance to open my mouth he whistles in shock at the sight of my tire. When I turn around to see the damage, there it is, staring me in the face like a angry mother-in-law when you make an inappropriate joke at the dinner table, a screw.
Now there's two men attending to my car. Courtney, the first-responder, and Lamar, the muscle. The elect to change out the tire and find what they have in stock. 2 good conversation and half a cup of cheap coffee later I've got keys in my hand and ready to start my day. I made it to work on time too for anyone who was wondering.

resp.text: We are so appreciative for you sharing your story. These guys really do work hard to try to be a positive impact in people's lives. Some may say, "you guys just change oil." but we like to say, "we're not just changing oil, we're changing lives!" we strive to be the best 10 minutes in a customers day. thank you for your business and we are so grateful again for your kind words.

name: Ernest G Waters
text: Update to previous review.  Since my initial visit to the McGee rd service facility back in December,  which did an excellent job, I have had 2 bad experiences.  1st bad experience was with my wife's car. She had the oil changed at the eastern blvd facility.  Approximately 1 week later her car's check engine light came on and the fault was for dirty oil. She had the oil checked at a local change facility and it was a quart low. They did another oil change, and I have the filter from that change and it is not as clean a filter as you think from 1 week previous. I had also gotten my oil changed in my truck a few days after she did at the eastern Blvd facility.  So I decided to take a look at my oil and filter. The filter on my truck had an install date written on it from the McGee Rd facility of 12/9/19. The date I first got Express to change it. They supposedly changed my oil and filter on 2/7/20 at McGee rd. I will also attach a pic of the filter . Needless to say this is a very bad way to run a business.  Engine damage from dirty oil is very significant possibility from these action.

resp.text: Hi there, Ernest. While we never like for a customer to leave unsatisfied, feedback like this helps us grow as a company. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We value your business and would love to address your concerns as quickly as possible. When you have time, please leave us your contact information as well as the details you provided here at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you!

I hope you will see this is much more than just an oil change that some others out there are offering. we hope to earn your business and your trust.

text: I can't overstate how much I appreciate this shop.  Long Lewis Ford gave me an estimate for over $4,000.00 for a new transmission (E350 drivetrain).  I came to Bacon for a second opinion because the owner is a transmission expert.  Turns out the transmission is fine.  I paid $35.00 for the assessment.  Previously, I had Bacon do a transmission service at 195,000 miles on my Ford F-150.  They fixed a glitch that Ford dealers could never get a handle on - when I accelerated hard between 30-40 mph, it would miss.  No longer!

name: rtc
text:
Went in for new shocks and coils, they installed them well, but when I started driving, my vehicle constantly pulled to the left. If I didn't hold the steering wheel tight it would have flipped at high speeds. So I called them and they swore they had done an alignment. I asked if they'd check again to make sure it was done right and they begrudgingly said yes. Took it back in, they said everything looked great. I drove it off the lot and there was still a severe pull to the left. They blamed my tires and said it's because they had a bad wear pattern. (My tires were only a few months old).

So I took it to another place on the other side of the river. They did an alignment and told me that whoever had done my previous alignment lied to me. They showed me on a print out how the camber was over an inch out of line and how the toe of one wheel was turned too far in. I drove off the lot and my vehicle drove as straight as an arrow.

Bacon Alignment lied to me twice and charged me for something they didn't do. Avoid.

name: Brandon Cunningham (Triumph)
text:
All Around Mechanic (James Richards) came out to my house to replace an alternator. He started taking the alternator out without disconnecting the battery and ended up shorting the alternator plug to ground. Our car would not crank with the new alternator installed. He began checking fuses but could not find any visible blown fuse. He admitted what occured was his fault and that he would fix it. He said he would be back later that evening but never showed up. Since then he has avoided answering my calls and he has blocked me on facebook. Learn from this situation and stay away from this clown. I wish I had saw the other bad review before dealing with him. Apparently he stays on the run.

Proverbs 20:17

17 Bread gained by deceit is sweet to a man,
but afterward his mouth will be full of gravel.

name: Hailey Bain
text:
*WOW*
If I could give 10 stars, I would!

The whole team at Maaco is absolutely amazing! They truly exceeded my expectations in every area. Krista (sales technician) goes above and beyond to ensure everything is fairly priced and handled properly & efficiently. Carlos (the owner) was very friendly and gave me a ride back to work when he realized I didn’t have one. Michael and the guys in the shop did a wonderful job painting and got my car painted quickly, while still delivering high quality work.

In fact, they got my car finished earlier than expected and knew I needed my car over the weekend, but they asked if I could bring it back on Monday because they wanted to touch up a tiny spot they saw that was completely unnoticeable to me. It is evident that they have a high attention to detail and value the quality of their work.

I seriously couldn’t have asked for a more positive experience and I highly recommend Maaco to anyone needing anything done to their vehicle!

text: I have used this location twice. I am beyond happy with both trips here. Brian and Dustin were very helpful, professional and their service allowed me to not wait there long. They have my business and will be a returning customer. Thank you!

name: Kendra Sparks
text: Super grateful for this business and Brian. Our family was traveling home from Florida and our back tire went out 4 hours into our 14 hour drive, we went to Walmart first and they didn’t have our tire size, and we called down to Express Oil Change and they told us to bring our car down And at the very least would get our spare on so we could get somewhere that had our tire size as they didn’t have one in stock either. They called down to another Express Oil Change 10 miles away who had one for us. Instead of putting our young family on a spare tire in an area we didn’t know, they drove down and got the tire for us and changed it there. They had us back on the road in about an hour and half. While I don’t know when we will be back through, I will forever be grateful for their kindness, and professionalism and highly recommend them if you are traveling through.

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us with your vehicle's maintenance needs and making Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers your shop of choice! We appreciate your business and thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our shop Kendra!

name: Marissa Blaylock
text:
This place is awesome!! Dustin was my “tech” and he was incredibly nice and helpful! I use them for all kinds of things!

I am updating this because I recently used them for an issue with my check engine light and my converter was bad in my car! They were excellent, professional, and very great at making sure I got the best deal! Sam, the assistant manager, was always following up and taking care of anything that came up! Would 100% recommend them for something as simple as an oil change to as big as an exhaust issues!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind review, Marissa! We’re happy to be your shop of choice for your auto service needs. If you need anything else, don’t hesitate to give us a call!

name: Patty Griffith
text: I pulled in to an empty parking lot and empty bays. I explained that I wanted an oil change and an alignment. After my oil change my car was put in the parking lot and the shop filled up. Other cars started getting aligned and my car sat there for almost an hour. After asking about it they then put my car on the rack. When I was ready to check out. It gets better. They tell me they couldn’t alignment my tires because it had to be weighted and go to the dealership. (Added: Which is a lie. I was able to take it to NTB and get aligned the next day.) This was my first time at this location and I will not be back.

resp.text: Hi Patty. While we never like for a customer to leave unsatisfied, feedback like this helps us grow as a company. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We value your business and would love to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please share your contact information, as well as the details you provided here, at www.expressoil.com/contact/ so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you!

name: Britt Noelle
text: I happened to be traveling through Calera on my way home, and unfortunately got a flat tire. It was the perfect storm of bad timing, incredibly delayed roadside service, and the literal annoyance of cold and rainy weather. I looked up tire mechanics in the area and happened upon these guys. After a couple of calls to let them know i was still awaiting a tow truck, we realized I might not even make it to them before closing time. And on top of that, if it was deemed that I did need a new tire, they might not have what I needed. It was at this point that the managers asked me where I was located! Wyatt and Sam actually drove to where I was, helped me put my spare tire on, and assisted me safely to the shop. They were busy, and still took incredible care of me. I truly can't thank the team there enough. The customer service is off the charts. Everyone was personable and kind, the shop itself is clean and orderly, and they got me taken care of super fast! Honestly, I am just so thankful to have encountered such a great team. Its too bad I'm not a local, but I'm very thankful that it was in Calera that my tire blew. :) THANKS AGAIN Y'ALL!!

resp.text: Hi, Britt, thank you for the positive feedback! Our team here at Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers is always happy to service your vehicle, and we’re thrilled to hear the customer service was stellar. We look forward to continuing to do business with you in the future!

text:
i went out to get lunch and noticed my tire was low, so i stopped into the calera location. i pulled in to the parking lot and sat for several minuets and no one came out to great me. so i decided to pull behind one of the bays and wait. after the car in the bay was guided out, they guided my in. i told them i needed my tire pressure checked and after checking them he said one was very low and that i probably needed a patch. i asked how long it would take  (since i just got lunch and needed to take it home to the family)
he told me 20 min. an hour and a half later, no one even came to tell me it was taking a little longer and at one point a customer pulled into the lot and almost drove into the bay because no one was in the oil change area. the driver got out and walked into the waiting room and asked "where are all the employees" i told her i had not seen anyone in a while, she got back in her car and left. terrible customer service.

resp.text: Hi Jamie, we’re sorry you were dissatisfied with our staff and experience during your service. We value your business and would love to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please visit us at www.expressoil.com/contact/ and leave your contact information, as well as the details of your experience, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: Gracie Vela
text:
I tried to use this company/business to get a window fixed on my vehicle.  Not only was I lied to apart my part, I was also lied to about the person at the mechanic shop that was supposed to be there to fix it.
According to them, they use the same company to transport parts to the different shops and that the drivers all have more or less the same route.  So if someone could please answer me this question;  how is it that you have the same driver, same truck, same route have EVERY PIECE  of glass break on not 1 occasion, but on 5 trips in the same month?  And how is it that that driver still works and has his license?
Myself, and my husband were also told that a man by the name of Tony was the one that was in charge of my window, since he was not only the supervisor, but he was the man that works on windows.  Well when we both called and asked for him, not only did he NOT WORK THERE, the shop has NEVER heard of him.  Come to find out he was dating someone that works in that office, and apparently they broke up or were arguing and they wanted to get back at him by trying to blame for not only ALL the glass being broken on every order, but by falsifying his employment.
When I did call back and tell them my questions and concerns, not only was I hung up on, but my number was blocked and so was my husband's.  Now even if we call from our work's phone number once we say who we are or mention what vehicle we are talking about we get hung up on and when we call back we get a message that the number is no longer in service.
I know this because I called just before posting this and when I mentioned my name and vehicle the line got disconnected somehow and when I called back the number a few minutes later I got that same disconnect message.
DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY, unless you don't mind being lied to and having your insurance company lied to also.

text: They left my car a complete mess glue everywhere on the radio on the strip above the windshield the only reason they got a 1 🌟 is because I couldn't go any lower. I take very good care of my car it's garage kept hasn't been in the rain yet but wouldn't be surprised if it don't leak.and upon further inspection the trim around the glass is loose just a poorly done job.Thats why you don't go with the cheapest you go with the best.

text: I was referred to Glass America when I had to replace my vehicle's windshield. I couldn't have been happier with their service. text: Daniel was amazing! He was respectful, answered all my questions. Did an amazing job on our windshield! 10/10 would recommend!

text: Great service and technician was great. I highly recommend them.

name: Seth Green
text: Glass America replaced my windshield on September 4th, 2019, but did not used the recommended procedure to remove the windshield/roof pillar moulding and broke my car. The technician was in a hurry or didn't bother to look up the recommended procedure; instead pulled the moulding off the car with brute strength. He broke the tabs that hold the moulding on the vehicle. After the incident, I submitted a claim with Glass America and three (3) months later they still have not resolved the issue. The only resolution they have offered to date is to glue the moulding back on the car which is not approved by me or the manufacturer because of the risk of flying off while at highway speed. In the mean time, I have not been able to leave my car outside in the rain because without the moulding installed properly, the rain water leaks into the interior.

name: Kristi Chamberlain
text: We brought our car into Glass America solely as a precaution.  The dealership fixed a small electric problem for us and stated that while they could find no evidence of moisture getting in through our windshield, it might be possible that water was getting in.  My husband and I never saw any evidence whatsoever that there was water getting in; however, we took the car into Glass America just to follow up.  The glass technician looked at our windshield and said that it looked good and that there was not a problem, except that there was a tiny place on the passenger side that needed a little bit of resealing.  He resealed it for free and sent us on our way.  A few days later it rained and water was not just leaking...but pouring into our car from the top of the windshield.  The ceiling of the car was sopping wet and water was all over the console and floors.  I called Glass America about this issue and I was transferred to a manager named Brandon (who had never seen our car), and who proceeded to inform me that my car already had a problem and that is why we brought it there to begin with.  He denied any responsibility for the issue.  He talked over me constantly and then stated that the only way in which to rule out a leak would be to have taken off the entire windshield to begin with.  When I asked why that wasn't done to begin with if that is the ONLY way to rule out a leak, he accused me of calling the people at Glass America "bad people."  I have never experienced such rude customer service.  He did not offer any compensation and now we have water damage to our car.  When we called the dealership and spoke with the technician who had referred us to Glass America, he was astounded by what happened because he knew that we were not having any leaks even remotely close to that in the car he had worked on.  We would definitely not recommend Glass America to anyone.

text: I've been coming to RoadMart for two years now and I am now having the worst time with them. I brought my car in a week ago because the front end of the car was not driving properly. RoadMart said that they could not replicate the issue but they did see I needed my tires balanced, I let them balance my tires and when I left I was having the same issues. I brought my car back and then they said the tires were  separating on the inside, so I paid 367 for four brand new tires. Replacing the tires only helped the car drive smoother but the problem was now worse! So I brought my car back today and now there saying that the back tires are the cause of the front tires shifting and that wasn't something they could fix, I would have to take it to the dealership. The guy said he could try to align the front to see if that would help but it made the issue even worse then when I had initially brought the car in. I am now sitting here after closing hours so they can set my alignment back to were it was. I just feel like if they were unable to repair the car in the first place then they should've said so instead of me coming out of 446 dollars for no reason. I asked if I could a refund for the alignment and the guy said that he wouldn't be able to refund me, would have to wait until next call and ask for a refund or he could credited as two free oil changes which is not acceptable for my inconvenience

name: Robert Rainey
text:
Took my truck in for repairs, a date was set.  They call 2 weeks later (time I could have gotten into another shop) to tell me they couldn't honor the appointment they set.  Called me today and said they could not take my truck in on the date they set.  Period.  My mother had problems with these people and I should have known better than waste my time with them.

You must have me mixed up with somebody else.  Will called me this morning and all he said was he couldn’t take my truck in on 10/19 (the date that was set).  I told him I’d call him back.  I made a call to another shop (down the road).  Called back and told Candy I’ll be taking somewhere else.

I’m giving you an honest review.   You are unable to accept the truth.

resp.text: Mr Rainey, as the owner of the company, I feel that we should reply to your complaint via Google since you chose to insinuate we couldn’t honor your appointment via our Google review page.  We actually called this morning to confirm your appointment for next week and you told the customer service representative that we would have to complete your repair within 1 week or you would go somewhere else.  We explained that we cannot commit to that due to the size and complexity of the repair and the fact that dealing with your insurer (name withheld) results in a 100% guarantee that additional damage would be found as they write their estimates without a disassembly to identify all hidden damage.  They typically take 3-4 days to complete a supplement.  I truly apologize that we were unable to meet your expectations, however, we would rather you and all customers know up front that a repair cannot be performed within those expectations when we know that it cannot be done that rapidly.  To tell you otherwise would simply be telling a lie to get you in the door and then you would be more upset after finding out that’s what we did to get your sale.  We don’t want our customers to endure that.  Best of luck in getting your repairs completed.

2 years ago I had Auto Craft refurbish the headlights on the Nisan as they were looking rather scuffed up and dull.  Today they STILL look excellent.

They really care about their customers at Auto Craft and it is obvious.  I was even contacted over the weekend to make sure that we were happy with their work.

Hopefully nothing happens any time soon to bring us back, but if it does, there is no where else we would go.

text: Very  friendly and helpful. Willing to discuss proposed repairs and costs! Car runs great after service completed.

resp.text: That means we did our job, this is our goal for each car and customer.  Thank you for choosing us to perform the scheduled transmission service on your Mercedes.

name: Marliese Thomas
text: I drive an older BMW and had to call four places before finding a shop that would work on a car that old. The people at World Class Auto Repair were friendly, helpful, and effective! The final repair was even less than the original estimate. I'm so glad to now know of a quality repair place that's also in my neighborhood.

resp.text: Thank you. We have been in business for 30 years, and our journeyman technicians have years of experience with older BMWs and Mercedes as well as the diagnostic tools and expertise for newer ones.

name: Patrick Dailey
text: I don't normally post reviews, but I feel compelled to pass along my excellent experience at World Class Auto. I had the front/back brakes replaced on my 2011 BMW 328i, and the work was quality, timely, and fairly priced. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and generally made the experience as enjoyable as possible. Additionally, the mechanic diagnosed and fixed my broken windshield washer pump without me evening mentioning the issue at first (compared to a certain service provider, who shall remain nameless, who wanted $300 to do it!). I'd give them 6 stars if I could.

resp.text: Wow!  We give customers like this 6 stars also.  We want to take care of our customers by taking care of their cars, and give them one less thing to be concerned with in life.  Thanks for your kind review Patrick.

name: Edward Payne
text: World Class auto repair is a Great alternative to the dealer . They gave me the Star treatment . I recommend them to everyone who want dealer service , but not dealer repair prices . Edward Payne .

resp.text: Thank you for 5 stars. We promise to continue to give you and all our customers the "star treatment "....you deserve it.  We're glad we could repair your Mercedes by replacing the ignition.

name: Don’t Worry
text: Owner quoted me at $700 then some lady quoted me $1100 at checkout. This has happened before because I read a review about this and then it happened to me. Red flags everywhere here. Went elsewhere

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with our service, but are grateful you've brought it to our attention. We invite you to call the shop in order to speak with the owner directly. We'd be happy to address your concerns and frustrations, however I believe the confusion is that you called for an estimate and the fellow you spoke with gave you a price over the phone based on your assessment of the car, but when you brought it in, we gave you an accurate estimate of what your vehicle needed, including both parts and labor.  When you have time, please call (205) 591-7990. We hope to hear from you soon so we may work to resolve the issue. Thank you!

name: Joseph Beavers
text: Best experience I've ever had getting my car repaired. Staff is awesome and professional.

resp.text: That says a lot....THANK YOU!

text:
What else is there to say when they are the best. 😁😁
They deserve beyond the 5 Star Review.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words regarding the work we did on your Mercedes.

text: Brought my 1994 BMW 325is in for a driveshaft and mount issue, and they had my bimmer fixed right up. Quick turnaround and reasonable pricing. Will probably use these guys again if I need more servicing done on my car

name: David Goodwin
text:
An amazing job with an older Mercedes 300CD!  It has essentially sat for a number years and the service and repair schedule needed to begin again.  They kept in constant contact as they uncovered areas that needed to be addressed with a full explanation and estimate of the work needed.
It was a great experience and and I'm very comfortable in recommending World Class Auto Repair.

resp.text: Good customers are like good cars...hard to find...and we both lucked up.  Thanks for the great review.

text: Excellent customer service always, great cost-savings, A+++ work!!!

name: John Markus
text: I have used World Class for several years and have been quite satisfied with the quality of the work and value received.  I trust them not to recommend more than I need and to perform any necessary repairs right the first time.  Also, the offer of a ride downtown and back makes the process very convenient.

name: Dwayne Carmichael
text: Do not take your vehicle to this place. I brought my BMW X5 there to have the water pump replaced. They replaced the water pump, but damaged other parts on my vehicle while doing the repair. I was quoted $360 labor to replace the water pump. I called to check on my vehicle later that evening, and Yvonne said that her technician was having a hard time installing the water pump and that they had to charge me an extra hour worth of labor. Who fault is that? I told them no way, so they only charged me the $360 that I was originally quoted. However they did mentioned that my car needed 2 more repairs and quoted me $563 for one and $440 for the other. The $440 repair was for a hose that was damaged while they were changing the pump. The hose cost $40 from the BMW dealership and they said it would be 4 hours of labor, which didn't sound right for a hose. I called 3 other independent shops and was quoted $130 for the same repair parts and labor. The $563 was for a hood latch and cable, the parts at dealer are $80. Yvonne also said it would be 4 hours labor. I called several independent shops and was quoted $200 for parts and labor. I guess 4 is there magic number. When I asked Yvonne to double check those quotes all of a sudden she wasn't able to find the labor rates in the system. How did she come up with those figures initially? Bottom line do not take your car to these ppl. Yvonne charges you whatever she feels like and that's not right.

resp.text: We remember you well.  You brought your car late one afternoon with a coolant leak,  and we drove you across town to take you home. You didn't mention that your hood latch was locked and would not open. We spent quite a while to opened the hood to replace the water pump that you brought for us to install, and you declined the hood repair knowing that it would not reopen once it was shut.  We actually charged less labor to install the water pump than the labor guide prescribes.  We also told you about another coolant leak that you say we caused, but we did not; you also declined that repair.  Yes, we would normally charge more because of the extra work to open your hood because of the latch and cable.  Your car came in with several problems, but none caused by us.  We did our best to accommodate you in every way and we're sorry you left dissatisfied.

name: Rico Suave
text: Dropped my car off for a radiator change. It took about a week to just get an estimate when I was told it would be looked at the following morning. When I finally got the estimate, it was on the high end, quoted a few more hours than normal. Continuously called to try to get information over the next week! Was lied to several times throughout the two weeks and one day for a radiator change! Wasn't even notified when they required another part.  On top of it, the manager/owner referred to me as a "damn Yankee". Great business savvy you moron. If you want over priced work, dishonesty, ignorant management this is the place for you. Honestly, the worst experience I've ever had at a car maintenance facility.

resp.text: Sorry, Mr. Suave, but we have no record of you ever being in our shop.  We take our reviews very seriously, but you must have us confused with another shop.

The repair and ownership team take the time to get to know you and always listen to what I think is going on with my car. Hands down I wouldn't take my car any other place in the Birmingham area for regular maintenance to more complex projects.

Most of the service I have received is on a 2005 BMW x3. They are helping me keep it rolling in good shape.

name: John Petit
text: To anyone in the Foley, Gulf Shores and Orange Beach area who needs engine repair, please strongly consider Fausak.  I gave them 5 stars and took the time to write a review and here is why.  They performed the service review on my 2015 Toyota Avalon with 70K miles and it was missing badly and seemed like a coil pack problem.  The original diagnosis and estimate came in around $650.  I gave them the verbal to proceed and they called back an hour and half later to tell me that their original diagnosis was incorrect and that they found the problem.  A beach mouse/rodent chewed the fuel line to one of the cylinders and the bill would be $136 parts and labor.  I was overjoyed and consider that an incredible testimony to their honesty and integrity.  I will do business with them whenever I can in the future and I recommend them highly.

resp.text: John, we appreciate you sharing your experience. It is important to our business to treat our customers with respect and honesty when it comes to their auto repair needs. Thank you for coming to us with your Toyota Avalon and we look forward to working with you next time!

They were so accommodating, fixed his tire, and even found another nail in another tire and fixed it.  They did it quick and we were back to our vacation within an hour.  I highly recommend this place.

name: M. Tyler Arthur
text: Stopped in to check a deflated tire and was told a ( perfectly fine otherwise) tire cannot be repaired/plugged more than once. Upon a quick search - this isn't the case at all! Fausak will not see my cars again. Honesty and trust are most important to me and was let down on both fronts.

resp.text: Mr. Arthur,  Thank you for reaching out to us and pointing out our miscommunication.  Your tire had a puncture that was too close to a prior repair and together the repairs would have overlapped.  This makes the tire unsafe to repair according to the Tire Industry Association and the US Tire Manufacturers Association.  Our top priority is the safety of all our guests and employees, and ultimately every other car on the road.  We failed to explain these guidelines accurately which led to the misunderstanding and for that we apologize.  We have sent a copy of the excerpts from each of these guidelines to you.   If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to reviews@fausaktire.com or call the Foley store.  Thank you.

name: Joseph Daniels
text:
Manny is the Absolute Best! Having never owned a BMW prior to my visit, I took my recently acquired 1989 E30 Convertible (from a previous owner who failed in fulfilling routine maintenance over the years) to Mota Autohaus for diagnostics and was immediately met with honesty and integrity upon speaking with Manuel over-the-phone and in-person. He gave me an accurate turnaround time and told me when I could expect to hear an update from him. A short time later , Manny gave me a diagnosis of everything needed to get my E30 mechanically proper!

I will not hesitate to recommend Mota Autohaus to anyone needing to get their BMW serviced in Birmingham!

resp.text: I'm always happy to help! Welcome to the BMW family! Thank you for your review.

text: I’ve searched for a way to be able to leave this review for the past 30 mins at work! It was that important to me to leave this review, that’s how AMAZING my service has been!!!! He cared from the beginning BEYOND customer service, YOU CAN’T BUY THAT!! I also believe he can build a BMW from the ground up! I came a female looking to be price gouged and I left full of gratitude and respect!!

resp.text: Thank you! We strive for customer satisfaction, and we know honesty is one of the most important factors when it comes to car repairs. We appreciate you, and your review really means the world to us.

name: brian coshatt
text:
Driving BMWs for 40 years we now own two, an 18 year old BMW E46 and a 29 year old BMW E30. Before finding Mota Autohaus older BMW maintenance was definitely a problem, I've lost count of the ripoffs and horror stories using 3 other local shops in particular.
Manuel always does what he promises, fixes it CORRECTLY and there are NO cheap "knock off" parts, only QUALITY OEM parts. There's no "Bait & Switch" GOTCHAS when the Final Invoice comes,  the estimates hold up when it's time to pay.
Thanks for your Expertise Manuel!
brian

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Brian! I strive for honesty and reliability. It's always a pleasure working with you.

name: Dominique Linchet
text: Manuel Mota just saved me $5,000!  I had my car (a 2008 3 series with 63,000 miles on it) towed to the service department at BMW of Birmingham after it stalled in the middle of an intersection.  After they charged me $190 for a diagnostic to tell me that the engine had “locked up” ( it would have costed another thousand bucks to know why) and that I needed a new engine ($18,000 for a new one, $6,000 for a used), I had the car towed to Mota Autohaus to get a second opinion.  Manuel quickly assessed that I simply needed a new alternator.  He promptly fixed it the day the alternator arrived in his shop and the car is running like new.  The cost, $700.00 (he also had to replace all the oil the dealership’s service department had drained).  Best, most competent, professional service I have encountered in a long time!

resp.text: Thank you, Dominique! It was a pleasure helping you. I always appreciate a good challenge, and I'm happy this ended with you being able to keep your beautiful car. Thanks again!

name: Anna Reeves
text: I’ve never been made to feel more comfortable at an auto shop. I’m a woman who deals with car troubles from time to time, not always knowing if I’m being taken for more than I *need* to have done. At Mota Autohaus, Manny took the time to explain to me what was happening and what needs to be done to resolve the issue. He definitely knows his stuff! Will be using them exclusively going forward!

resp.text: Thank you, Anna! We are happy to hear that your service is exactly what we strive for as a business! We appreciate your kind words and look forward to working with you in the future!

text:
I had came in to get a tire changed. Place was packed out, that's cool, I dont mind.
They have the tire I want but can't put it on the day of because of time constraints, that's okay.
The manager, who's name I will withhold, told me that no other tire shop was open that day and I would have to come back on Monday, although I had already came from Walmart TLE and they were changing tires.
I go up the road and to the other Express Oil and tire center. They have my size tire and change it for me.
Now why the manager of this store lied to me on both occasions is beyond me. I can only assume he was trying to save his sales instead of trying to help a brother out.

I'll be going to the Express Oil on 280, instead. There's good people there.

They even repaired some minor issues because they felt it wasn't right to return my car to me without it being in tip top shape. Their work ethic puts customers first and works in their best interest. If I ever have car troubles again, I'm definitely returning here!

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

Haley McGraw The internet sales manager did everything she could to make sure i was updated and informed on all aspects of the sale . She is top notch and very helpful. Alan Carlisle was also helpful and took great care of me. Ill definitely choose Joe Bullard when i purchase my next car. Thanks again to Haley,Alan and the whole Joe Bullard Cadillac team .

name: Brittney E
text: I took my Escalade to the service dept to get work done on it. They miss diagnosed it and I paid over $500.00 for repair. I had my truck 2 days before it started doing the same thing again. I called to let them know and got the vehicle back over to them. They had my truck a little over a week and claim it was not doing anything for them and that it was old codes showing up. Well since I have had my vehicle back it once again started doing the same thing showing up the same codes. I decided to take it to another dealership and to my surprise the codes that they told me was old was not old they just cleared them instead of fixing my truck. I'm very upset because they repeatedly lied to me over and over. I will not recommend the service dept at all. They just played around with my truck and I called to let Myla know that it was doing the same thing again and that I took it to another dealership and they showed me how codes had been cleared and showed me the history codes. She stated Christian the service manager would call me but he never did.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. I am very sorry your experience wasn’t what you’d hoped. I have reached out to management to let them know about your recent experience. Someone will be in contact soon.

text: I purchased a vehicle from this dealership in Jan 2021. I came from out of state to pick up the vehicle and when I arrived found out there was an issue with the vehicle. After waiting for a while we worked out  a fixed for the issues and the dealer said they would send a check to me for the repairs. It took almost two weeks for them to finally send the check to me.  Now over a month after I purchased the vehicle I get a message from my county tag office saying that the dealership didn't pay the Tag fe and I will have to come in and pay it.  If a dealer is not going to pay these fees, they need to let people know so your not waiting until the temporary tags run out.

name: Katy McGehee
text:
The service department is the best I've ever encountered. They have gone above and beyond every single time. I'm not a crying person but they've made me cry twice. The good cry. The first time: I assume they saw the toy factory and smashed snacks in the carpet or maybe it was my food covered shirt and crazy hair. Either way, they gave me a note of encouragement that every mom needs sometimes with a gift card for coffee. The second time: I requested a larger loaner vehicle which is apparently hard to come by. Along with my 3 kids, my dad is in a wheelchair and I transport him to/from dialysis and we just all wouldn't fit in the smaller one. They greeted me with a "one tough cookie" box with treats and snacks galore.

They are the nicest people and so accommodating. Add uplifting to that mix. That was this exhausted Mama's gift from heaven.

I can't say enough good things about them. I would buy every vehicle from them a thousand times over just to show my appreciation to their service department. Thanks guys!

name: Veronica Eaton
text: I was due for an oil change for my 2012 Cadillac SRX and received a call from the dealership asking me to schedule an appt. I looked online 1st to schedule, there was an appt. available for the next day. I didn't book it, thinking that maybe the person that called would get credit for service. I called her back, and was informed that it would be a week out for the oil change, fine. I also had a secondary issue of getting an estimate for the liftgate actuator replacement. A week later, I take the car in and wait on it. When it was done, I specifically asked about the actuator and was told that the estimate was the paperwork. It wasn't. I called back today to see when I could have this repaired and  was given another appt. a week out. The moral of the story is that they listed 12 things for "recommended services"  but nothing on what I actually requested. The car could have been repaired 10 days ago if I had been given the info that I requested. Now I'm trying to see if I can get my SRX repaired at another dealership either in Pensacola or Gulf Port.

resp.text: Hi Veronica,  I am very sorry to hear about your recent experiece with us. It is our goal to provide each customer with the best service experience possible. We have passed your feedback along to our General Manager and Serivice Manager. With your feedback we can only improve our processes and provide you with the best experience possible.

name: Sherri Herrington
text: By far the absolute best experience I have ever had buying a car. If you are looking for a car please see Michael Sewell. Absolutely fantastic to deal with and I would highly recommend him! The transparency and honesty were a complete change from what I expected. I have an absolute new respect for the Bullard family and their dealerships. Once you walk in there is no doubt that customer satisfaction and the customers experience is higher in the business plan than the numbers are which is not normal operating procedure in most dealerships I could not write enough about how pleased I was with the whole experience. I did not walk out feeling as though a great deal on a vehicle was the only thing I got. I walked out of that dealership with an uplifted spirit and felt through the whole process that I was receiving amazing fellowship and as if I were being edified through this whole process. If God sees fit I will absolutely be a customer for life.They were an absolute inspiration and are a perfect model of a working business  plan that is extremely successful. And I’m not talking only monetarily successful. I left with a fire in me that they helped to burn brighter. And I thank them from the bottom of my heart for allowing God to work through them as they unknowingly ministered to me They never realized it and that’s what makes them special.

name: Douglas Allen
text: What started off as a beautiful experience has turned out to be a nightmare. I purchased what was told to me to be my Certified 2015 Chevrolet Suburban LTZ. Rodney Lofton who is a awesome salesman and Roseevelt Harris the phenomenal finance guy sold me the vehicle and 3mths into my purchased I was told I had over $2k worth of repairs including brakes, new radiator, tune-up, oil cooler lines, and left tie rod end just to name a few. When I asked why wasn't these things serviced and replaced before I purchased the vehicle I was told the repairs wasn't necessary at the time. I feel the salesman did a great job but the service department made it a bad purchase by not doing their job!! I had to pay for the replacement of the radiator and oil cooling lines but the other repairs are still needed. I feel robbed and will probably never purchase from a major dealership like Joe Bullard again!!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Allen,

Thank you for taking the time to give us this feedback. To make sure this issue is addressed/resolved I have notified the General Manager, Jason Colbert, of the situation and asked that he reached out to you as soon as possible today.

I'm very sorry that your service experience did not mirror your sales experience at our store but I'm confident if there's a way to rectify the issue our team will do so.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M., Marketing Manager

name: Robert Werning
text:
Review of Joe Bullard dealership

My used car purchase was probably a little different than most.  In my case, I needed a good, reliable vehicle as quickly as possible and would immediately be making a 12 hour road trip to a different state as soon as the car was in my possession!  My salesman Curtis Williams showed me what I wanted to see, took the time to answer my questions, and gave me the time to decide if the car was right for me - no "pressure to buy" involved.

Curtis actually delivered the car personally the next day, so that I did not have make another 2 hour trip from Pensacola to Mobile and back to pick up the car!
Overall I would say that I am very satisfied with the service I received at this dealership.  If all their employees are as conscientious as the ones that I dealt with I would not hesitate to recommend this dealer.

text:
I have purchase many vehicle and I must say that this was one of the most pleasant experiences I have encountered buying a vehicle. From the moment I entered the doors I was greeted and treated as a lifelong customer.  After meeting with Mr. Jackson I was introduce to Mr. Curtis Williams who would be my salesman.

Mr. Williams and I sat down to discuss what I was looking for in the vehicle of my my choice.  Once I had selected the vehicle, Mr. Williams made the test drive a pleasant and unique experience.  After I decided that this was the vehicle that i wanted, he even saw to it that the reasonable minor imperfections that I nit-picked while looking over the vehicle were taken care of prior to my picking up the vehicle.  Negotiating the final price was even an enjoyable experience, which is rare.  I think that at the end of the day we were both happy with the price.  At no time during the experience did I feel pressured or uneasy.

I will highly recommend to anyone that is looking to purchase a new or used vehicle, visit Joe Bullock Cadillac and ask for Mr. Curtis Williams.

Willie Johnson

name: Matt Holloway
text: Terrible! I came in because I had a tail light out and it's one of the newer LED lights that aren't supposed to burn out. They told me to come in at 3 and I would be out by 4. At 4 they had just finished their diagnostic check and they told me it would cost $607 to replace my tail light. I told them to go ahead even though I believed it was too pricey. The rep told me the light costs $500+ and the labor wasnt that much. I started to look up the part online brand new and I could buy 2 for less than what he quoted me. I told him they could stop and I'll bring in the light myself after buying it cheaper elsewhere. He tells me I will still have to pay $135 for the diagnostic. No problem. He comes back and tells me it's already in. I ask well where is my car? He says they're finishing up. 45 minutes later he comes back and tells me that they put a new light in and it didnt work. Must be a wiring issue he said. So I said: "So that $135 diagnostic u tried to charge me for wasn't even accurate? Because the diagnostic claimed I needed a new light." He never did answer. They did change my oil so I paid for my oil change only and went to leave. When I got my car back if was filthy even though they claimed all customers get a complimentary wash with all services. I will never go there again.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

Thank you for providing us with this valuable feedback. I assure you this is not the Bullard experience we want for our clients.

I have forwarded your comments to the Service Manager, Sean Alexander, as well as the General Manager so that this can be addressed. I’ve also asked for one of them
to contact you to personally discuss in more detail.

I’m sincerely sorry for how your visit with us needed and I hope that we will be able to earn back your business.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.

name: Julie A
text:
Our family was on vacation in Mobile Alabama this past week. Things didn't go quite as we had planned. Our SUV was cutting out pretty bad on the highway. It was getting worse the closer we got to Mobile. I contacted my friend who's daughter lives in Mobile to see if she might know of a service place. I talked with her daughter and she informed me that her husband, Kyle, worked for Joe Bullard Cadillac. She gave me the number for the service department and said to speak with Haley.  About this time the check engine light came on in our vehicle. It was flashing on and off, then would stay lit.
When I spoke with Haley in the service department she asked about the service engine light. When I told her it had been flashing intermittently she was immediately concerned and said we should get stopped as quickly as we could to avoid internal engine damage.  She then helped us get started with finding a tow service. We were 50 miles aWay and had four people so their usual towing service couldn't do it, but she got the ball rolling for us. She gave me her direct phone number so I could call if I needed anything.
Once we got to the dealership Kyle helped us get a loaner car while ours was being repaired. Haley kept us informed as they learned what was wrong. Our technician, Mike, came in on Saturday to work on our vehicle because we needed to leave to head back to Missouri on Sunday.
To make a long story short...God used all of these people to help us during a difficult time. They made this experience so much less stressful than it could've been. THEY WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND TO HELP US! And, they did it all with a smile. We appreciate the dealership and all the individuals who helped get us back on the road. I would recommend them to anyone who needs service or a new ride!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We always strive to meet the needs of our customers no matter the situation. Feel free to let us know if you have any concerns about your vehicle.

Kind regards,

name: Jami Morgan
text: The people in the service department handling my claim were very nice. What I didn't like was that the mechanics were excessively rough with my vehicle. I had to have it towed and the towing company left it at the gate. Christian got me a loaner car, which I appreciated very much. When I picked up the loaner there were 2 guys who were trying to get it started to get it up to the shop. I needed to grab a couple things out of my car so I stopped to do that. For some reason they needed to open the back hatch. I was traveling with my animals so I had a large kennel in the back. I watched them put my seats down (rather roughly) and sling my kennel from the back to atop the back seats. It made me cringe but at this point I needed to get going as I had some stops to make and  I thought surely they knew what they were doing, this is a Cadillac dealership afterall and these cars cost a lot. They will surely be careful... When I got my car back, instead of them putting the vehicle back they way they found it, the kennel was still strown across the back. (As a plus though, it was washed! Which I appreciated since I had been on the road and try to take care of my car!) When I went to move the kennel back in place I noticed that there are scrapes across the plastic sides in the back. Greeeeaaaaaat. But, at that point I was leaving to head back to my home state and couldn't worry about it. It was more important to get home safe. They told me in addition to the battery that I needed new air filters, a rear wiper blade, and the throttle body cleaned, all easy enough for me to do myself. So, now I am here doing said maintenance and when I popped the hood I immediately noticed that my positive battery terminal clip has been broken and won't stay shut. Great. I am now back home, 3 states away. I will be back to the area, and am considering moving my family there but if they don't make this right I will find a different dealership to maintenance at.

resp.text:
Hi Jami,

Thank you for taking the time to leave your review and detailed feedback. We are closed today; however, I’m sending your comments over to my General Manager and Service Manager to make sure they address this first thing in the morning. Please expect a call from us tomorrow. I’m very sorry for your experience and I hope we have the opportunity to prove to you this is not how do business nor is this how we want our customers to feel when they leave our dealership.

Sincerely,
Kristina M.
Marketing Manager

name: Bill McLarty
text: I am William, answering for my wife Cheryl.  We bought this car new in 2004.  It has been solely serviced and maintained by McConnel/Bullard.  It has less than 30,000 miles on the odometer.  It's been the worst car we've owned since our marriage in 1962.  The problem today was a broken window regulator on the rear driver's side.  My wife has been the sole driver of this car.  We have no children in then home.  My conservative guess is that this window has been lowered and raised no more than 10 times in its aborted lifetime.  My wife was told a plastic roller had broken.  A plastic roller in a $50,000 (2004) Cadillac?!  My bill:  $517.23!  I can go back through my invoices and find similar instances of shoddy work and padded bills.  During the second year we owned the car the driver side dash assembly fell off the dash while my wife was driving.  At around the 4-5 year of ownership your service supervisor convinced my wife that she needed to replace all four tires (around 10,000 miles) because they had "dry-rotted." ($800)  I've owned two Cadillac De Ville's prior to this, and have never experienced what has to be either poor construction, low-quality parts, or untruthful service managers.
