name: barbara cowan
text: Saw a vehicle being advertised on Autotrader website that I was interested in. Before I made my visit to the lot, my mind was set that I would only be going to look at the vehicle. I was not even planning on test driving. But Mustafa Elastal (Moose) was so friendly and laid back, he made me feel very welcomed and comfortable.  All my questions and concerns was addressed with expertise and professionalism. Not once did I ever feel pressured. After a test drive and feeling this the vehicle I wanted, I told him I will be getting back with him. After conversing on and off for about a month with Moose the salesman by phone and having the privilege to speak directly to Ty (the owner of the dealership)  I felt the dealership really wanted my business and cared about my satisfaction.The deal was made by phone. Vehicle was delivered to my home personally by my salesman. All transactions and paperwork done in the comfort of my home. I was very impressed with the way I was treated during my recent buying experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Would definitely recommend family and friends.

name: Austin Tanner
text: Awesome job by the service team as usual.

resp.text:
We appreciate the kind words, Austin. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Best regards,
Robby Herbert, GM, rherbert@joebullard.com (251)-544-7341

name: Jenny Linda
text: Bought a 2009 GMC Yukon used from this dealership. Great service, very friendly and helpful. Scott Howie was very accomodating in trying to make sure I got the truck I was looking for and was very helpful. Mr. Richard Nassar knew I was on my lunch break and worked very quickly to get me in and out and finished with all my paperwork all with a smile on his face. Went to many other dealerships in the search for this used truck and could not be more pleased with my experience here at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Will start here first next time and leave the rest for last resort!!!

name: Jeannette Bennett
text: Worst used vehicle I've ever purchased. This car has cost more in 18 months than my Honda in ten years. Inspection protocol was incomplete before the car was presented for sale. When I tried to find out what had been done I received this asinine answer: if it needed something we did it. Will never purchase a car here again.

resp.text: Jeannette, I am sorry to hear about the recent frustration with your vehicle. Our team is dedicated to providing our customers with a top-notch experience and I’m disappointed to see this wasn’t the case for you. Our GM, Marc Heiter will be reaching out to you shortly regarding this matter. Sincerely, Joe Bullard Cadillac Team

name: Johnny Swopes
text: Absolutely, the most wonderful buying experience my wife Kathy and I have ever had.  The atmosphere was amazing!!  Ty was very gracious and made us feel so welcome as did the entire Bullard family!! Andrew Speight was phenomenal with his delightful British accent describing all of the wonderful details of this truly great Cadillac DTS. His knowledge of the vehicle was paramount!! He knew 'everything' and treated us royally with the test driving and description of the many facets of the vehicle. Andrew kept everything in perspective of the price we could afford. Then he turned us over to Jon McCarthy who was equally as brilliant. Jon made it happen!!! What service!! Jon was so relatable with such tenacity in helping us, and he really came through with making our dream come true!! We highly recommend the family of Joe Bullard Cadillac, and especially Andrew Speight and Jon McCarthy.  They will indeed spoil you! We really thank the Lord for sending us to this Company, thy are a true blessing to the gulf coast!!

name: C C Hall
text: I purchased a Cadillac SRX on 1/11/14 from Joe Bullard Cadillac. Curtis, Roosevelt and Ty were very courteous to me and my husband. They answered all of my questions and worked with us to get to the price we were willing to pay. The Cadillac warranty is hard to beat, especially the 4 years of maintenance and the road side assistance. This is the 6th GM vehicle that we presently own and I know will be the best serviced one by far. I had been looking for a vehicle for 5 months when I decided to look at the SRX. I am glad I did. It has everything on it that I was looking for plus a lot or more features. Everyone at the dealership that walked by you spoke and asked you how you were doing. This is a dream vehicle for me and I look forward to driving it for years. I will recommend to family and friends that are interested in a great luxury car or SUV to get a Cadillac at Joe Bullard Cadillac in Mobile, Alabama and ask for Curtis. I had to use the service department today to get my oil changed and check the routine things out. Christian and the others were very courteous and took care of me and my SRX. The customer lounge area was very pleasant and comfortable during my wait.

name: Greg Loughlin
text: Good workmanship, poor communication.  No warranty info with tires on road hazzard option.

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Loughlin,

Thank you for giving us this valuable feedback. I have sent your comments to our Parts and Service Manager as well as the General Manager for them to consider how we can better improve our communication and process. Please feel free to contact us any time you need assistance and we hope to continue working with you in the future.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.
Marketing Manager

name: Ashley Brown
text:
Superior Service A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

My experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac - Mobile Alabama was excellent to say the least. The moment my fiance and I pulled up to the dealership we felt welcome. Mustafa Elastal immediately greeted us and made us feel important. He went out of his way to make us feel comfortable as he walked around the lot with us picking out suitable vehicles. This was very important to me considering I had never owned a Cadillac before. His extensive knowledge of the vehicle I wanted (XTS) and the history of Cadillac itself impressed me by far. The hospitality didn't stop with Mustafa. Roosevelt Harris also did a fine job answering all the questions I had about the different cars and prices. He also mentioned a couple of nice restaurants we could try out while visiting Atlanta, GA which we did and absolutely loved. Curtis Williams came by and personally greeted us and also had a nice conversation with my fiance. Last, but definitely not least, Jon McCartney was absolutely amazing (and not just because he actually knows where Winnfield, LA is located lol). He worked very hard to get the financing I needed to get the exact vehicle I wanted. It was a hard sale for me, but he showed us that he wouldn't give up. I really appreciated all the time that each of them took out to make our experience the best car buying experience we have had. I would recommend this dealership without thinking twice (I already have mentioned them to others), and I will be bringing others to come do business with Joe Bullard Cadillac in Mobile, AL.

name: Ramona Reed
text: Honestly we did not wake up that morning thinking of buying a car. We saw one on the interstate and decided to go look at them. When we got there it was freezing and windy and Darren Robinson was in the parking lot moving cars. He offered his help and we told him we were in town to Christmas shop not spend all day at a dealership, we just wanted to try the car on for size. he escorted us inside for coffee and cocoa and went to get the car. we test drove it. we loved it but we were not there to spend all day at the dealership. we left our personal information to be reviewed and were going to shop when Darren notified us that we would be using the cadillac for the day via loaner form approval. we really enjoyed using the car. we Christmas shopped all day and when we returned to the dealership we had been approved for the car with our payments within dollars of request. Jon McCartney had to have been the most professional financial manager i have ever encountered. He was a real person who made us feel right at home and comfortable to speak openly. very friendly and personable. then Roosevelt Harris enters the picture. a gem. a diamond in the rough. so charismatic so joyful and helpful and accomodating. I cannot put into words how much Darren helped to familiarize us with the cue and features. he was so knowledgable of the cars systems. he was an absolute treasure. I cant say but one thing about Joe Bullards team, "you are doing something right". I got hugs from everyone when i left. i felt like i was part of a family there. I even got a text message from Darren on Christmas morning wishing us a merry Christmas. i literally spent 2 hrs tops at the dealership and received the most beautiful CHristmas gift I could have ever dreamed of. but the most inportant thing was the environment and kindness that we experienced while there. oh and my son loved the lounge with computers and coffee/cocoa which made his time there enjoyable also. we will definitely reccomend Joe Bullard Cadillac to friends and family and we will definitely be repeat customers ourselves. my only hope is that we have the privilege of having the same staff in years to come. Thank you so very much.

name: Fred King
text:
From the moment I walked in the front door, Andrew, Ben, and Ty did their best to find the perfect car for us. They were more than successful, my wife and I both have never been more satisfied with a major purchase and the reason for this was the genuine effort each member of the team at Joe Bullard put forth to ensure that we left not only as satisified customers, but as new friends.

Andrew stayed with us and walked us through the process and was a very genuine and honest regarding the steps and what was happenning and what was going to happen.

Ben was very diligent and went above and beyond to get the exact car we were looking for... the car is perfect, just what we wanted.

Ty was also great, taking time to sit and talk to us about what was happenning and to ensure us that everything was on track and going well. It was and it did. I do not remember seeing as big a smile as when I told my wife that ya'll had her car ready... Thanks

Richard made the paperwork fly by with ease... the power of a sharpie to show me where to sign... Thanks for making the experience great.

I can not say enough about my outstanding visit and purchase, when you want to go back to the dealership that sold you a car to visit with  the people who were involved in getting you a vehicle because they are now friends, I guess that is how it is always suppossed to work, I am glad that I found the place to go and to send my friends and family to when we need not only a new vehicle, but to meet some outstanding people as well.

Thanks again!

Fred & Diane

name: Andrea La Rossa
text: Wow!  Another great experience with Joe Bullard Automotive!  My Salesman, Damos Brand, was wonderful. He was courteous, professional, and very knowledgeable about the Cadillac product line and that helped make my car buying experience a dream!  Damos delivered my new Cadillac XTS to me and then spent as much time as I needed going over all of the XTS functions and assisted in setting up my XTS to suit me perfectly!!  I love my new Cadillac XTS and once again, I will recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac, Damos Brand, and the New Car Sales Manager, Roosevelt Harris, Jr., to everyone I can.  Both of these men are true assets to Joe Bullard Automotive.

name: Jim Smith
text:
I was impressed from the start with Rich Borden who was the first person I met and provided me an excellent selection of new and used models to make my choice. I had driven a 2002 Cadillac Deville for 10 years, so I was already happy with the Cadillac family and had owned/driven GM (Pontiacs before the Deville)cars since 1966. Because I perferred new over used, and because I had never leased a vehicle, Rich introduced me to Ben Jackson who provided me the pros and cons of the lease vs purchase option. I made my decision on a 3 year lease. I made my choice of the 2013 XTS.
The administrative process was made flawless by the excellent knowledge and professionalism of Ben Jackson and Richard Nassar.
The entire sales staff from Ty Bullard(same as when I bought a new Olsmobile Holiday 88 from his Dad and Granddad Joe Bullard in 1978), Roosevelt Harris(who presented me my Cadillac IPad),and in particular Rich Borden was outstanding.

name: chris edmunds
text: When I tell you that my salesman, Mr.Curtis Williams and my fiancé Officer Mr. Roosevelt Harris did such a out standing job. Can't get any better!

Marketing & PR Manager

I hate buying a car because I’m accustomed to pushy salesmen and I have to admit that I was a bit stoic at first when Troy ( Andrews ) introduced himself but as we worked through the process he was a complete gentleman and a professional and helped me work out a deal that I was happy with with . It really is a different experience at Joe Bullard and I would buy again from these guys .
Dr M

name: Ken Klispie
text: Excellent service! The team at Guthrie's did a thorough inspection of our new/used minivan after it started making various intermittent sounds from a long cross country drive. They were able to pinpoint several issues that were small but would have left us stranded on our next big trip. Quick, very reasonable and communicative through the repairs. We did our next long trip without any issues or noises. We know where we will be taking all of our cars for service, thank you!

resp.text: Thank you, Ken for the review. We appreciate your business. We are happy to help with your automotive needs. Welcome to Alabama!!!

name: Steven Richardson
text: We were traveling through Alabama and my pickup broke down right off the 310 Cullom exit. The tow truck driver recommended Guthrie.  We were nervous not knowing anyone but were pleasantly surprised. We received text updates and a phone call to explain what needed to be done.  They exceeded our expectation completing the job quickly and at a fair price. Highly recommend their auto shop. God Bless.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Steven. We appreciate your kind words. We always try to get people back on the road. I know what it is like to be broken down on the road. Especially if you are on a schedule. Thank you so much for choosing Guthrie's Auto Service.

name: Michael Blair
text: Our car started experiencing some pretty severe issues on our drive home to Tennessee from Florida. We genuinely could not have chosen a better exit to pull over at! We pulled Guthrie's Auto up on our Maps and decided to take our car over there. Despite how busy they were, they were very understanding that we were from out of town and immediately got to work on our vehicle and offered recommendations on places to eat around since we had to wait several hours! Absolutely awesome service!

resp.text: We appreciate your words, and the 5 stars. We strive to give everyone a 5 star experience and help them along their way. Thanks again. Terry Guthrie

name: Victor Cornell
text: I've taken my cars there several times and always got good professional service which was reasonably priced.

resp.text: Thank you Victor, we appreciate your business. Terry

name: teresa cobbs
text: Great people. Keep you updated on progress and prices. Very trustworthy.

resp.text: Thank you Teresa, we appreciate your business and kind words. Terry

name: Barbara
text:
A Great Place/Great People... Our truck broke down & Triple A couldn’t have found a better place to take it to! They took us to our hotel & picked us back up....The owner went above & beyond to get our truck fixed so we could be back on the road this morning! Truck is running great again! Thank You So much for not only getting our truck fixed but for your kind & thoughtfulness.
Rick, Barbara & LACI

resp.text: It was a pleasure to meet you two. I was happy to help you all with your F-250 diesel. Glad you were able to get back on the road any get out of the flooding that we had that day. We were safe but got a lot of rain that day. Thanks again for letting us to serve you.

name: Janice McGahey
text: They got my car fixed in no time flat. The cost was super reasonable. And it’s been several weeks everything is running perfectly. I would highly recommend Terry and his crew!!

resp.text: Janice, thank you for your review! We're glad we could provide a quality auto repair service for you and we'll see you soon!

name: La Donna Griffin
text: I received very good service, both times I brought my car to Guthrie's.  Very nice employees., and patient with the questions I ask.  I'll be back.  I've recommended Guthrie's to a few people.

resp.text: Thank you La Donna for the 4 stars. We hoped to give you a 5 star experience when we serviced your Kia. Maybe next time. We do appreciate you trusting us with your vehicle. Terry Guthrie

name: Page Sparks
text: A couple years ago my car was really in a bad way, and took it to the dealership. They were going to charge me $1500 for my repair. I despaired and reached out to friends and family for recommendations. A good friend recommended Guthrie's, said they always did good work. So I called them up. For the same repair they were going to have to charge close to $900. It was better but still hurt. Took my car up and waited. Got a call from Mike and he said that he wanted to check over the car before I spent all that money. He discovered what the dealership didn't, that something was just unplugged. Only charged the diagnostic fee! He could have charged me fully, but he and this business have been ethical. I take my car to them anytime I have issues, and they've been precise and sure every time. Would highly recommend for anyone who's been burned by bad mechanics.

resp.text: Page, thank you for your review. We were happy to have been able to help you out with your vehicle and to save you money. We appreciate having you as a customer and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Hustle Hard Fitness
text: Very caring and reliable crew Terry and them have always took care of our car needs and always does a fantastic job! Great prices and they get it done it a timely manner

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review! We'll continue to provide a caring and reliable atmosphere for your auto repair needs and we look forward to helping you in the future!

name: Felicia Wright
text: Took my vehicle to have my AC looked at. They were very friendly and knowledgeable. Seemed to want to help me more than just make a dollar. They have a text system set up that notifies you when your vehicle is being worked on. The owner follows up with you a day or so after you pick up your vehicle to be sure everything is going well. Very personable business.

resp.text: Felicia, thank you for your review! We're happy to have looked at your A/C and we'll continue to be friendly and knowledgeable.

name: John Thomas
text: Broke down while traveling. They was very helpful and willing to get our truck repaired at very reasonable rates. I highly recommend Guthrie's Auto Service.

resp.text: John, thank you for your review, we hope you had safe traveling after visiting our auto repair shop, and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!

name: Bettie Burnett
text: Had car towed to Guthrie's for repair on coolant system. Had been told by two regular customers that they do really good work. The office attendant (Mike, I think was his name), was straight-forward, respectful, patient, gave me a phone quote, had the work done timely, with the final bill ending up being a little less than the original quote, even after adding the tow bill & taxes. It was a very welcomed change from the experience I'd had at another local shop I'd been referred to (but later warned about from several other past customers) where I repeatedly had to endure rudeness from the know-it-all mechanic, immediate breakdowns from same issue I'd just paid to have repaired, & ignored voicemails asking to speak to the owner. Guthrie's owner followed-up the very next day to make sure everything was going well with the work on my car. I would much rather pay for a job well done the first time than a little less and keep breaking down, having my car towed, finding another way to work at the last minute to keep my job, and then constantly being talked down to in person & over the phone (while the owner justifies it as him "being from New York",... to which I reminded them both that he's now n ALABAMA, & that cocky attitude won't do here, especially with me!!... 3 different types of repairs... never fixed after being told they were!). So, yes, I am very happy to give Guthrie's a positive review, THANK YOU!

resp.text: Bettie, thank you for your review. We were happy to help out with your coolant system repair and we are glad to be respectful, honest, and patient for all of our customers. We are sorry you had a bad experience at a different shop, but thank you for trusting us to get the job done. See you later!

name: Randy Anderson
text: Took my '08 Tundra in for some pretty major repairs (stuck secondary air intake valve, timing belt replacement, pulley repair). I’m beyond pleased with the quality of the work, the affordable price, and the speed of service you guys gave me. I’m new to the area, and will be coming back to you guys for any vehicle work that I need, and I’ll make sure to tell everyone else I meet about you as well! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Randy! We're glad we could help you out with your '08 Tundra repairs, and we'll continue to offer quality and affordable auto repair services, and we are excited to have you as our customer. See you next time!

name: hotrodford 88
text: Great people to deal with.

name: Jeffrey Stevens
text: They were AAA approved brought truck in for water pump replacement they repaired it in a timely manner and did a over all inspection people were very friendly

resp.text: Jeffrey, thank you for your leaving us a review. We're glad to have helped you out and let us know if there anything we can do for you!

name: Cheryl Masterson
text: I was traveling thru Cullman car wouldn't start.  They repaired it same day. What a blessing, excellent service.

resp.text: Cheryl, we're so glad we could help you out while you were traveling through Cullman. Thank you for trusting us with your auto repair needs!

name: Mark Maddox
text: My truck needed help. I planned on it being in the shop for 7 to 10 days. I dropped it off on a Monday afternoon, and received a call on Friday afternoon that it was ready. Never did I think anyone could repair or replace as many things as Guthrie's did in such a short time. I left Guthrie's and drove to Gulf Shores. The true test, interstate highway's in Alabama. They did a great job. No vibration, shaking, or leaking. Awesome job guys. Thanks.

resp.text: Mark, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Here at Guthrie's Auto Service, we understand how important your vehicle is to you. That is why we always strive to provide quality care in a timely manner. It was a pleasure to work on your truck and we're thrilled to hear that your drive to Gulf Shores was smooth. We look forward to your next visit!

name: Jason Bookout
text: We were from out of town and our car broke down late on a Friday afternoon. Terry the owner fixed our busted coolant hose and had us back on the road in less than 2 hours for a fair price. He did not take advantage of a situation where we had no other choice.  I have later heard from other friends in the area that Terry does great work. Would highly recommend if you are in the area.

resp.text: Jason, we appreciate your kind review and were happy to assist with your coolant hose. We understand how frustrating it can be to deal with vehicle issues when you are out of town, so we were glad we could fix it quickly so you can be on your way. Thank you and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you in the future!

name: tanya roberson
text: Very courteous, professional, high quality service! They solved our overheating issue and fixed it Fast! Highly recommend!! Best auto service in Cullman!!

resp.text: Tanya, thank you for your review! We're excited to continue to be courteous, professional, and provide high quality service! Looking forward to seeing you next time!

name: Xochitl Robinson
text: Terry was very helpful and pleasant.I went there to have an stimate on a problem that I have in my SUV. The place is very clean.prices are reasonable. Thanks Terry.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We appreciate your support of our auto repair shop!

name: Justin Nichols
text: Needed help tracking a power draw draining my battery, they found it and got everything sorted very quickly. I was very pleased with the service and I will absolutely use them for future repairs.

resp.text: Justin, thank you for your review! We're glad we could be here to help with your battery, and we'll look forward to seeing you next time in our auto repair shop!

name: Douglas Ballenger
text:
I was really surprised by the service and friendliness of Guthries auto service, after I spent 2 weeks working on my vehicle with no luck finding the problem I decided to find a shop to work on it. A friend of mine recommended Guthries. Some of problems I was having with my vehicle was, lost power to all of my windows, lost power to my rear view mirror and backup camera, blown bulb in taillights, short causing battery to drain, could not turn ignition switch All the way off so I couldn’t get key out 🤔😂 but the power door lock still worked!!
But don’t lock them if you have something draining your battery ! 🙃 Seriously Guthries will be my go to from now on ! Very friendly service, very knowledgeable and very fair service pricing!! I’m not going to say what my vehicle problem was ask Mike when you take your vehicle 🚗 in.

To all at Guthries auto service,

Thank you 🙏

resp.text: Douglas, we appreciate your kind review. We were more than happy to help you out of a tricky situation with your vehicle, and we'll continue to be friendly, knowledgeable, and fair-priced for your future visits. Thank you and we'll see you again!

text: I've used this shop for a number of repairs on my older vehicle now. Their prices are fair, the staff are all friendly and knowledgeable, and they are very expedient! They also send valuable customer loyalty coupons!

resp.text: Emily, we are glad to have you as a customer in our shop. We will continue to offer fair prices, friendly and quality service, and timely. We look forward to your next visit to our shop!

I have no idea what this kind of work is worth with parts and labor but having peace of mind is worth it all.

My car was ready before they got there. (A/C leak). Two days later I get a text from the manager following up to make sure I was satisfied and to make sure the A/C was working properly. That alone will have me going back when I need service again.

resp.text: Chris, we are glad that you had such a positive experience at our shop for your A/C leak. We do our best to be quick and thorough for our customers because you guys are our priority. Thank you for your review and we're happy that we have gained a new customer!

text: Really had a bad experience with these guys. For Julio to have such a great name in our area to have bad management working for him really took me by surprise. Everyone, at every encounter, went above and beyond to make my experience as pleasant as possible; they were honest, upfront and exhibited complete trustworthiness, which was very refreshing to experience. Thank you all and keep up the great customer care! It really makes all the difference.

name: Tabitha Payne
text:
I met Matthew Moss while looking at the Mazda 6’s. He introduced himself and asked some questions about my needs in a car. He pointed out the safety features, the roominess of the car, the amazing gas mileage and other features found in the Mazda 6.
Matthew introduced me to Rick Cantrell. They were both extremely knowledgeable and in no way were “pushy” or made me feel the importance of buying a car that day. I felt a sense of trust in talking with both of them.
I went home did my research and emailed Rick to send me a final cost breakdown. I was extremely happy with it and told him that I’d be there after work to pick it up.
When I arrived, it had been cleaned and the gas tank was full! I drove off in the first new car that I’d purchased in over 20 years. I absolutely love my new car and would recommend Matthew and Rick to anyone who asks me about my car.

name: JauWana Dansby
text: Thanks for your help and hardwork. Desmond Windham... I will be tell more people about you guys.

resp.text: Our reputation is one of our top priorities. Your positive review is what we are always striving for!

name: Christopher (Chris) Gill
text:
If I had just dealt with the service department it would be a five star rating. The young lady that helped me with my service was friendly, professional, and was on top of the process the whole way!

They lose a star because the parts department left a lot to be desired. It was next to impossible to get them on the phone and after a while the system sends you to a voicemail that no one apparently ever checks. I left 8 or 9 messages and never got a call back. My part had been there for three days before I found out from someone in service (when I called) that it had arrived. They either need more people in parts to handle the load or better training.

resp.text: Hi Christopher, thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are happy that you enjoyed your experience with us - but do want to apologize for the negative experience you had with our Parts department. This is not acceptable and it will be looked into and addressed immediately. We appreciate your business and hope to work with you again soon. Take care.

text: I was driving through Tuscaloosa on the way home, and the knocking sound in my car was driving me crazy. They saw me immediately, found the problem within minutes (loose lug nuts), explained what must have happened, where it was, and fixed it + washed my car as part of their complimentary services. Lol got a tour of the place while I was waiting, too. Never been treated that nicely at a Mazda dealership in the 5 years I’ve been going to them in three different states.

text: I arrived early for my appointment and they took my car right in. The waiting room was clean and pleasant. The service manager was helpful and attentive. He asked me what services I wanted for my car in addition to the airbag recall repair. A friendly, young salesman sat to chat with me for a few minutes as I waited. Jared asked about my Mazda and my experience with the dealership. He was genuinely interested and enthusiastic about working for Julio Jones Mazda. I learned that Tuesday’s are “Ladies Day” which meant 15% off oil changes AND free massages by a therapist from Nancy Taylor Day Spa!!! I have NEVER had such a pleasant car service experience. My car had the airbag repair, an oil change, tire rotation, 17 point inspection, and the headlight “glaucoma” polished in just over an hour. When this dealership was owned by Verta Barr, it had the reputation as the best service department in town. I think that under Julio Jones’ ownership, it will regain that reputation.

name: Dylan Davies
text:
What can I say? My husband and I went to look at the Mazda CX-5. We found one online, previously, and wanted to drive one before we drove all that way to Birmingham to see it. They made us a proposal, "If we  can cut you a deal on a new one, can we have your business?" Well, of course if the price is right then, yes. We drive a grey CX-5, everything is great, but they are calling this car "new" and it has 7500 miles on it. Well, it's never been owned they say its a "demo" car. Then my husband tells them he wants to be at $19,999 financed for this car (yes, we were putting several thousand down - we didn't expect a miracle deal). They only get it down to $20,010. Then he says, well if you throw in remote start, we will take it. They came back with each of us paying half so, we decided to buy the car.

They told us that they could get us a killer interest rate of less than one percent. When we got back to financing, it was another story entirely. We ended up wit ha 4.99 interest rate because "less than one percent is only for "new" cars" well when you were trying to negotiate this deal you said it was a new car and now that we are financing you've classified it as a "used" car.

After we left, we began driving to my dad's house which is probably 100 miles away. The check engine light came on before we got there. We had O'Reily's check the computer and they said it was low oil pressure. We called and they has us call the Mazda tow truck to come pick it up and take it to the nearest Mazda which was in Birmingham. (They told me to get a rental during this time and they would pay me back.) They called for me to come pick it up three or four days later saying it was a computer problem and it was fixed. When we got there, 4 error messages were popping up on the dash. We left the car and called the sales manager at Julio Jones Mazda who never called us back and said he never got our message.

I went in to talk to the Julio Jones Mazda sales manager about this problem on Monday. They had me sit there for a while and eventually said they spoke with the technician at the Birmingham Mazda and they said I must have taken my foot off the brake too early and it caused the car to throw up those error messages. So, they blamed me for the problem.

Later, the technician from Birmingham called us personally and said they had screwed up and not fixed it properly to begin with. So, the sales manager at Julio Jones Mazda was either misinformed or blatantly lied to make me think it was my fault.

Well, we finally got the car back and it has been running fine. No more issues. However, they still haven't paid me back for the rental and it's been almost a month. I called about this and they said they lost my receipt and asked me for the amount again. I still haven't been paid and they haven't bothered to call me back. That was a week ago.

Simultaneously, I took the car in to the Julio Jones service center to get the remote start put in on a Thursday. They told me it would take a day, maybe two, to get this done. The service center is telling me that I owe our half of the remote start that was supposed to be included in the deal. Obviously, they didn't include it in the price like they said they would. Also, they had to give me a rental car because they couldn't get the remote start to work. It's now Monday and I have no clue when I am going to get my car back. I called today and they said they still couldn't get the remote start to work.

Needless to say, I don't wish this headache on anyone and I wouldn't recommend this dealership to anyone. It has been an absolute nightmare since we signed for this vehicle.

resp.text: Hi Dylan, thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize for your experience, as we strive to provide all of our guests with 5 star service. We understand that our management team has worked with you on this matter and has provided you with a reimbursement check for your rental charges. If there is anything further that we may do to assist you, or if there is any further feedback that you would like to provide, please feel free to email us at WeCare@BuyFromJulio.com. Thank you

name: Alyssa Oliver
text:
Called up there to schedule a drop off. Because they had good reviews. Not the friendliest person who answered the phone. That's fine but when I told him what was going on he said we dont do transmission work. My problem is it says they do on their website. Rude and waste of time. Going to add to the post I was discriminated against I guess because I'm a woman. my husband called the place and said exactly what I said the problem
Was and they told him yes they do that there.

resp.text: Hello Mrs. Oliver. We do not rebuild transmissions, but we do remove and replace transmissions with either used transmissions or remanufactured transmissions. A gentleman called yesterday and obtained a price to replace the torque convertor. I am not sure if this was your husband or not, but we can replace a torque convertor because it is physically attached to the transmission and is not an internal part. I believe there may have been some miscommunication as to what was required to repair the vehicle/transmission. Alabaster Automotive, LLC prides itself in servicing EVERYONE in the community and we do not discriminate against anyone based on sex, ethnicity, religion, etc. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to me with a phone call. Thank you.

text: They get on the ball with fixing your vehicle no matter what the problem is and faster than most anywhere around believe it or not. But if you choose to sit and wait they dont seem to mind if you charge your phone while you wait! I will recommend everyone that I know to get their vehicle fixed HERE! I personally showed you that your wiring harness had been severed by the oversize wheels that where put on your car. Please feel free to reach out with any questions you may have. Thank you.

text: I will never take my truck anywhere else from now on!  I took my truck to them a couple of weeks ago and they were honest/fair priced and fixed it within a few hours!  Wayne and John were amazing, as were the rest of the techs.  They were a blessing in my life that I so much needed and they made me laugh!  I am recommending them to all of my friends no matter where they live in Alabama. Thank you for the little blessings Alabaster Auto!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing about your experience, Lisa! We're glad you like our awesome staff as much as we do, and that you were happy with our pricing and speed! We really appreciate the recommendation and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Nancy McCay
text:
Fantastic service !
Honest and fast.

name: Andrae Antwoine
text: They explain, very professional, but not accountable for any mistakes.  I have 4 kids and wife, the expense was necessary..they had to replace spark plugs, explained that if removed, Its a possibility some will break off...well 1 got stuck in the engine.....it requires taking everything out and restructure how it was before...with no mistakes...so it took 2-3 weeks to get it done...after 3100$ mechanic informed us #1 he drove the car 65 miles testing the truck..no gas reimbursement (not considering our financial needs)....#2.that our sensor light was not working, (but we never had an issue with it),they didn't charge us for replacing it, but now it  ironically reads an alternator light.  #3 The mechanic simply said, i don't know why it came on, but it needs to be replaced. Although, your safe to drive it home.   #4. 2 weeks later, a great amount of smoke begins to shoot out exhaust...that very day, I took it to another auto place to get it assessed. (my red flags were to much).The other repair shop did not go into detail, but towed it back to alabaster, free of charge told them the issue and Alabaster Auto's  said "we'll give them a call".  #5 2 days later, I called them...ask "what is the problem?" they replied: The fluid injectors ironically messed up within 2 weeks, causing oil to spill onto the motor, "washing it out"...not only did they tell me an alternator was needed, but now I have to buy a new motor. Their excuse was....this is all a coincidences. they don't know why these thing are happening to my ford expedition that is under 120,000 miles. I called the other auto store to come and get it...I'll pay them what is necessary, but I am not spending another dime at alabaster Auto's.  We are taking legal action against them immediately after proof of fault. I can't except "it's all a coincidence".

resp.text: Andrae, one of our goals is to be honest and forthright with our customers. Also, we make every effort to ensure our customers are satisfied.  We deeply regret not being able to do so in your situation.

name: Tim Brewer (jugglertim)
text: Older shop, but they have always been good to me. Very reasonable prices and honest people.

text: I really like Alabaster Auto. They always do good work and have great prices! Mr. Ricky is a very friendly guy. I think they really care about their customers and have been in Alabaster since I moved here when I was about 8 yrs old, 30+ years later and they are still packed with business every day. That should speak volumes in of itself.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write this nice review! We're glad you like our work, prices, and that you can see how much Ricky and the team care about our customers like you. Thanks again and see you next time!

text: Been using these guys for the 2 years I lived in Alabaster.  Mechanics John and Randall are great, they will talk to you, make suggestions and both tell and show you what they are doing.  Only issue was when I took my vehicle to them right before Christmas and it was 3 days to even look at the car.  I didn't have the time so I took it to another Alabaster repair shop..................................MAJOR MISTAKE!!!  Keep up the great work Wayne and Ricky and all involved at Alabaster Auto! Thanks. Ben

resp.text: You're welcome, Ben. Thank you for your review and continued business with us!

name: Dayon Lane
text:
Do NOT aide this place. My CRV had to go in to have the fan assembly replaced. Upon getting it back I saw that my A/C no longer blew cold and my automatic window function no longer worked. Then, when taking it in to be looked at, I found that they BROKE what holds to coolant reservoir and just had it sitting, and it was empty. They had lost two of the caps on the front, AND they didn’t attach the grill back correctly.

I called them and they said to bring it in Saturday. I head that way and call them to tell them I’m on the way. And they inform me not to come Bc they are not able to do it Saturday and to come Monday. Isn’t an option for me. I paid $532 for them to essentially break my car. WILL never go back.

name: Andrew Hicks
text: GREAT staff! Very friendly and professional. The level of service on my car was too notch. We won't go anywhere else again.

resp.text: Thank you for all of the great feedback, Andrew!

name: Mark Wright
text: Had alternator and pulley replaced in June this year here.  Recently car wasnt  starting had to jump off took car to 2 places to check battery and alternator checked (free)was told it was alternator so took in here and they checked said it was the battery which I have no problem with but when I got there it was 42 dollar. Guess I should have asked first just assumed the shop that did the work would have done it free too.  Lesson learned I guess.

text:
We recently had one of our cars worked on here and the service was fantastic.  My son and his family have their cars worked on here as well.
If you need a good honest repair service this is the place.

text: Can't even change brakes and rotors correctly. I brought it in several times after they changed them with a noise and they couldn't find it and blamed it on something else. Finally got tired of it and took it to another mechanic and they left bolts out of my caliper and I've had 2 brakes lock up since they did the work.

text: We stopped here on our way to Gulf Shores, after having some minor issues with our breaks which turned out to be nothing other than the adjusting of the new pads I has installed a few days before. They were Saturday but got us in quickly within a few mins. The mechanic and the older gentleman in the office were very friendly and courteous. The gentleman sent us on our way to enjoy our vacation and didn't charge us. If you're having car trouble in this area this is your place. They are Great folks!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! Our main concern has always been the safety and satisfaction of our customers. We’re glad to hear we have delivered that. Thanks again, Justin!

text: The store manager Ricky Tidmore lied to my family and took over $12,000 dollars all the while blaming me on how the car was driven. Sold us a transmission when the motor and transmission needed to be replaced. DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

name: Warren D. Sweeney
text: My last review wasn't what I intended. I just figured how to change it. They really do have a five star rating with me.

resp.text: If there is anything we can do to earn the 5th star warren please let us know.

name: kevin armstrong
text: I came here to have a plug put in my trailer tire. I waited and was told to back my truck around. When i started backing in someone else whips in and i was forced to stop. He comes up to my window and tells me to wait just a minute and let him take care of this customer. I waited another 10-15 minutes. He finally plugs my tire, i pay and leave. I drive 1/2 Mile home. Get up the next morning and the tire is low again. I drive back down there and tell them something was wrong. There was one person in the lobby and he tells me the wait would be at least one hour to put air in my tire. I had to unload several things from my trailer to get to tools needed for me to put air in it myself. I did this in there parking lot as they say inside and watched me. They won't make there wrongs right. Expert tire is right across the street.

resp.text: Kevin, when we reached out it sounded like you had no issues with your experiences at our shop after we offered to assist in any way we could. If there are any further concerns, please reach out to us as we would like to clear up any misunderstandings. Thank you.

name: Chase Miller
text:
First time customer, came in off recommendation from a friend.

Staff friendly, clean waiting room, good location, fair advertised prices.

3 stars due to being told over phone an oil change would be 20-30 mins wait, showed up 20 mins after the call and I sat in the waiting area over 1-1/2 hrs (I waited because I understand business, and things do happen) without anyone informing me of any delays. I left without recieving any service.

Don't set expectations and then not fulfill them without an explanation, before money walks out the door.

resp.text: Chase, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and for the feedback on your visit. We apologize if any part of your experience was less than satisfactory and we hope to have the opportunity in the future to work with you. If there is anything else that we are able to help with please feel free to give us a call.

text: We've used this place a handful of times and it seems reasonably priced and they get the work done in a timely manner. We had some major electrical work that needed to be done, car wouldn't start and show any signs of life from a brand new battery, they repaired it and was ready to go in under 2 days

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review and your business.  We look forward to helping you in the future.

name: Ben Turner
text:
Been using these guys for about a year since moving to Alabaster. Their hourly rate is the cheapest I have found anywhere and they always take care of my problems on both my cars. Oil changes are only about $22 and that includes a tire rotation and they don't try to upsell you on a bunch of crap you don't need like alot of other places in the area who offer cheap oil changes and then make it up with additional "needs fixing items".

The mechanics and the 2 gentlemen at the front desk are always helpful, and courteous even though they are always busy and I can't thank them enough.

I don't believe for a second these 2 reviews that say they did such a poor job and accept that some people are never happy unless they can drag everyone else into the misery pit where they reside.

Thanks Alabaster Auto and I will continue to use you and recommend you to my friends as long as I am in this area.

Ben

resp.text: Ben, thank you so much for the comments you left concerning our service! We appreciate your business and will continue to strive to meet your expectations! See you next time!

name: Juan Puente
text: Mike did excellent on my Lexus. He ran diagnostics on my car first to make sure it really needed a complete transmission first and not just a set of solenoids or something else. I already had a good used transmission. But he serviced it to make sure everything worked and performed perfectly before he installed it. Flushed my system to get rid of all the old metal shavings from the old transmission. Needless to say he went above and beyond and for a extremely fair price. He definitely gave me a great deal!!! This is exactly why I used him before when my Honda transmission needed rebuilt.  Thank you again Mike and guys for another excellent job well done! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to send us a review and we appreciate for your business,  Again, with over 30 years of services, customer satisfaction is always our goal.

text: Very professional and efficient service,. I was hesitant at first but Mike and his staff made it a pleasure to use for my car service.

resp.text: Thank you for your business

name: emily miller
text: We were on vacation 4.5 hours from home when our transmission gave us trouble. Transmission King was available to take our truck that afternoon. The price we were quoted was the price we paid. Work prevented us from picking it up promptly, but they were kind enough to work with us. We're having our first baby this month and I'm so grateful to have the issue taken care of! Truck drives like a dream, shifts as smooth as butter! So glad to have the truck home!

name: Kiara Gamboa
text: Mike is SUCH AN ANGEL! I’m only 21 and this was first experience dealing with car troubles on my own and he treated me like his daughter and gave me everything I need to know.  Very professional, kind and you know he’s not taking advantage of you! Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Customer satisfaction is always goal.

name: Victoria Barfield
text: I took my 2008 Nissian Maxima here with a transmission leak, they found the leak, and fixed it quickly! When I first left my car there, I spoke with Eric and told him all the issues I was having with my car. I had a check engine light on, for my catalytic converter, they were kind enough to take it off and clean it for me, FREE OF CHARGE. Definitely will be going here for any other issues! They were so kind!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Again, with over 30 years of services, customer satisfaction is always our goal.

name: David Campbell
text: Brought my vehicle in to shop the owner Mike Ho was who I was dealing with he said that I can check your transmission out for free. He had the vehicle for almost a week no call and after I called him he said we’ll get to it tomorrow three days pass by and then he called saying that he has to go a little deeper and and go inside the transmission for $250 then I said ok after that a few more days past he told me it would be $1400 to get it fix and he said jus bring me a few dollars each week and it’ll be ok. I went to go pick up the vehicle and give him a down payment and he said no we deal with a financing company apply for a loan .

name: Courtney Seals
text: I called Transmission King and spoke with a guy named Mike after I explained my problem he advised me to bring it in on Monday morning and he would diagnose it for no charge. I brought it in promptly Monday as advised after I dropped it off a guy named Lee explained to me what they were going to check out and give me a call. 3 days passed and still no call so I stopped by and I was asked by a mechanic what do you want and why was I there if I haven’t received a call from them (rude as possible). I explained to him that I was concerned about my transmission and he stated that he test drove it and it has lost reverse so he has to get it up on the rack and then he will call me when they figure it out. Day 4 mike calls and ask how do you start your truck I told him I usually start it with the key. He said that he needs me to come get it started so I went up there and waited for over an hour for Mike to show up. Finally he shows up and he tells me to get it started and he doesn’t know anything about motors he is a transmission specialist. Mike diagnosed the problem as a bad starter I had to wait for a mechanic to take off the starter. While I’m searching for a starter Mike calls and tells me that they are leaving  for the day and they need me to lock up my truck and put the starter on so he can get it fixed. So I finally make it back with the new starter and I had to pay  a mechanic to come meet me at the truck and install it only to find out my bolts are missing. Therefore, I call Mike he doesn’t answer my calls. As a result,  I had to call a tow truck company Friday morning so I wouldn’t have to deal with an unprofessional transmission company.   John and his team of real mechanics from Southern Transmission diagnosed the issue when it rolled off the tow truck which was loose battery cable and truck started running immediately. Thank you for wasting my time and money Transmission Clowns!

text: Excellent service!  Everyone was very communicative and friendly. Eddie is knowledgeable, fair and honest guy.  That's hard to find in a good mechanic. His dog Trouble is pretty awesome too!  I would definitely recommend for all repair needs!

name: Alan Manley
text:
Eddie is the best in the business when it comes to car repairs. I've been going to Eddies for about a decade with any car issues I have. When you know as little about cars ad I do, honesty is the biggest factor when choosing a mechanic, and Eddie fits the bill. The last time I took my car in (transmission issues), Eddie quoted me $1300 for the repair but encouraged me to call around just so that I was comfortable with moving forward. I called 4 different transmission repair shops, and every single quote I got was >$2,000. That really showed a couple things:

1. How efficient he is by being able to save you money due to his vast knowledge of the intricacies of car repairs.

2. He's not looking to jack your price up to make a profit on this one repair. He knows that if he's giving you a good deal, you'll continue to come back and he'll make his money by repeat business instead of what others do by overpricing you and trying to make it all on one repair.

text: Very nice very professional and does great work. I’ve used him for years never had a bad experience using them.

text: Eddie  did a great job.  Warrenteed  an a/c compressor.   Timely service. Thank you.

text: We love Eddie's and Eddie. He is very reliable and knowledgeable concerning vehicles. I do not trust anyone else with my vehicle.

name: A C
text:
Gave a good price for a difficult job due to replace all the wheel bearings.  Attempted to remove the rear driver side myself having experience on this quick task but couldn't on my own due to it being rusted in place. Eddie stated he had to remove the entire wheel hub for each wheel and place them on a hydraulic press to get the bearings out.   Problem occurred when he didn't properly secure the front passenger lower balljoint causing it to come out while driving less than 15 miles later.  He attempted to correct the damage but the CV axel he replaced due to his error only lasted 1 month.  When called about this issue He hung up shortly after hearing it, while I was talking.  Took it to another mechanic who also identified the other front ball joint was welded in place!
Lastly, I left a review that was removed about a month later.

resp.text: Difficult due to this persone spent a weekend in his back yard beating the bearings out with his buddies untill it rendered the vehicle damaged and had to be weckered on a flat bed with battered and broken wheels. repaired the car for agreeed price. name: phyllis seday
text:
My dashboard lit up with indicators,  googled garages near Prattville,  Al.; Eddie's was 3rd on the list, 4.3 mi from my US 65  location,  so i called and he said come on by.
At 3:30pm on a Friday,  Eddie jumped into action diagnosing, assessing,  pulled my car into the stall and his team went to work:  rear brakes, reset indicators,  oil change, tire rotation and road trip inspection.  (Oil change and tire rotation were my request)
I was given a print  out of the diagnostic
for a point of reference. Eddie also educated me on the indicators, red-seek assistance, yellow maintain course investigating upon arrival.
WOW, ~1 hr. And reasonably affordable.
PLUS, you get some ' Trouble loving'. Trouble is such a sweetie and entertaining .
I made it to my destination of Pensacola without anymore concerns.
As a traveling single woman, I was grateful for the direction and honesty.

There has been several times when I left thinking that they could have ripped us off, but they didn't. Knowing they are trustworthy gives me more confidence in their work, and the work has always been great. Nice people too! I don't usually write reviews but felt that these guys deserve it!

name: jennab5704
text: Eddie's is a great place to deal with!  They are fair and honest, good folks.  They stand behind their work and will always try to make the customer happy.  If Eddie's can't fix it, it either ain't broke or it can't be fixed.

name: Teresa Keil
text:
Six years ago, for our oldest son's 16th Birthday, we bought a 1997 Pontiac Grand Prix  with close to 200,000 miles on it. We took the car to Eddie to check it for any major problems prior to the purchase and explained that the seller wanted to keep the custom rims and tires on the car, and did not have the originals to place back on the vehicle. Knowing we did not have a lot of extra money to spend after the purchase, Eddie recommended that we take a look at Pull-A-Part for replacement wheels. We actually found 4 inexpensive wheels & tires, so Eddie sent a member of his staff to pull-a-part in the hottest part of the summer to remove the wheels and tires for us. After mounting the wheels, Eddie noted that one of the tires to be dry rotted, so he replaced it with a better used tire free of charge. After the wheel problem was settled, Eddie did a diagnostic evaluation and a good once over to check the car for any major defects. Upon completion, he made a list of identified problems and potential problems that could lead to costly repairs. He made sure the identified problems were taken care of immediately and gave us the potential  problem list, so we could save for these replacements.  Eddie gave us peace of mind by being honest and did not break us by hitting us with costly repairs or replacements all at once. My son drove that car another 2-3 year, before he was hit by another vehicle and the Grand Prix was totaled.
My daughter drives a 1998 Oldsmobile Intrigue and is a student at Auburn. After being stranded with car problems a couple of times, Eddie has her come by his shop when she is home and checks her vehicle free of charge for potential problems and to again give us peace of mind. He knows her safety on the road between here and Auburn means more to us than anything. Thanks Eddie & Kim for treating our family as your own.

name: alan agin
text: Very good

name: Randy Householder
text: I have been dealing with Eddie for over a year now and could not be happier.  He gives fair prices and the quality of work is top notch.  He has worked on my daughter's Mazda 3, had it done on time and the price was exactly what he quoted.  Every car in my family will be taken to Eddie's when there is a problem, I like dealing with a man I can trust!

name: Stevie Holloway, Sr.
text: I've used Eddie’s LLC several times over the last few years and I’m delighted to give his establishment the highest praises.  Eddie is a fair businessman who does his level best to give his customers quality service.  Eddie’s gives a fair and honest estimate with no hidden costs and will always call you if repairs will exceed estimates.  His work is done correctly the first time, on time, every time.  Visit Eddie’s…you won’t be sorry!

name: Sharon Chance
text: My husband and I have trusted Eddie with our vehicles for over 10 years, he is the most straight forward honest mechanic that we have ever encountered. Recently I had a most serious problem in my car, my whole steering mechanism went out in my car and the warranty went out2000 miles ago. Eddie said for him to fix it would be a fair but costly price for us, but he also guided us to go to the maker of our vehicle and talk to the service manager. The maker of our vehicle said we would be more than happy to take care of this matter for you at no cost to you because not only did Eddie guide us on what to do he also gave us paperwork to back the situation up. Now I ask all of you who has ever encountered such an honest mechanic? He could have simply said sure I can fix it and took our money, but that's not how Eddie works, I'm telling everyone if you want someone honest and fair for your mechanical needs please call Eddie they don't get any better than him. Thanks Eddie for always being there, Mike and Sharon Chance

name: Dustin Melton
text:
Edit, 9/26/2014: in the week since posting this review, Eddie Cobern and his wife have made harassing phone calls to my wife, posted false and defamatory information about my finances to social media, made false reports to both Facebook and Google, leveled outright threats against my property and person in public forums, and have embarked on a letter-writing smear-campaign with their customers.

Screencaps of these exchanges can be provided upon request.

###Original post below###
Heard that this was one of the better auto restoration places in town. Don't believe it. Made a deal with Eddie to restore our 1974 Super Beetle from good, running condition to showroom quality. Repairs were to include engine rebuild and brakes/electrical/suspension overhaul, as well as complete interior revamp. We agreed to a ballpark price with the understanding that it could climb, and agreed that time was not an issue, since we were moving to another State anyway.

Eddie promised regular status updates and talked a nice game of providing pictures of every stage of the rebuild. What really happened is that we received zero updates, regular requests for money, and bad attitude. After stringing us out for several months, we were told that Eddie was no longer interested in performing the rebuild, and that the vehicle needed to be towed elsewhere within one week -- towed, because it had been torn apart, in running condition, then slapped back together such that it no longer cranks.

So, we had to find a flatbed that could haul what now amounts to scrap metal across State lines, on short notice, at our expense, with no explanation whatsoever. We're out money both ways, out a functional vehicle, and out months of time that could have been spent working on it. To top it off, the driver we found said the shop gave him nothing but grief when he got there; very unprofessional.

This is a crooked outfit. Invest at great risk.

text:
This was honestly the best experience I have had with a dealership.
First, like most dealerships you get a warm greeting and all the pleasantries of being a potential buyer. This is where my experience usually changes. Usually after the salesperson talks to me, and I tell them my wants then start the negotiations it all changes. This did not happen at all. The sales people Adrienne and Chris were friendly and helpful. They seemed to genuinely care. The financial personal Timberley was very warm and tried to relate to my country roots. There was another lady there that helped me and got the car I wanted and worked out the financial part. I unfortunately forgot her name. She was awesome as well and got me exactly what I wanted!

Thank you all and please keep up the great work!

text: I can honestly say my experience was great! My salesman, Dennis Johnson was absolutely AMAZING! He is very knowledgeable, courteous,  attentive, patient, honest. text: I had a great experience at this dealership, everyone was really friendly and willing to help. The best thing was I drove away in a new car! Big thanks to everyone who helped! I definitely recommend!

Jordan demonstrates unwavering attention to details and customer service, which is why I bring my 2016 Hyundai Sonata Sport to Jordan in Birmingham versus having it serviced in Atlanta or other possible locations. name: Tebriel Alexander
text:
I went to test drive a Hyundai Santa Fe'  two days ago. This is not my first Hyundai since reinventing itself and blowing our minds. Needless to say I purchased what is now my 5th Hyundai.  However, i'm here to brag on the man who walked my husband and I through this entire process in this humid Alabama weather.  Initially, I came in to take advantage of the $50 GIFT CARD that Hyundai was offering for simply test driving its vehicles, but I also knew that I would potentially be driving off the lot with something new as well. Brandon Blagg was awesome from the gate. He stood and walked over to me, invited me to his desk, and inquired concerning my business. A few questions later, a copy of my license, and "BAM" we were test driving a base model Santa Fe.' One would think that this guy designed these vehicle with his level of knowledge concerning them. Recalling that I have own several vehicles in my lifetime, it is feasible to understand that we have dealt with our share of sales consultants. This is by far the first person who not only informed us of what we would potentially enjoy about the vehicle, but patiently explained in detail its benefits, and demonstrated  to us its functionality. He took a base model vehicle and literally painted a picture that lifted it beyond it's level. He hung out with us for over an hour doing comparisons and contrasts. He was honest concerning pro and cons, but never negative.. not one time. For him every vehicle had its benefits, and for every person there was vehicle that fit them. THIS IS WHAT HE DID! He didn't interfere with our choice, but he made sure that we would be satisfied once we left  the lot for good. In the end we ended up purchasing a Santa Fe' SEL 2.4 engine with both the Convenience and Premium Package. He didn't use a hustler tactic to cause us to go for a higher grade, it was simply his transparency and patience that ultimately led to our selection. Recalling that this was in 90 + degree weather, this man didn't stop until the tires shined.  He made me laugh, shared stories, explained who was whom of the CEO vs. COO, and also wasn't shy around me whatsoever. He even blew bubble gum bubbles for our delightful 6 year old who stood amazed at the excellence his gum blowing abilities. Brandon Blagg, job well done. You deserve all that's coming for your hard work and dedication to service. Aside from our direct experience with Brandon, everyone rocked. Their pleasantness was superb, two of the women conversed with me, they offered treats to my babies, and others smiled and waved. There wasn't a rude attitude in the building. The lobby and bathrooms are well designed and clean. As lengthly a process that car buying could be, they have enough going for themselves to make you relax and enjoy your time.

Thanks Again, Tae A.

name: Agee Richardson
text: I can't say enough about the awesome staff in the Jim Burke Hyundai Service Department. Rusty, the Hyundai Service Department manager, has been very attentive to my automotive needs. When there was a way to hold the manufacturer's accountable for repairs associated with their recall, this service manager had no problem going to bat for me. Although my first impression of this establishment was not a good one due to lack of communication, my final impression is the one that REALLY COUNTS! I feel so blessed that these were the guys: Rusty, Eddie and Justin that tended to my 2013 Hyundai Sonata and me when my car just STOPPED RUNNING on the interstate. It took about a month to get my car fixed right, but they have stuck it out. I am proud to say that my blue-silver streak and I are on the road again tearing up the highway!!! Adrienne Richardson from Birmingham is your #1 Fan!!!

name: Steve Ariens
text: Overall experience was good, we had hit something unseen on I-65 N and blew out a front passenger tire. My car has high performance tires and not common sizes and front and rear are different sizes,  The dealership was able to locate the appropriate sized tires.  When I returned to pick up the car I was surprised by being told that they had done a oil change on the car.. claimed it was due... I have used a specific full synthetic oil in this car since it has 1200 miles on it and now the bill from the dealership was not clear as to what oil is in the engine..  By factory requirements.. it had  abt 1800 more miles before it needed to be changed. IF they would have asked me - they had my cell phone - and they had the oil that I use.. I would have been glad to authorize the oil change.

name: Bernice Bunkley
text: I went in for a oil change . I have a 2016 a Hyundai genesis. We were told we could get free oil change,but because  I didn't want to get the 45000 mile service done I was told I will have to pay  for my oil change. I told the guy that I  have had my oil change for free without the service done before.  He said  than pull all the time I came in ,on the 24000 mile I didn't get service but free oil change. He said  I didn't  need service at that time. All I went to go to the waiting room. He stop me and told me I had to go to the other side that was for Hyundai customers.  The last time I was there I went to the side he said was for Subaru customers only. While  waiting in t by e waiting room for Hyundai customers and customer ask this lady what kind of car she has, she said a Subaru.  He ask me to give him a 5 rating.  No you get a 2 rating from me.

name: Jackson Pike
text: We traded in our vehicle about a week ago and purchased a certified Sonata. Not to say we were screwed over, but the entire experience felt shady. The salesman knew nothing about the car itself other than the price and the carfax. During the test drive we asked about features and got shrugs. This place also takes its sweet time to process a sale. We arrived at 10 that morning and didn't leave until nearly 5 in the afternoon. Expect a whole day ordeal. Also, make sure you know what your car is worth to the dime before attempting to trade. They will not give you anywhere near what your car is worth.

name: Debbie Brazeal
text: Always courteous and helpful. They did not find cause of car noise. Started making it again after I left. Will bring it back when noise starts back

text: I continue to come to Jim Burke because Eddie Hicks treats me with utmost respect and I feel very confident that he understands me and will be honest about any  services needs.  There's so much greed  in the world that you cannot always trust what's being shared when it comes to car service or any kind of service even healthcare service.  I value honesty so I'm pleased with it being serviced by Mr. Hicks. My courtesy ride driver David is also very nice as all others have beeng as well.  my sincere apologies to the young lady that call today and I quickly asked her was she calling about a survey. Please  let her know she's appreciated - I know she was simply trying to do her job. Bless, Valerie Johnson.

I am not satisfied with the level of service on my last visit. I was promised free wiper blades for life with the purchase of my car. Miles driven is not a reliable indicator of wiper wear.

Also, 2 1/2 hours for an oil change is excessive.

text: My experience was great. Wendell was very patient with me and  his customer service was outstanding. He took care of my mom with her car needs as well.

name: Keven Akings
text:
I've purchased several cars and this experience by far stands out as one of the worst.......from beginning to end. I test drove the vehicle on a Monday and pointed out a few cosmetic issues that I feel should have been addressed prior to placing the car up for sale (only a few hundred dollars to correct).  That combined with the manager coming outside to talk to me smoking a cigarette, should have clued me in to the professionalism and pride taken at the dealership.
I was asked that if the problems I pointed out were corrected,  would I purchase the car? I agreed.  The following day I recieved the bill of sale and I noticed that the price shown on the internet was not the price shown on the bill of sale. When I asked the manager, the explanation I recieved was that the car was headed to auction the day I saw it and the price on the internet was the auction price, not the sale price (what does that have to do with me? And the price I came intending to pay is the price that I saw advertised ).  I was then told that they would sell it to me at the internet price but I would have to pay for the repairs which would be $400+.  Since the price was still under book value,  I agreed.  I was then told that the car would be repaired, HAND WAXED and ready for me in a couple days.  I was informed Friday that the car was ready. I drove up Saturday only to find the car just as dirty as it was when I test drove it on Monday(they sprayed the dirt off but there was still hair and dirt on the inside of the car.... wheel wells were dirty, etc). Of all the cars I've bought,  no one has ever tried to delivered me a dirty car! I discussed this with the manager who appeared to care nothing about it.  I left with no intention of buying the car,  but the salesman,
Mr. Willie, called and said that he would take care of it...... he took it to a local shop and had it washed and vacuumed.  As a customer, when money is spent, whether it be $30 or $30,000, you want to feel good about spending it. That's not the feeling I left with.  In the end, I purchased what I feel is a great vehicle.   But the service is what will definitely keep me from being a repeat customer or recommending to anyone else.  Professionalism and putting the customer first is definitely lacking and needs a lot of improvement.

name: Jo Jones
text: I am completely dissatisfied with Jim Burke Suburu and will not ever bring my car there again, even if I have to drive outside Alabama. I took the car in for four recalls.  When I picked up the car the car three lights came on, the car wasn't running smoothly, and I called the technician. He said "nothing they did could have caused this."  Also he told me the diagnostic test -which I didn't want or ask for - indicated the car needed a timing belt,AC etc lot of work that's is needed at a 100,000 miles.  I told him this was already done.  I took my car to my usual mechanic who cleaned the throttle so that the new ECM would read it properly.  Your guys should have known this and should not have returned the car to me in the condition they did.  Also,the right passenger airbag light hasn't been reset.  It's still showing an error. I just hope they really replaced the defective airbag

text: Because of their downtown location the service entrance leaves you backed up sitting in the street in your car when they're busy. That can't be helped. name: denetria mcglown
text: I bought a 2012 Volkswagen Passat with 85,912 miles on it. This was the worst car buying experience ever. My original salesman was nice but knew nothing about a car at all. My battery had a dead cell when I first purchased it. I took it back for the battery to be replace and it took four hours to get a new battery. I asked them to take me to the service center to find out what was taking so long and the guy that work in the front said my battery has been there for two hours. And the guys that were supposed to be working were playing and joking around the next time I needed work done was three days later I noticed the bumper on the car was popped out of place, the 12 volt adapters didn't work, the service light had come on, the key tumbler was messed up in the ignition. I went to try and get that fixed and they told me it would be two days well I asked if they would give me a replacement car to get back and forth to work they told me no they don't do that. Ok so I paid for the work myself. A few days later I discovered my account was overdrawn 500 dollars and when I ask the finance manager why my account was charged and I paid 1000  in cash his response was well we wanted 1500 for the car and u couldn't do that. So they took it upon themselves to take the other 500 dollars. Now after they agreed to give my money back. name: Anne Murray
text:
I was treated very politely, the salesman even picked me up at my home, because my car had caught on fire and I had nothing to drive.BUT the car I was supposed to look at was no longer available. They did not tell me it had sold when I called that same morning to verify my appt. & it's still on the internet as "Available" the following day. Further more 5 days later, it's still listed on the internet as available. So NOW I'm positive it's to lure customers in. If someone is awaiting approval for financing on this vehicle, the very least Jim Burke Hyundai should do is post a flag on the car saying; "Sold Pending Approval of Financing". In my opinion, that would be " Professional Business Protocol".

I'm of the opinion that they might possibly do this to get customers to come in when it looks like a certified car is lower priced then average.

I believe they tried to do a "bait & switch" maneuver on me by showing me a same priced vehicle that was the same color but a different make and model.

The sales mgr. also told me he would find me a Pre-certified car in the same price range that same day, however he never followed through or even had the professionalism to call me back one way or the other. I called him later that afternoon, I didn't want the other car I looked at, at another dealership to get sold, & asked if he could call me back by 6pm  to tell me if he had found another car so I could make a decision. He never called.

Bottom line... before you make the trip to see a specific car, make absolutely sure it's still for sale.
