name: Traci Miller
text: DO NOT PURCHASE A USED CAR FROM THIS DEALERSHIP. And if you do, please, make sure you ask them to print and show you any TSB's (Technical Service Bulletin) on the vehicle you are considering. A TSB is not like a safety recall and therefore the dealership is not required to make the repair. Make them prove to you that they have repaired all of the items on each and every TSB. However, I can almost promise you that they will not make the repairs before selling you the vehicle. I purchased a used 2007 Hyundai Entourage van from Jim Burke Hyundai's used car dealership in March this year after having purchased a new Elantra from them last year. I did not make them show me the TSB's because I wasn't aware of them at the time. Unfortunately there are several of them on the van I purchased. One of them had to do with a part that causes called the "Junction Box Switch" or Instrument Panel Module that causes the battery to discharge. That means when you go out to your car it simply won't start!! I found the TSB on it and it says in large print that it was issued to all Hyundai General Managers and that the repair should be made before retail sale of the van. Many of us believe that purchasing a used car from what you think is a reputable dealership will protect you from these type issues. Well...this dealership is not reputable and should be put out of business. I have contacted them to give them a change to try and make this right to keep customers happy and try to get return business but they obviously are not intersted in this. I will be taking further action regarding this issue.

name: Adam Benson
text: To bree k. On your story about what took place. The vehicle in question was brought in because the ignition switch was defective. Due to the connector going to the anti-theft module was not making connection. After I spent 30 minutes on the phone with the chevy dealer I found the connector was not available. I instructed your daughter to go and get a complete unit with a new pig tail. After explaining to them that a code reading would bring no results to identify the issue. I did allow the vehicle to sit in my parking lot until the problem could be addressed. Most places charge several hundred dollars to do this. Several days later they brought in a switch from a junk yard that was ripped out and badly damaged. I told them they could not use part due to being damaged. After a couple days a night time worker offered to help with diagnostics, he brought his scan tool and tried to diagnosis the issue. Found the anti-theft module was not making any connection with the vehicles pcm. He spent over an hour trying to help your daughter for free. He normally charges $70 an hour for this. We have gone out of our way to help your daughter every way we could. Including letting the vehicle sit for over a week. No way did your stand out in the cold while we laughed at her. If you feel we miss treated you I am the store manager my name is Adam Benson and feel free to come by and we can discuss this situation.

name: Adam Mattes
text: Went to get a misfire diagnosed and no suprise they diagnosed me with a misfire but wouldn't tell me anything past that. Instead they wanted $1200 to replace my spark plugs (they had just been replaced), spark plug wires, and clean my throttle body. A quick look at the throttle body would have told them it was clean. A quick look at the spark plugs would have told you they were correct and attaching a multimeter to the wires can tell you if they pass. They did not check my fuel pressure (takes 2 seconds with the proper tool) or my fuel injectors and did not check the camshaft position sensor which I think (again I didnt get it diagnosed) is wrong. They will say I refused further diagnosis when I refused replacement of everything but what I really refused is their poor excuse of what I diagnosed is. My though is take your money and run I can learn what they told me just sitting in my driveway.

name: Phillip Dunn
text: Oil change was 69.00 yesterday I was told by service adviser, today I paided 83.00 plus. Price change over night. Damm!

name: Mark Brogdon
text: I live in Florida and found a Jeep Wrangler they had there online. Before I left, I called to make sure it was still there. Mr. Ricky Jones said "let me call you right back, I'm going to walk out there and put my eyes on it before I tell you to drive 3 hours up here." He called back within 10 minutes and told me he had pulled it off the lot and to come on. That started how great the service and experience was there. Everyone was super friendly and personable. I didn't feel like I was being hustled or pressured into buying anything. Even though they aren't a Jeep dealership, they knew the answers to my questions regarding the jeep. I ended up buying it and couldn't have had a better experience, all the way from Mr Ricky in sales to AJ in finance office. Super easy buying experience!

name: Giuliana Marie Marinucci
text: I went in to look at the 2018 Traverse on 9/16/2017. When I arrived, I was looking at the vehicle from the outside in before being approached by a salesperson. When the lady finally came up to assist me, I asked if I could look inside of the vehicle - if she had the keys - because the truck was locked. She told me "no" but she could take me inside and give me the specs for the vehicle from the tablet. Ok, fine... thats good for the moment. We get in and she starts running numbers on what the payment would be and telling me what the truck had it in based on what was on her tablet... disregarding the fact I asked her multiple times to go outside and get it unlocked so that I could get inside of it and look. I know what I can afford, I already did the numbers before I got here. All I wanted to do was look at it and see if it fit my family's needs. She finally unlocked it but when I started touching the touch screen she yelled at me like I was a kid even though there was little damage I could do to the vehicle (not that it was my intentions but) since the vehicle was in demo mode. I was also not allowed to sit in the drivers seat. She had told me multiple times that the truck was out of my price range, knowing NOTHING about my finances because I had not yet disclosed that information in any form. Then she had the "manager" come out and he told me the same thing, that I couldnt afford this vehicle but they could put me in a cheaper vehicle. Long story short, they lost a purchase from a client who makes over $100k per year because "I couldnt afford that vehicle". We will take out business on to Prattville to the Chevy dealer up here when they get the 2018 Traverse in stock.

name: Jeff Plummer
text: Simply put..."A breath of fresh air". They literally spent hours trying to identify a vibration I was experiencing with my truck. When they weren't confident they had found the exact problem they actually told me so. They gave me a set of recommendations on things I could do to rule out things it wasn't, and left the next steps up to me. Their recommendations ultimately guided me to the answer (Young tires that had failed). They had my vehicle in their shop multiple times, didn't actually fix anything, but they have me as a customer into the foreseeable future. For me, helping me find the answer is as valuable as being the answer.

resp.text:
Our team truly has the best interest of our customers in mind, Jeff, so you can always count on us for honest service! We appreciate you recognizing our efforts, and we hope you'll keep us in mind for future maintenance.
Gratefully,
Christian Brothers Montgomery

name: Jacey B.
text:
I just want to start out by saying that the employees here all seem very genuine and caring, and they’re probably great with most vehicles. But do not bother taking any foreign vehicle to their shop that needs anything more than an oil change. I had a vehicle break down on me and took it here to avoid towing it to the dealership in Birmingham. I quickly received an estimate of almost $23,000 to fix my suv and was told that I should contact my insurance company because it was totaled.

I ended up taking it to the dealership for a second opinion (like I should have to begin with) and ended up only paying $3700 to repair what was wrong with my suv, and that didn’t include a single thing listed on the original estimate sent to me by CBA.

I really wish they would have just turned me away before I took it there in the first place if they could not service my vehicle instead of guessing what the problem was and writing it off as a lost cause.

I called CBA last week to update them on the status of my vehicle and to let them know what really was wrong with it - all they wanted to know was how “reputable the shop was that I took my vehicle to” and to try to tell me that they never referred to my car as totaled. Not only did they put us in a horrible situation, they also tried to act like they never said the things they did and asked what exactly I was expecting from my phone call. Just a bad experience.

resp.text: We apologize for your inconvenience, Jacey. Your feedback is appreciated, and we wish you well with all your future automotive repairs and services. Respectfully, Christian Brothers Montgomery

name: UpInTheAir
text:
I'd like to start off this review by saying that the folks at CBA Montgomery are incredibly polite and courteous. I have no disapproval towards the individual employees there.

With that said, that is unfortunately the extent of my positives about the business. I've brought two of my vehicles there a total of three times, over the course of two years, and each time, I have been disappointed. My first vehicle had a minor oil leak, and I took it to CBA to check it out. Long story short, they charged me over $1000 and a week of time, and in the end, the issue wasn't resolved. Brought my vehicle to another shop on Atl Highway, $250 later, and it was fixed. All in all, this wasn't a huge deal, but I was disappointed in CBA.

Fast forward 2 years, and i take another one of my vehicles that I had just purchased to CBA for a post-purchase full diagnosis (This alone cost $120) which they assured me would cover just about everything i needed to get done to the vehicle to get it to top shape. They quoted me over $5,000 worth of service. This alone wasn't completely insane. It was an older vehicle, and yes, a good few things needed fixing. However, I jotted down the items they told me I needed to replace and decided to do the items myself (brake change, coolant flush, oil change, filters, etc). Took off the brakes. The Pads, Rotors were literally brand new. They said my front caliper mount and caliper itself were in terrible condition. Completely false--it was in perfect condition upon further inspection. Performed the coolant change after they claimed it was dirty and needed changing (btw they quoted me $140 for the coolant change, which if you know, is one of the easiest things you can do yourself for $20 worth of coolant and 30 min of your time max). This also turned out to be unecessary. The coolant I drained was the exact same color as the new coolant I purchased myself. I did this for every item on the list of things they told me I needed to change, and the ONLY thing that actually needed to be changed was the front driver struts and the radiator fan.

A week after I get the $5000 list of things that need to be serviced, I drive to Atlanta. Halfway there on the interstate, my timing/fan belt shred apart, engine overheats, and my car is disabled. Tow it to a garage nearby and they inform me that my water pump was well on its way out, A/C compressor had imploded, and timing/fan belts should have been changed a long time ago. NONE OF THESE WERE MENTIONED BY CBA. Fortunately I did not get into an accident, but I trusted CBA to diagnose what I needed to fix on my vehicle, and they failed to mention, at all, three incredibly easy to inspect components that were failing, and caused my vehicle to stop driving in the middle of the highway. Absolutely unacceptable.

If you're reading this, CBA, come on, step your game up. If you're going to charge one of the highest rates in the entire state of Alabama, maybe provide service that backs up that rate. I respect you all as individuals, but  as a "reputable automotive service center", I am appalled.

resp.text: We take your detailed feedback seriously, as our customers' safety and satisfaction are very important to us. However, we are unable to find your information in our database so there is a chance you have left this for the wrong business. Please allow us an opportunity to address your concerns in detail by sending your phone number and availability to Eric.Wesch@cbauto.net. Thank you for your time, and we hope to hear from you soon. Respectfully, Christian Brothers Montgomery

text:
There are not enough stars to rate this company.
2 weeks ago my car broke down, following a long string of misfortunes, I felt utterly hopeless and on the verge of just giving up. I came across the number to CBA while trying to find a repair shop that could quote me less than the few $1000 I had already been quoted by another. CBA was the only other shop I called, as soon as Danny answered my call he said he knew he had to help me, not to worry, they would do everything they could to get me through this. He did. He helped me get it towed from Prattville to their shop in Montgomery. Kept me updated every step of the way and constantly reassured me that they were there to help. My car, unfortunately, had some very major issues and even at CBA prices still was out of my price range. But, I didn't leave without transportation. Danny went above and beyond to help me find a suitable vehicle that I could afford and I left yesterday the owner of a reliable, running vehicle. The people of CBA are some of the kindest people I have had the blessing of meeting. They are truly doing works that reflect the epitome of Christians. Neither my family nor I will never not take a vehicle anywhere else other than Christian Brothers Automotive.
Thank you Danny and all the staff at CBA! I am forever grateful.

resp.text:
Being there for our customers when they need us is something our team takes great pride in, and it was truly our pleasure to be of help to you. Thank you very much for taking the time to share your great experience and acknowledge the diligent efforts of our team, and please know you can expect the same above and beyond service from us in the future.

Christian Brothers Montgomery

name: Keith Poche
text: Horrible service. I called them at 10:30 am to schedule a time to bring my vehicle in for an oil change. They told me to be there at 1:00 pm. I was there 10 minutes early. Finally after waiting a hour. They tell me they don't have have the oil filter to change my oil.

name: Joe Florida
text:
The name of this place really bothers me, and reminds me of the money changers in the temple. They are just using "Christian Brothers" for marketing purposes, not to show a genuine Christian nature. I went in for an alternator swap. I knew it was the alternator and told them as much; didn't stop them from charging me $48 to "diagnose" the problem. That was for an half hour of labor which if you want to count the time it took for them to tell me the price, was not a half hour after I brought it in. So yes, their hourly labor rate is $96 which strikes me as a little high, and yes, they don’t mind rounding up to the detriment of the customer. The rest of the bill was just as offensive and out of tune with normal auto repair prices. A re-manufactured alternator for my car was $117 at the time, they charged $244.20 and kept the core fee for themselves. No, they didn't put a new one in, just a re-man. They then charged me $39.78 for a serpentine belt, which I don't mind that they replaced, but a new one at any auto parts store runs around $20. So paying twice for parts is pretty painful, but then they add on a fee for "shop supplies"; I'm not sure what for, wear and tear on the tools? A paper towel or two? Whatever they were, they cost me $37.10. You'd think that "shop supplies" would be included when you pay premium for the parts and labor. On top of all of that, they padded the hours they were replacing the alternator. They charged me for 1.5 hours ($144.09) but the guy was only working on it for 45 minutes tops. The rest of the time that it was in their garage it just sat there. That's right, a car in Christian Brothers Automotive's garage is accruing labor costs even if it just sits there, hate to see what the overnight tab would be. Just think of the “shop supplies” that leaked into a car that sat there overnight.

They have three salesman upfront and only two technicians when I was there. This shows their focus: extract every possible penny from a potential customer, especially if he is from out of town. Why pay extra techs when you are still billing for the time that the car sits in their garage right? Another indication of their less-than-honest nature is that they put all these odd-ball prices on the parts and shop fees. Like what is with the 10 cents on shop supplies, they couldn't round that off? Well they could, but they don't want you to realize that they are just padding the bill. Ten cents looks more authentic. They also have a sign in the back that says: "Ask every customer: Is there anything else we can check for you today?" I'd hate to see the proposal for work you get back when you give these guys a greenlight to check out your entire car.

The technicians were good, the alternator seems to be working out fine. But the salesmen are only good at small talk. They brought my car back out of the garage and it started to smoke. They thought the engine was about to explode or something they turn it off and frantically check the oil. When I get out there they say that the oil pan is empty. Nope, check again. When they checked again they saw that it was half full like I knew it was. The smoke was from the debris that got knocked down onto the serpentine belt. Some debris that my $37.10 in shop supplies should have cleaned up. Guess not.

All-in-all, I paid $545 for a pretty simple fix, and they quoted me on the phone $250 as I was driving trying to get somewhere before my car died. I guess they knew they had me, but I hope this review saves somebody else the expense and frustration of dealing with these guys. These guys bend you over with a smile on their face. If you want this type of service and pay these type of prices, just go to the dealer, at least they are more knowledgeable about your car.

text: My experience at Autonation was awesome. My service advisor was Jason Williams and he saw to it that I had awesome service. Not only did he greet me when I drove up to the service center, but he made sure I had beverages to drink, he checked in with frequently to keep me informed of the progress they were making on automobile, and he saw to it that I received the services I requested and I received them in a timely manner. He was absolutely awesome and I will come back again.

name: LaToya B
text: This place was the absolute worse place I ever been to for car repair service. They were very unprofessional. They lied to me and told me my services would be covered under warranty. They said they called and then told me later warranty was not covering. My car went into the shop running and was there for 3 weeks. When I tried to go get it now they are saying it needs a whole new motor. It was so many levels to this, but I would never in my life ever buy a Dodge and I will never go to that dealership again. Everyone that work there is a complete joke.

name: Christopher Peters
text: They have trouble wearing masks correctly. Also, the Service department treats customers like an after thought.

name: jan vickers
text: automation is awesome! they bought my vehicle and found the exact suv I wanted!! Alexis was so sweet, and oh so helpful!

name: Jackie Camp
text: When my 2014 Chrysler 200 needs service I take it to AutoNation because they are professional and they check everything to make sure no issues arise.  When it's going to be a long wait they come and let you know were they are on each step of repair.  They always have coffee and water if needed.  They also check on recall parts so you want have to come back they fix it doing your service visit.  They always offer other discounts on oil changes, tires and other necessities.  I wouldn't take my Chrysler anywhere else.

name: Matt Montenegro
text: Some of the most sleezy people that give all car sales men a bad name. Purchased a used vehicle from this dealership in May of 2020. I was sold when I was told that my vehicle had an Auto Nation warranty of "90 days or 4,000 miles." Sounds great doesn't it? Well after being hurried along in signing paperwork so the vehicle could be mine I was very happy with my purchase. However, less than a month later, and still well within my "warranty" coverage period I got a Christmas tree of lights on my dashboard. I was told to take it to its dealership and from there I could then make the claim. When I called to make the claim, Auto Nation's warranty service said there was no vehicle with my VIN in the system. I then called the manager there who told me, "I never signed any contract stating I had a warranty and it doesn't matter what I was told because it isn't in writing." I realized the manager was right about this however, I was being told one thing then they intentionally rushed me through signing paperwork so that I wouldn't catch that I never signed anything for my "warranty". The deceptive methods of these people shows that they are talented at one thing and, one thing only and, that is lying to people. These people are clearly slimy and cannot be trusted, save yourself the hassle and do not purchase a vehicle from here. Learn from my mistake, don't come here. Where ever you do go, whatever you are offered make sure it is in writing!!!!

name: William Mott
text: The two service advisors I usually deal with are Michael Robinson and Ken Baker; they are always friendly and helpful. I dropped off my truck for service (oil change, tire rotation, etc.) and Ken Baker called back to notify me that my vehicle was ready. As far I know, the work was done satisfactorily.

name: Charles Bailey
text: I’ve never had any problems with them. Good quality work on time. They’ll tell you if something else needs to be looked at.

name: Samantha Stefan
text: I have purchased 3 Vehicles from this Dealership with my Husband and have had the same salesman Austyn ! He is Humble and Honest and that means a lot these days when purchasing a vehicle. They met my expectations and we will continue to buy from here as long as he is there. The best experiences I have ever had at any Dealership and I have bought many vehicles in my lifetime!!! Thank you Austyn you Rock !!!

name: Alfonso Packer
text: Consumer service was very poor. Upon arrival to pick up my car after recall work I had to stand in the lobby for 20mins before I was even acknowledged to get help. Then the service guy who said he had my paper so he would him me continued a phone call for an additional 30 mins. It didn’t bother me until I heard the conversation, which seemed personal not AutoNation business related, so I decided to go to parts while I waited to get so things. That department was great. After finishing up he still was on phone so I went to someone else to see if I could be helped then he decided to pull up my paperwork and noticed it was a recall job and only need a signature and to hand me my keys. I will never probably use the service department if that was a example of the customer service to expect.

name: Richard Dodson
text: Had some warranty work done on my 2019 Ram 1500. Troy was very knowledgeable of what needed to be done, and the service technicians did a great with the small issues that had, andchad my truck ready to go in a timely manner. Great job Autonation team.

name: Ms. Kay
text: Great service team. Ken was extremely patient throughout the journey. I experienced some flood damage in September 2019 that required major repairs to include a rental for a few weeks. Updates were offered and a complete thorough summary of what was serviced. Ken and the team wereprofessional. My vehicle was as showroom ready as the day I purchased it from them. Roll Tide.

name: Daijha Doss
text: NONE of my experiences at autonation have been pleasant. I’m either here all day or have to leave my car for days at a time because they can’t seem to do their jobs. My car was there for 2 days just to get the battery changed (I kid you not). Now I’m waiting on a part for my car and dear lord you would think they had to actually build the part themselves. I’ve been told 3 different stories about this part. I’ve had my car for almost 4 years now and EVERY SINGLE TIME I’m in there someone is upset about how they run this place. Now I’m that someone. Thanks for nothing Autonation. Keep up the good work.

name: Rick McNeill
text: I have dealt with Tommy Johnson on multiple occasions and he has always been courteous and professional.

name: Amir Sahori
text: Very unprofessional staff. 7 hour oil change while I was stuck at the mall. No service or anyone to help get me anywhere. Was given a call 20 min before closing time and said that my ride was ready, got there 40 min later due to traffic and they said they closed. So honestly never doing business with this dealership ever again. I suggest everyone get oil changes at Honda rather than this dealership... buy your cars somewhere else, the bad service outweighs the quality of their trucks.

name: Samuel Alston IV
text: I was completely satisfied with the Service Advisor, Mike Robinson’s eagerness and prompt service to my problem. I definitely enjoyed the awesome service. I will recommend him to friends and colleagues. Also, Autonation as somewhere to go for all their car related needs.

name: Janet Wright
text:
Great company, great atmosphere, and it was awesome working with Chris and Austin
They made us feel at easy and comfortable
My husband and I would definitely do business with this company again
Thanks guys

name: Natalia Hornbuckle
text: Great experience from beginning to end!!! Salesman (Sondra) not overbearing, very professional, cordial and kind. Ralph in Finance great personality. Wonderful experience.

name: Scott Boyd
text: The staff there worked out a great deal for me on my purchase of a 2020 Jeep Wrangler Unlimited Rubicon.

name: Dana Adcock
text: 10 years ago we bought a new Jeep Grand Cherokee.   No one has ever touched this car but Auto Nation.  A couple months age my husband took the car in for repair.  A new condenser had to be installed.  After the work was completed, when we picked the car up, the dash lights were out.   We were told there would be an additional $300 or more to fix it.  This was very shabby business as it was fine before the work was done.   I’ve had a couple of issues with this establishment but let it go but this is going to far to expect us to pay for something that was broken while a very expensive repair was being done on the car.

name: Daniel Eisrnhard
text: Sid was very helpful throughout the whole process of repairing my wife’s vehicle through the extended warranty.  He spent time on the phone dealing with my warranty company and when it came time he even drove me in his own vehicle to the rental company.

name: Diane Krause
text: I took my car in for repair of the power adjustment on the driver seat. The service rep who took care of me made the scheduling and check-in nice and easy and arranged for the shuttle service to take me home. I was disappointed that the AutoNation website didn't allow me to schedule an appointment for repairs online (only maintenance services could be done online). I got a diagnosis and repair quote within a day, but word that it would take a week to get the part in. It turned out to be an additional day for the part to arrive, and I was told the car would be done the following day, but  it took two more days for it to get done. We came from the Houston area where we were used to parts being accessible more quickly, so this wait time may be normal for the Mobile area. The pickup experience was a bit frustrating. I picked up on a Saturday and waited 1 hour 15 minutes to get checked out (was told the car was ready but paperwork had to be done). The service rep kept getting pulled away by walk-ins, phone calls, and I'm not sure what else, but it seemed I kept getting bumped to the back of the line. There may have been more legitimate reasons for the long wait time, but those weren't shared with me. Everyone was nice and helpful, and my car was repaired, but the wait times were a bit disappointing.

name: And P
text: Parts department is a joke. Spent 10 minutes going in circles trying to reach someone there. Eventually just hangup.

name: Cinde Pocase
text: I recently had a recall taken care of on my Jeep Renegade at Auto Nation Jeep in Mobile.  Troy took care of setting up my appointment and getting the repair done. They always do a great job there and take care of me and my car.

text: Awesome experience!!! Austyn Long gave us great service. We are very happy with our purchase and will be going there if we need anything in the future.

I paid cash and was told that I would have the paperwork for the title and so I could get my tag, in about 10 days but to allow 20. It’s weird to me that I didn’t get the title that day but now it has been a month and I still don’t have the paperwork. I’m still driving around with no tag, just the temp tag.

name: Scott Ford
text: I drove about an hour away from home to sell my car to Autonation because they were willing to give me substantially more than other car buying services.  To be realistic the price was still under the book value for the vehicle, but no messing around, just a reliable sale.  I would say from the time I drove in to the time I left with a check was less than an hour and they gave me 50% more than what Carmax offered.  Karen in the online department was great to sit with while the service guys did a quick inspection and prepared the paperwork and check.  If you're looking to sell a vehicle and don't want to mess with CL or haggle with another dealer, autonation was great for me.

text: Took my car in because the check engine light came on and was given a quote for the repairs , I was excited when the lady explained they had a discount due to Covid-19. I got the main issue repaired that day and she explained i could come back and get the other repair within the next month and STILL get the discount. Came back 2 weeks later and they didn't have the part even though I called a few days before to schedule the repair. 😡 So I was told we will call you once the part comes in they NEVER called and I called and left messages they were NEVER returned. 🤬So I just went by the shop later that day and the part was on-site but they tried to charge me more than I was quoted. I am completely satisfied with the repairs several months later but I also completely disturbed by the lack of professionalism and customer service 😐. Hopefully I never have to use them again and I can't in good conscience recommend them...two👎🏿👎🏿 waaaay down!!!

name: Jennifer King
text: We went to try and trade in my current vehicle, Our sales LADY was awesome (even though we couldn't trade at the time) she explained everything as to why we couldn't trade in at that time, gave us some great info and pointers for when we do trade, she knows her work and is very knowledgeable about what shes doing, she also refused to run my credit that day to keep from putting a hard inquiry on my credit report (she refused b/c of my job history with only being there 2 months and said the banks wouldn't approve it since i hadn't been on my new job long enough) so instead of just running it anyways to try and get a sale she saved me from a hard inquiry on my credit report. MOST DEFINITELY WILL BE GOING BACK IN A FEW MONTHS when I have a little more time in on my new job. (I cant remember her first name but her last name was Edwards (im almost 97% positive lol)

name: Shaye Iascone
text:
June19, 2020 my husband and I went to Serra Chevrolet in Birmingham, AL to look at a 2003 F-350 Flatbed truck, we had an appointment with a young lady named Jerrica.  When we got there we looked over the truck thoroughly and then took it for a test drive, when we got back, my husband looked over the underneath of the truck to see if there were any oil or other leaks.  He found oil dripping at the rear seal, so he pointed that out to Jerrica and she called out the “GM” Eric to come talk to us.
Eric explained that he himself purchased the truck and would like to “just get rid of it”   so he started to talk price.  He went from $15,000 to $12,500.  My husband also told him the ride was really rough and it felt like the truck had a heavy load on it when it was empty, saying it could be from sitting for a long period of time, but he wasn’t sure.  Eric then said to have the oil leak look at it would be somewhere around $1500-2000 he will drop the price to $11, 800 and they will do the repairs.
We told him we would think about it and Eric said the price was good until closing the next day which was Saturday 06/20/2020.
We decided to call Jerica and told her we would take truck without the repairs being done for $10, 300 and we would pick up the truck tomorrow Saturday 06/20/2020.  Jerrica said they have accepted our counter offer.  We then get a text that we need to hold off until Monday 06/22/2020 to get final approval and they will have the truck delivered to our house once they have to final okay.
No final okay, WE FINALLY GOT A HOLD OF Eric the GM who told us he was also ½ owner of Serra Chevrolet.  He told us their policy was NOT to sell a vehicle in need of repair, so the truck had to go get the rear seal leak repaired and as soon as it was finished they would deliver the truck to our home, he told my husband he was not trying to pull a fast one but that was the policy and he was not going to renege on his agreement for the $10,300 and they would get back to us asap.
Jerrica called after a week or so and told us that the truck had significant repairs and they were pulling off the market and it was no longer for sale, to anyone.  I had a friend inquired about the truck and was told it is being serviced.  No word from anyone at all.
Fast forward to 07/24/2020 my friend Erica gets a text from Serra Chevy asking if they are still interested in the 2003 Ford F-350?  She answers yes, how much?  Text told her $13, 825.  So my friend asked if the repairs she was told about last month were done and they told her yes, the truck is fixed and ready to go, Drove 2+ hours to go see this truck again. We walked up to the truck and my husband climbs underneath to look at what they did to repair the truck.  He saw NO SIGNS of anyone touching the housing bolts or any difference what’s so ever from the last time he looked at the truck.  Sale agent comes out we say we are interested can we take for test drive and off my husband goes with the sales girl.
When they get back my husband looks under the truck and low and behold…the leak is still there!!  My husband had asked about the rear seal being repaired and the sales agent said it was repaired, my husband showed her the leak and she just said would you like to make an offer?  We went in, she started filling out the paperwork and asked what we think a fair price would be so my husband said we talked to Eric the GM and since the leak isn’t fixed we want to give the price we both agreed to $10,300.  The agent said she would be right back and went to the other end of the building to a man sitting at a desk,  We sat a while,  agent came back she said last night a man said he wanted to pay full asking price and had a cashier’s check.  “What the hell is going on here”?
My friend Erica sends a text same day after we were told was sold and tells the agent is it okay to come Monday at 5:30 SHE WAS TOLD ABSOLUTELY!!  The agent said the truck was still available!  Erica says  I am not wasting a 2 hour drive, the trucks rear seal is fixed ”  The agent said YES, the rear seal was repaired. BAD BUSINESS!

name: Hellonwheels999 (Hellonwheels999)
text: Wow, just wow. These guys EARN 5 stars hands down. I have a 01 Rodeo which are known to be difficult to work on especially for alignments. These guys deserve your business. Very homely eager to help group of individuals. The alignment guy went above and beyond to hear what I had to say and at least help my situation even though he told me upfront it would be a difficult fix. Every person here, acted like they were there to help you and want your business to come back. From the first phone call, to the moment I left this shop was honest and fair. As a mechanic of 11 years, a shop like this is a needle in a hay stack. I will send everyone I know to this place. Seriously they were that good.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

text: I enjoyed my visit. Great service

name: Brooks B
text:
JacMac Tire and service was not busy today, which was good for me and for them. I usually get depressed when my car gets sick because RARELY do I walk away without spending a grand. But this visit was very pleasant. The customer service man asked me what was wrong with my vehicle, then asked me for the key. He went out and took my car for a test drive, then onto the rack. I waited in the lobby waiting area for a very brief time and then he came back. He told me I had a couple of options. Option one included replacing brake rotors and option two, pads only. I took the less expensive option two because money was tight. My total bill was HALF of what I assumed it would be. At JacMac, the difference is simple. They don't seem to want to drain your checking account like other places around Tuscaloosa who want to bill you no less than 1000 dollars every time you walk in the door. And I really like that he OFFERED me the different options. Most places dont do that. They make you ASK for less expensive options then say, welllllll, but, if you do that then this will happen, etc.
I think I just found "my mechanic."

resp.text: We're glad we were able to offer you the service you needed, Brooks! Let us know if there is anything else we can do for you, and we look forward to working with you again!

name: C.J. Sealy
text:
Quick service and reasonable prices for tire work.

However, this is what won my respect:
I came in to get my tire patched after running over a screw.  The mechanic patched my tire but accidentally stripped a lug nut when putting it back on. I noticed it once I got home and called the service desk.  They assured me I could come anytime over the next few days to fix the problem.  I showed up the next morning with a $5.18 lug nut from Nissan to replace the stripped one.  Not only did the mechanic fix it right away, the manager voluntarily reimbursed me without me bringing it up.

Mistakes happen...  It makes me happy to see a business doing the right thing. Especially without being prodded.

5 stars for this business!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review us! We are so happy to hear that you had a great experience at our location and hope to see you next time!

Most places won't do for a new customer what they did for me, and believe me when I say I appreciate it. I think the crew here's gonna see me again for my car maintenance. This is how you do business right - treat the customers with a little respect, help them out, and you'll have them for life. Thanks again JacMac, the car feels great. I'll be back again soon.

P.S. ask about the magnetic helmet in the office. Pretty crazy little thing. Two championships off but still fun.

name: LJ Pack
text: These people have communication issues. We went to make a deal on a used vehicle. We almost made the deal twice. After making our down payment and payment requirements very clear, the sales persons involved went to get approval. When they returned, the vehicle had been discounted, but they added a "fee." That's the only thing he would say, "a fee." They were trying to deliberately be vauge and, in our opinion, dishonest. After discussing their "fee," we never actually achieved full disclosure. We were told the vehicle was at a different dealership within our city and we could go there to finalize the deal. They said that they would call ahead and we should just go over there. Our credit had already been run multiple times, and we had received approval from the credit company. With this in mind, we went to the other dealership location. As we arrived at the other location, they hadn't been given all the details as we had been led to believe. So the process began again, running in circles of double talk and running our credit again... We left at closing time and expected a phone call the next day to complete the deal... That has yet to happen days later. I used to have great respect for Greenway Automotive. It appears that Greenway has only taken over these dealerships at face value, and the same crooks that were already in place are still running things just like they always have. Avoid Greenway Honda in Florence, AL, and Greenway Chevy in Muscle Shoals, AL, if you are planning to make a deal on a used car. They are not to be trusted unless you have the cash to pay up front or your own financing.

resp.text: LJ, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. This is not the level of customer service that we strive to provide at Greenway. We take customer satisfaction very seriously and we hope to have another opportunity to show you that. Should you wish to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to our General Manager, Jesse Gouvin, at jessegouvin@greenway.com. Thank you for your patience.

name: Michael Corvin
text: Many thanks to the guys at David's Auto Clinic for being able to look at and repair my car on such short notice.  I ran over a dead deer on I-65 during rush hour traffic and it banged up the underside pretty good.  They were able to repair a loose brace that'd been partially ripped away and get me on my way in mere minutes.  A job well-done for a fair price.  I'd recommend these guys anytime!

text: Very knowledgeable, prompt, great pricing!!

name: Marvin the Martian
text: Use this shop at your own peril. They supposedly replaced my fuel pump. 1 year later my fuel pump breaks. I ask them to check it out. They confirm the fuel pump is out & could not warrantee the part but they would fix the problem for $580-. I asked how could this happen & the mechanic actually said he sold me a non ethanol pump. What lies. After hearing this I decided to replace the pump myself. They actually held my car hostage & tried to extort me for $100 to release the car. After replacing the pump myself I could see they never replaced the bad pump to begin with. Complete scam artist. I would never use backwood shop like this again. Liars & theives.

text: It's a great place to go to Can I have your car repaired? Tom Sanders from S&W Auto Parts highly recommended David's

I would absolutely recommend David's auto clinic to any and everyone!  You guys were so unbelievably fast and courteous. Thank you for everything! A++++ :)

text: Guys here are great. They got my car fixed in under an hour. Great talking with them while we were waiting on the parts house delivery. If I ever have any more trouble I'm definitely going back to David's.

name: Phillip Willcox
text: Scott McClellan only reason your giving a bad review is you bought your own parts to save a dollar, that mechanic or any other mechanic is not responsible to warranty YOUR PART that's the chance you take that is why we mark parts up to cover things like this. The thing your not saying is you drove your truck for a month before the slave cylinder went out and like I said that's your part that went out not his so you a responsible for that repair also the labor cost will have to be took up with the store that sold the part. I've known David and his wife for 20 plus years they are honest and good people I've sent him plenty of customers and they have ALL thanked me and said how good of a job he'd done them. But the funny thing is that in my line of work I visit and talk to just about all the shops in the south Hoover to Montevallo area and you and your wife's name came up a couple of times funny how those guys I spoke with all seemed to remember you having some kinda problem and screaming money back, fix it for free, your just trying to screw me and then the I'll get a lawyer card lol we all love those, cant afford to get your car fixed but can afford a lawyer fee yeah right. Folks these are great people at David's Auto don't believe what one trouble maker puts on here because of their on ignorance.

name: Callme Fishmeal
text: It has been about a month since I had my tire service done at Grady's. Excellent customer service and price. I waited in the lobby while they mounted and balanced my 4 new tires. The whole time the staff was super friendly and engaged with me in interesting conversation making me feel more welcomed. They told me I needed new brakes and a rear rotor (which I did, and already bought the parts on Amazon before going to Grady's) and I appreciate how they didn't try to pull any sneaky fees on me. My only complaint is that when I got my car home, I checked the pressure in all 4 tires and each were off. One tire had 65 pounds of pressure in it! The other 3 had around 20-25 pounds of pressure. My tires are supposed to hold 35 pounds of pressure, so needless to say I had to do some air pressure adjustments. Nonetheless, I have no hard feelings, and understand this was probably an overlooked mistake. I still recommend Grady's and will continue using them in the future (checking tire pressure before leaving the parking lot next time.)

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, but we sure are embarrassed! Please call and ask for Brian, so I can find out how that happened! We appreciate you letting us know. Mistakes will happen, but we always strive for perfection. Thank you for your continued business!

name: Tiffany Mann
text: I’ve come to Gradys 3 times and every time has been a 5 star experience. Everyone there is so friendly and informative. Last time I went I was only there for a check up since I was about to drive 3 hours away with a ton of stuff in my car and wanted to make sure I wouldn’t end up on the side of the road. I went to pay and they said it was free. Completely caught me off guard since I assumed there would at least be some labor fees but wow, very nice. Up until I moved, they were my go to. Would definitely recommend them!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Tiffany! Hope your move went well, and don't hesitate to call us!

text: The staff here is so friendly, warm and welcoming! That means so much. We have been happy with the service. Can’t go wrong with Grady’s!

We got a flat tire on the highway. Went to a place, that supposedly fixed it. An hour later on the highway the tire went flat.

The friendly staff at Grady's managed to take us the same day and fixed our tire. Rick and the rest of the team were very knowledgeable and helpful! Super professional and helped us out even though we got there 30 minutes before closing.
Thank you!

name: John Mcdonald
text: Last Friday at 8 30am, my family and I dropped off our car at Gradys tire and auto, for tires, oil change, and brakes. After they kept our car for over 8 hours, they never completed the job we asked and paid them to do. On Monday morning, we returned our car again to them once again in hopes they would complete the one job left to finish. After 6 and one half hours later , they have not.

name: Devan Seabaugh
text:
Professional with Outstanding Customer Service:
My family was traveling from Atlanta, GA through Opelika, AL when the car lost oil pressure. The cap not being secured correctly the day before after taking it for an oil change. Turns out it lost 7 quarts of oil!  My wife pulled over and was directed to Grady's Tire & Auto.  She arrived an hour before they opened and Mr. Anderson happened to be there.  He welcomed them, opened the shop early and treated them to a cup of coffee while he checked out the car.  The team put degreaser on the oil that had splashed onto the car and washed it down so they could get back on them road.  So thankful to Mr. Anderson and his team for taking care of my family in their time of need.  It's nice to know there are kind, loving people all over this great country.  Thanks Y'all

resp.text: We appreciate you choosing us to help you! - Rick

name: Taylor Gwen
text: Honestly the best place you could go!! I LOVE the shuttle service they offer. Outstanding customer service, they are very trustworthy, will go above and beyond to help their customers, and honestly care if their customers are truly satisfied. They stand behind their work and are very dependable. I really appreciate how they take care of their customers. They don't try to sell you something you do not need. Their knowledge, experience , and work is top notch. I would not recommend going  anywhere else. Laura at the front desk will get you in and out.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback! We'll pass this on to Laura!

name: Carleen Amadio
text: Made my cross country drive from California to Opelika, Alabama and when I got here I asked about who would be a good place to take my “Louise” to, and Grady’s was said to be a good company to go to, and they are!! Louise is a ‘94 Ford Cargo vVan, and need the oil pan fixed and asked them to do a few other things and we are doing all we can to extend her life and now she needs to have a slower life, and Grady’s did a fabulous job with her and feel like she’s a whole different van now!! I was very surprised that the offer of the courtesy ride is willing to drive you anywhere you need to go while you vehicle is there and even if your vehicle is there for a few days, you need a lift, give them a call!! I did not expect that offer and to me that’s service!! They now have my business no matter what vehicle I have, I found that this business gas surpassed my expectations and now won my loyalty 100%. If you need any help, this is the place to go hands down! You will not regret coming here! Friendly, kind, understanding and great comfort knowing you are in good hands! Deeply impressed with Grady’s! Grateful and deep gratitude for your company!! Thanks for fixing my Louise!

resp.text: Carleen, we enjoyed getting to know you and Louise! Thank you!

text: AMAZING  customer service!! Their roadside service always responds in a timely manner even if you are out of town or not in a near by area. They are honest, dependable, reliable, and the prices are very competitive. I would not  go anywhere else!

text: Thank you Grady's for professional courteous service! The gentlemen helping me stayed after closing to get my vehicle repaired. Thank you so much!!!

name: Alice Cullen
text:
Excellent!!!!

I was stranded on the side of the Interstate with a flat tire. I called them and they promptly sent someone out. Charles made the extra trip to take the tire to the shop, fix it, and take it back to my car. When we realized that my car had more of a problem than just a flat tire, Charles was more than happy to take me back to the shop and had my vehicle towed. The men at the shop were extremely friendly, polite and very helpful! When the part could not be delivered until the next day, the owner offered and took me to a nearby hotel. Not only did they give me great service, at a great price - they also had the decency to help me in a time of need. If I were a local, Grady's would be the one and only Tire & Auto service I would go to!!

name: Miah Henderson
text: HORRIBLE SERVICE! They charged me $90 for a diagnostics test without telling me the price initially. They then offered to charge only $45 if I would have the work done there. They also told me the job would be $465   and I took my car to another business and they only charged me $150 for the job. Truly shameful that they tried to charge me a $150 service fee because they "typically don't work on Mazdas".

name: james Czerniak
text: They wont see another dime from my pocket. My son had $600 worth of work done on his truck and about a week later, there was a noise coming from the same area the work was done. I had him call Gradys and ask if they can look and see if the part they put on was bad or if it was something else. My son was told to bring it in and a mechanic would take a look and see what was what. The mechanic(some old guy) took my son back and started blaming my son for the original problem we brought it in for. He was real rude. Then my son was told to go to the front office and they will put a quote together for him. The quote was for $3000 which he didn't have at the time so we waited until he could get the money together. Well, we decided to drop it off at another shop and see what they said before we paid the $3K. The other shop did the same work for $600. I would stay away! This isnt the first time I felt suspect about some work they have done.

resp.text: James, we are sorry to see this review and apologize for any inconvenience. When we did a little digging, the estimate that we had pulled was for $1,300, but we would love to discuss this with you furthur so we can work it out. Please give us a call at 334-745-3568. Thank you.

name: Erica Chambers
text: A leak in my trunk caused the fuse box to get wet so I scheduled an appointment to drop it off. When I dropped it off I told them that the fuse box got wet due to a leak and I wanted them to figure out why it was leaking. They didn’t check my car in until the next day. I never heard anything from them unless I called and no one called back when they said they would. Got my car back over a week later and they fixed the fuse box but said they didn’t find a leak. Every time it rains hard I find water in the trunk which means they didn’t test it for a leak. Do not bring your car here.

name: Mike Hicks
text: Blew out a tire on my jeep wrangler while on a trip from Montgomery to Atlanta and then back to Florida. Tow truck towed me to Hester's. They couldn't get that large all terrain tire until the next day. They helped me locate a hotel and even drove me to it, so that I wouldn't have to get a cab. They called me the next morning and informed me that my Jeep was ready to go. They even came and picked me up at the hotel and brought me back to their shop. Once again, saving me from having to get a cab. They got me back on the road and I was able to complete my trip with no more problems. They were all extremely nice and very professional. Can't say enough good things about them. Thanks to all the staff that helped me out of a bad predicament. You guys rock!!!

name: JaQuana Smith
text: My prices seem to be higher than others that get the same thing done there. I was charged 90 for an oil change and it was just regular oil but the guy after me was only charged 54. Also a 10% fee was added for using my debt card but I had bought tires from there 2 days before and a lady checked me out and there was no 10% fee added on that receipt and I had used the same card. My advice is have them write the price down b4 they start because they will nickel and dime u to death.

resp.text: Jaquana I am sorry you feel this way, however there are a few reasons your oil change was more. 1) Your car required a synthetic oil change which was $47.95. 2) Your car required an air filter, we ask you if you wanted us to change it and gave you the price of the air filter which was $25.13, and you told us to go ahead and change it. 3) We topped off all of your fluids including antifreeze and windshield washer fluid. In regards to the 10% fee for using a debit card, that is just untrue. We have never charged anyone for using their card. I reviewed your ticket and I would be glad to discuss with you further please feel free to give me a call at 334-576-2248. Thank you.

I know it is very frustrating and I apologize that you feel that our customer service was anything other than great.  I appreciate your feedback.

text: I'm the VP for the Buckhorn High School football quarterback club and we had a flat tire on our equipment trailor that we had brought to our game versus Cullman High School.  The staff at Cullman High referred us to Branham.  They stayed open late to replace our tire so we could make it back to Huntsville.  They are wonderful people that care about their community and will go above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service! I would recommend Branham for any automotive needs you may have.  Branham needs to open a store in Huntsville!

name: David Talmage
text: I took my 2017 Suburban in for an electrical issue, and I am so glad to say this shop restores my faith in humanity. First they were too busy to really dig into my problem, but a super nice mechanic, Phillip, spent a fair amount of time narrowing down the problem and advising me that he didn’t want to charge me for unnecessary repairs. He further advised that he believed a Chevy dealership would need to look into it, as it I was probably computer related. This is how a business should operate. They have won my business forever and I recommend them to anyone reading this. Bravo! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you David for trusting in us to take care of you and your vehicle needs. We appreciate you !

text:
Just wanted to say thanks to all at Branham and share my personal experience. You guys did an awesome job on the truck. I highly recommend giving them an opportunity for any of your automotive needs. It’s important to me to know that the actual owner of the business is present most all the time. I could tell he cared about my project just as much as I did. Him and his crew worked very hard to get the truck done and delivered as promised. For that I’m grateful. The staff there is very knowledgeable and helpful. The installer was very thorough and explained everything that he had done to the truck. Again l, can’t thank you all enough for the great service you always provide!
Ryan

text: Great customer service and stands behind their work. We got our tires, wheels and had our Jeep lifted with Branhams Accessories. They have always done the servicing and upkeep. When I heard a squeak they diagnosed the problem and fixed it. Later I realized the part was faulty, the owner met me back at the business after hours, diagnosed the problem and kept it over night to get first thing the next morning. When they pulled the faulty part off, they realized it could have damaged my brake pads. They replaced them just to make sure . This is great customer service! Thanks for taking care of your customers and my Jeep!

resp.text: Thanks Andy we appreciate you and your business. You have a great looking Jeep.

name: Julie Hughes
text:
I had an appointment for an oil change at 10:00 am. I was told that it would be ready in a couple of hours.  I left my car for 4 hours. When I arrived at 2 pm, Kyle didn’t know about my car. When he finally found the paperwork, he said,”they can put it on the rack now.”  I informed him that I had to be home by 3 pm and I live an hour away and to please just bring me my keys. He brought my keys, rudely handed them to me and said,”Bye.”
I was not rude to him. I did tell him that this happened before and that I just needed my keys.
I am more disappointed in the way he handled this. He never once apologized and seemed annoyed that I couldn’t wait.  I think 4 hours is plenty of time for a 15 min. oil change.
Customer service goes a long way!

name: Dorothy Carter
text: I was in the service  department  yesterday  I had another  service   associate. I hate too give a  bad review because  I have been  dealing  with  Nissan  since  2014 this associate  name is ADAM. MONTGOMERY he doesn't have good customer  service  skills. I watch  the other  associate  come in and out and communicate  with customers.He never communicate  beyond checkin.This was first  time the lady a the desk call too sign out for my car.I had go back in tooask for the oil sticker that goes in the window. He did enforce. me my car was ready. Maybe he was upset because  I told him I didn't  need a tire rotation  because I DID one the last visit .I just purchase  this car in August  last year. Next time I will get someone else in the service  department  not him. I Jim Burke  Nissan Sales and Service But Adam Montgomery  is not a good  associate .

name: Beth Jeszka
text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I dropped my 2005 Nissan Titian off to have some recall work completed, diagnostics ran, O2 sensors replaced and an oil change. I used one of their rental cars, as the truck would not be finished for several days. I left my truck, after giving them a budget of $1500.00, got on to the interstate and went about my day. I woke up in the morning and the car was not there. I talked it over with my roommate and we agreed i should call the police. Long story short, I tried calling Nissan to let them know the situation. I left several messages, tried calling my appointed service tech, sent an email and even had a conversation with the online chat. This happened Wednesday night- Thursday. I finally received a response, via email, stating my truck was finished. Total cost was just over $300.00. The recall work was covered, the cost was for the rental. All of the work I requested to have completed was not finished. The invoice didn't even reflect my request, the issues my truck is having or why I brought to them. In true honesty, they did complete the recall issues.
I will be staying with Benton Nissan or my personal mechanic, lesson learned.

text: Awesome people and service...period...my oil changes are free and I didn't even buy my Nissan from them...also they provide a decent military discount...did it without me even knowing or having to ask once they saw my tag. Wait times can be a little long so watch your timing.

name: Pamela Williams
text: This is by far the BEST Nissan service department I have ever had experience with. We own 3 Nissans our teenage/college kids drive and have about 25 Nissans in our company fleet. Needless to say we have a lot of experience with dealerships and I have not come across one that compares to the superior service Jim Burke Nissan provides! Ron was absolutely amazing helping our two sons who broke down just outside of Birmingham while driving back to Florida from Mississippi. If you want your vehicle worked on by a company that is honest and goes above and beyond this is the service department to go to! Thank you Ron and Jim Burke Nissan! What a top-notch company!

text:
I purchased a 2013 Pathfinder from another dealership but have an extended warranty on the vehicle so I decided to take my SUV to this location. WORST DECISION EVER. I knew it was going to take at least a week and a half to fix my vehicle but, it literally has been 3 weeks that my truck has been in the shop with no updates. I've been told it will be ready 4 different days and my vehicle is still isn't ready. Are they not on a schedule with what vehicles comes in first gets service first? I spoke the Service dept mgr Ron today (9/8) at around 2 p.m and he was suppose to give me a call but it's 4:30 and still no call. Customer Service sucks, finishing in a timely manner is definitely some bull$***
Update: Picked up my SUV on 9/10 everything seems to going good. Mr Ron the service dept mgr made sure my truck was ready before he just handed to me. If it wasn't for him I probably would've have them 0 stars.

name: Jacqoura Towns
text: Very horrible service after my radiator was replaced. I was told to continue to put water in my car which I shouldn't  have had to do that if it was replaced with a brand new radiator. For the price I spent it better have been brand new. Smh waste of money and drive and my car is still messed up. Never again will I ever visit this location or any of them because of this bad experience.

resp.text:
Hello Jacqoura, we're disappointed to see your review, but we wanted to take the time to clarify the situation. When you brought your vehicle in to have the CV axle and P/S pump replaced, you noted that your engine overheated on the way to the location. Our service technician discovered a large leak in your radiator, which you agreed to have replaced. When you let us know that your vehicle had overheated again, we discussed with you the possibility of a damaged head gasket that was causing the overheating. We believe that this is the cause of the problem and suggested adding water to prevent it from overheating while you are needing to move the vehicle. We would be happy to take a look for you, as we believe this is the cause of the overheating issue. Please let us know if we can help you with this repair. Thank you, Jacqoura.
Chris, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Julius Matthews
text:
I'm not a very car saavy guy, but do know customer service. I signed up for an appointment through USAA RepairPal and thought that this place would have integrity. I was wrong.

I took it in one week. That Friday I had to call THEM to get an update on a Lexus IS350. They told me they did a few test and had more to run. The following Tuesday they informed me that the control head need to be replaced. I told them I didn't want the work done. At that moment, not the Friday I called them, not the day I brought it to them, but that Tuesday I was informed that I would be charged $45 everyday the car remained there. Why wouldn't you inform someone of this at the initial dropoff?

So I get there and fortunately I was not charged the $45. I try to leave and the vehicle, which only the AC wasn't working and the TPS light was on. When I get the vehicle back my parking brake light, check engine light, power steering light, and my ABS light was all of a sudden on.

I used them through USAA and this is how they are with customers. Poor.

resp.text:
Hello Julius, we were disappointed to see your review. When you came in late to your appointment, we were happy to still accommodate you and take your vehicle in, and we tried to communicate that we weren't sure how long the services would take due to the schedules of our expert technicians. You seemed to understand this at the time, and you signed the storage fee disclaimer. When you called on Thursday, you said that you would pick the car up on Friday and return for the repairs on Monday. You didn't come in on Friday or Monday, so Tuesday, we called to remind you of the storage fee. We're sorry if any of the paperwork wasn't clear, and we were happy to waive the fee for you when you came to pick up your car on Thursday. We explained the repairs your car needs (which is why your warning lights are on), but we would be happy to go over this information with you again if you have any questions. We wish you the best.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Corinne Boston
text: Paid for a diagnosis on my brakes which was $40. Wanted to charge me 482+ tax for 2 rotors and brakes and said they wanted to take my old brake fluid out and put some new in,check my emergency brake and charged labor for each thing he was going to install. So after i talked it over with my granddad he told me to leave. i told them i couldn’t afford the price and then he tried to take the price down and take the brake flush and checking my back brakes off it came down to 373+tax  i thought about but i still declined. After that they did not say thank you for coming or anything. just gave me my keys. this is the second time this has happened trying to over charge don’t go here! go to tire engineers. i ended up having a friend doing my brakes paid for parts which was wayyy cheaper thank god ! Also my brake fluid was clean and did not need changing so they lied about that as well, and checking for my emergency brake ? nobody rides on there emergency brake. since i’m a young woman they will try and rip you off be careful ladies .!

resp.text:
Dear Corinne,
We are sorry that we were not able to perform the work that was needed on your brakes. We brought the price down as we wanted to keep you as a client and to make sure you were taken care of. We are happy to hear that your friend was able to help. If you need anything, please let us know.

text: Sure, they were nice and did the work, but when I got my itemized receipt checked by an independent mechanic from a different garage, their prices were way more than what should have been charged. Get a quote and get it checked by someone else before you agree to the work.

resp.text:
Dear Alesha,
We sincerely appreciated the opportunity to work with you recently to perform brake maintenance on your vehicle. The brake pads that had been previously installed by another mechanic had several broken parts that needed to be addressed. We spent over an hour trying to salvage existing parts in order to save you the expense of new calipers. Our invoice showed we only charged a portion of the hourly labor rate to keep your costs down. I would be happy to discuss all of this further with you and address your concerns in a positive manner. Please give Jamie, the owner, a call at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience.

name: Beverly Ashley
text: They recommended I get rear wheel bearings on my vehicle. My car made awful noises after the work was done, I took the car to them twice after and they still did not fix it. I had another mechanic fix the car which was the same thing the left wheel bearings. Don't take your vehicle here, they aren't trustworthy at all and cannot even fix what they mess up.

resp.text:
Dear Beverly,
Thanks for coming into our auto shop recently. We were surprised by your review since we provided you with effective communication and excellent customer service. We replaced your wheel bearing and discovered a small evac leak. You also had us replace a headlight bulb and rotate your tires.

When you came back the next day and stated you were hearing a noise, our technician, Chris, took the car for a test drive and diagnosed you needed a new tire. You left our shop and purchased a used tire and then had us install it. The next day you came back and stated you were still hearing the same noise. Chris drove the car again and indicated that the used tire was no good. We even moved the used tire to the back to make sure the noise followed the tire, which it did.

Our team did exactly what was asked of us and provided you with an honest assessment of what your vehicle needed. We wish you all the best.
Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Darlene Strong
text: Micheal and his supervisor was so ugly to me. I will never go back to them. Not once did they call me about my car to let me know what was going on and when I called them they just said you can come and it. All it need is a sensor.

resp.text:
Darlene, we're sorry to see that you had a bad experience at our store. We aren't always able to let our customers know how long work on their vehicle will last, as we aren't always sure what repairs will be needed. We apologize that there was a delay in figuring out what was wrong with the vehicle, but we unfortunately had vehicles ahead of you that needed to be taken care of first. Our goal is always to meet our customers' expectations, and we regret that we weren't able to help more. We wish you the best and hope you were able to find the service you needed.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

text: Wanted to do a new review since they replied and lied on my other one. This shop lied and said I bought a used tire and brought it to them to put on after they told me that’s what I needed to stop a noise that they caused. Good used tires down the street replaced my tire not you all. I really need you all to stick with one lie. They also doctored paperwork saying I came up there earlier this year then sent out another letter saying I didn’t.  These people are CROOKS I promise you that. I’ve been told if they find out someone else fixes your car, they pay other mechanics that people take their cars to to fix the damage they did to avoid going to court. Good things don’t come to those who lie and don’t do right by people.

name: Laura Vines
text: I took my Subaru in for an oil change.  I asked them to look at the brakes to make sure they were good since it had been awhile.  The guy told me I needed rear brakes, and offered me a good price.  I could not afford it at the time, so I waited.  In the meantime, I spoke to a co-worker, who said, "OMG, don't go there!  I was there really recently and overheard the employees talking about one of the guys there who was so bad and told people they needed work they didn't need done, and were joking about it.!"  So I took it to another place for a second opinion, and they said I did not need brakes!  So buyer, beware.  I put one star because I had to put a star to post this, but I would not put any stars if that was an option!

resp.text:
Dear Laura,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. We appreciate your review and have looked into the issue you raised. We are a family owned automotive center and we strongly enforce providing our customers with an honest assessment of their vehicle needs. We treat all vehicles like our own and value each customer’s time and money. We are sorry if you were not satisfied with your last visit to our center and welcome the opportunity to discuss all of this with you. Thank you very much!

name: travia thomas
text: We just left the shop 30mins ago & when we made it home my belt started making a strange noise. We open the hood to find the oil stick wasn't closed all the way and a drill was stuck in between my belt and melt under my hood.... Wow I hope my belt isn't ruined and I have no future problems!

resp.text:
Hello Travia,
We appreciated the opportunity to service your vehicle for you. Shortly after you left our auto center, our technician noticed one of this tools was missing and we called you immediately to confirm the tool was still under your hood. You indicated you had the missing tool and our manager sincerely apologized for any inconvenience this may have caused you. We really appreciated you bringing the tool back to our shop the next day. Once you arrived, we were happy to inspect the belt and pulleys and found no damage. This was good news.

It was our pleasure to adjust your tire pressure and also install your fog lamp bulb at no charge, to compensate for our mishap. Everything seemed fine when you left our shop and you thanked us for our assistance, so we are a bit confused by this negative review. We are happy to discuss this with you anytime, and encourage you to contact one of the owners, Rick or Jamie Martin, at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

I am very sorry to read that your vehicle is not performing adequately, Mrs. Truss. I checked our records and we were happy to replace the heater core you provided on your 1992 Chevy Caprice. After assessing the car, we recommended replacing the other heater core and hoses, which you agreed. The car was still not performing well after the second assessment, so we then recommended replacing the throttle body. You asked to take the car for a second opinion, and let us know they provided you with the same assessment; the throttle body needed replacing. We stand behind all work where the parts are provided by Precision Tune Auto Care, with a 12 month guarantee. I am happy to work with you to find an affordable and honest resolution to get your car running in a reliable manner. You can reach me at (205) 945-8863. I look forward to talking with you soon. name: Mel M
text: On Jan 19, 2019 at about 1pm I took my car to this Precision.  If I could give zero stars I would.  They were to fix a Cv boot leak and replace pads on my front breaks.  The employee got into a car accident and damaged my car.  In addition, the break work was incomplete.  I had to after waiting over 5 hours immediately return to them for noises in the breaks.  But back to the accident, the police took statements from the witnesses.  The report states it was Precision Tune and Auto care at fault.  The employee even stated he was sorry and didnt see the other driver.  They were intially so appologetic. When I tried to contact Precision about repairs the manager Chris said he was waiting on the police report.  I kindly had my insurance make a copy for him and delivered it to him.  I call week later again asking what will happen or if someone will contact me.  He gives a different story getting short with me and saying they arent responsible for anything.  I asked if his company's insurance co will call me he got short with me.  I have complained to corporate but since this is an independent franchise their hands are tied so they say.  They charged me 584 for work performed and my car still has issues and damage to the body because of the employee's negligence and nobody is willing to fix the issue.  Who wrecks your car and then tells you their not responsible.  Well the manager Chris did.

text:
I WILL NOT DO THIS AGAIN.

SOOOOOO...where to begin. So this is my third visit to this campus, and needless to say, I'M PISSED. In a twenty-four hour period, I've seen this place three time, with minimum 1.5 hour wait, except for today. I come in the third time for the oil change with tire rotation, and I am denied service same day for the rotation. Ask for the same discount on tire rotations with oil changes since I have to come..even back again, and I am denied that. I understand business is jumping, but I would've been fine with a 50% off (normally $60), but can't even do that. Being a customer here the last minimum 5 years, this has to be the worst service and answer I've received, definitely when I'm spending my time to come and patronize, and giving chance after chance.

text:
This place just tried to charge me 546.00 for a tune up!!!!! 36.00 per spark plug, &226.00 for labor!!!! I went and bought my spark plugs for 46.00(all six) and  the mechanic isn't charging a third of the price they are asking! This is highway robbery!!!!

Then I called another Precision Auto Tune and was quoted almost $200 less for the same service on the same car what in the heck is going on at that Homewood location that is really sad $200 more that is so ridiculous!!!!!

text: I was freaked out by the negative reviews for this place, but the price was good so I figured I could give it a try. My experience was no fuss and fast, and I'm glad I gave it a try after all.
