name: Katherine Miller
text: I wish I did not even have to give one star as this place is so awful. I have paid close to $1,500 in repairs here just for my axle to break because it was not properly repaired. Now that another mechanic has my vehicle he told me the control arms were put on incorrectly causing further damage to the car, the sway bar linkage was held by electrical tape, and I'm lucky I didn't lose control of my car and kill myself driving it in the condition WHICH I PAID WELL TO HAVE FIXED! It is not only completely shady and unethical but dangerous. I hope someone sues this place and gets them shut down before they kill somebody! Seriously, don't take your car here unless you want a near death experience.

resp.text:
Dear Katherine,
We are very sorry to read that your recent visit to our Precision Tune Auto Care center did not meet your expectations. It is our sincere intention to provide every customer with exceptional service. We are very proud to offer a 12 month, 12,000 mile warranty on all services, when the parts are provided by our center. We were happy to allow you to provide your own parts for us to install and our team recommended other services, noted on your inspection sheet. The axle is under warranty and we look forward to working with you in order to find a positive resolution. Please contact Rick at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

name: Tashona Reese
text: Seems I'm not the only person who's gotten ripped off at this location. I was charged $800.00 for a Brake job. I paid because I was told my brakes were at 10% and having started a new job across town, I didn't want to take a chance to continue driving on them. The staff was super friendly as long as they got their money but, when I called the next day to inquire about how they price their parts, of course nobody knew anything. I left my number for the manager to call me back, this was in September, 2015 and I still have not received a call. I also reached out to corporate and they informed me that it's out of their hands because each location is independently owned, but they would however forward my complaint/ info on to the regional maanger, who I have yet to hear from. I have no problem paying for services rendered, but I do have a problem when businesses are shady.Do not go to this location.

resp.text:
Dear Tashona,
My name is Rick Martin and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. I read your recent review and am sorry that you feel we overcharged you. We went over all of the costs with you before beginning the service on your vehicle and you approved everything. We do not wish to lose your business, so please contact me to discuss this further and hopefully we can find a positive resolution. I tried to contact you and got only as far as voicemail. I look forward to hearing from you. Thank you, Rick (205) 760-9904!

name: Jeff Kumelos
text: The owner of this store, Rick, is a good man and an honest man.  If you are unhappy with work that has been done by his staff, contact him.  He will return your telephone call and work with you to resolve the issue.

resp.text:
Hello Concerned Parent, I wanted to let you know that we are very sorry that you felt like your daughter was not taken care of to your satisfaction. I am a parent too, and I truly understand the value of a trustworthy vehicle for our children to drive, especially when they go away to college.

I spoke with our manager and he tested the battery when your daughters vehicle was towed to our shop. Our testing indicated the battery was defective and also showed swelling on the side. When a new battery was installed, the car started and your daughter was able to drive it once again.

We are a family owned auto shop that takes great pride in providing each customer with honest, affordable, and friendly car maintenance. I would be more than happy to discuss all of this with you, in hopes of reaching an amicable solution. Please contact me at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience, or provide me with the best way to reach you and the best time to call at the following email address: jmartin@ptacit.com. I look forward to talking with you. Thank you.
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Danny Vines
text: These people will rip you off. Charge you for parts and service that you don't need and take advantage of people in desperate situations. Stay away from this place at all costs.

resp.text:
I am saddened that your recent experience at our auto center did not exceed your expectations, Danny. We work very hard to provide each customer with honest, affordable and professional auto maintenance solutions. We towed your 2000 Jeep Cherokee to our shop after you could not get it started at a local gas station. After running a few diagnostic tests we concluded the starter was bad and you agreed to have it replaced. Once that was done we continued with our testing and also recommended replacing the ignition switch, which you also agreed to have replaced. When asked if we could put the old starter back into the vehicle, we recommended not doing this, since our comprehensive testing showed the old starter was bad. Autozone ran a test on the old starter as well and came to the same conclusion; the old starter was bad and should not be reinstalled.  I am happy to work with you to get your vehicle back on the road and can be reached at the number shown below. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham
(205) 945-8863

name: Frank Buchanan Jr. (VooDoo)
text:
The employees of this location is not well versed in customer satisfaction and have a tendacy to have a sharp mouth. One of the store managers has manhood issues and thinks that all should bow down into him when he's nothing but pie. His name is Chris and have been employed by Precision multiple times...he has been known to steal cash from the register and also, had a bad drug habit as well. I'd strongly advise that you take your vehicle elsewhere. The owner of this Precision also has other locations around town and he doe not care about truth concerning how his business is ran but rather gotten money hungry at the expense of his employees and the customers.  Nor is their word any good for they tell you what you wanna hear but not man enough to deliver. All Precision Tune locations need to be under new management or close their doors for good.
I speak this in truth for I was once employed with this establishment. I'm an ASE Master Certified Diesel & Gas Technician...yet was treated with disrespect and was lied to about the pay scale. I've seen firsthand the deceit & trickery of staff. Nor do they abide by standards placed before them in order to maintain a respectable business. Of course there's more to the story but enough has been said to bring the customers awareness up..for it is my duty & obligation to expose such when at the customers expenses.
It speaks volumes when you bring things to their attention yet they fail to acknowledge you or allow an explanation....so I chose to terminate my employment and since then...I've been trying to contact those in charge so that I may retrieve my other toolbox at the Pelham location but have yet been able to. Goes to show the level of care when they lose a highly trained technician because the so called service manager has no real knowledge of automobiles but is allowed to make decisions above his experience...but I'm being hindered in accessing all my tools since i can't the owners to meet me there to get my belongings. The Pelham store momentarily closed due to lack of business but yet they don't see as to why when it's self evident.
Please take your business elsewhere...even if it's to one like Hellen Keller...you'd have a better chance of getting professional lasting repairs.

Attention to management: I need my tools from the Pelham location and have notified Chris and txt Rick only to receive absolutely no reply. If interested in the truth....please contact me....

resp.text:
Hello Frank,
We always appreciate receiving reviews from our valued customers based on services received. Since you have not been a customer at our auto shop, I believe this review in in direct violation of the Google Review Guidelines which state: "Off-topic reviews: Don’t post reviews based on someone else’s experience, or that are not about the specific place you’re reviewing. Reviews aren’t meant to be a forum for general political or social commentary or personal rants.” We kindly ask that you remove this review from our Google page. I am happy to make sure you have all of your tools mentioned, and encourage you to please contact Jamie at (205) 945-8863 to make arrangements. Thank you!
Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

Dear ra duhon,
I am sorry to read our services did not meet your expectations and wanted to respond to your review. When you first came to us we were happy to repair the issue with the main seal with parts you provided. When we install parts from the customer, they are not covered by any warranty. We reviewed all of our security tapes and found no foul play regarding items removed from your vehicle while on our premises. Since we could not seem to find a positive resolution, a release was signed by you stating a full refund was provided, and all maintenance was performed to your satisfaction. We are sorry to read that you are experiencing automotive issues. Our records indicate when the vehicle was brought to us, the engine was running hot from the fan not working and we also detected metal shavings in the coolant system. We recommended repairing both issues at a very fair price, and you asked us to only replace the fan. Our main goal for all of our customers is to provide honest and affordable automotive repair solutions and stand behind our work, which we feel we did throughout this entire process. We are more than happy to discuss all of this further with you in hopes of reaching a reasonable solution. Please contact our Precision Tune Auto Care center at (205) 945-8863. Thank you!

name: Keonte Gaddis
text: This is one of the most aggravating, frustrating experiences I’ve had in a longgg time! I took my car to Kia because my air wasn’t working they kept my car for a day and a half. I got my car back the air was working fine. I didn’t pay anything. About a week later I went back in for my follow up appointment because I was informed to bring the car back so they could check my Freon levels. I took the car back and the rep that car up to me informed me it would be 139.00 for a diagnostic reading. I got upset because if you charge to do a diagnostic reading why wasn’t that service performed the first time. I ended up getting a phone call back from a guy named Jaizon, that apologized about my previous encounter with the pricing and he informed me I wasn’t supposed to pay anything for the diagnostic fee.  I took my car back to the dealership and left it. A few hours later I get a phone call from a totally difference representative that tells me I’m going to have to pay 280 dollars for them to figure out what’s wrong with my car. I informed them to have my car ready for me to pick it up then five minutes later the same rep called me back and stated they would knock 100 dollars off of the 280 to make it 170 for the diagnostic fee. I’ve gotten literally four prices for simply finding out what’s wrong with my car. I’ve wasted my time, and gas by making trips up there that was a complete waste of time! I’ve gotten more lies and inaccuracy from this company than any other company in Huntsville thus far. And I’ve only been in Huntsville about 2 years. They will NEVER have to worry about me bringing my car there again. That’s for sure! Giving them one star is too much credit, I wish I could remove it too!!! If you thinking about going DONT DO IT!!!

name: Donna Stanton
text: KIA of Huntsville has had my 2016 (with less than 70,000 miles) Kia Sorento for 20 days now to fix a sun roof issue... not once have I been contacted about the status.I received 4 emails about my service appointment but nothing now that they have my vehicle.  I have called numerous times trying to find out what is taking so long since my car is covered under the warranty that I purchased when I brought the car from Kia of Huntsville. Charlie Musick is the advisor and said he would return my call all 4 times but not once has he called to let me know the situation. I WILL NOT BUY ANOTHER CAR FROM HERE DUE TO THAT FACT IF SOMETHING TARES UP (EVEN AS SIMPLE AS THE SUN ROOF) IT TAKES OVER 3 WEEKS TO FIX IT!

text: The gentleman tested the battery,  starter and alternator. Determined the battery was going bad, replaced the battery for me. It was on a 2017 Chevrolet work truck, takes a bit to change the battery but he accomplished it. Great guy, very knowledgeable and provided great service.

text: It's a nice store, but I've been in twice to get washer fluid and they never seem to have any. Seems like a basic thing so I cant give full stars.

text: Great staff on hand helpful and knowledgeable.  Doing front brakes on my 2004 Accord, picked up pads and grease, headed home to start, busted a wheel lug getting the tire off.  Back to the store, had the lug bolt and nuts on hand :).   Always have what I need and if not they have had it there within 90 minutes.  Welcome to the neighborhood, nice to have you in the area.

text: The store is not bad it’s the driveway. I copied the review that I made to the adjoining business that shares the same entrance. It’s the terrible concrete mountains they installed in the front entrance. If your pulling a boat or trailer of any sort be prepared for scuffed rims and dented fenders. And even if your not pulling a trailer be prepared to jump rockie mountains and slam down into the Grand Canyon when turning in. Whoever decided to install this needs to go back to architecture school because they FAILED. So please tear down the Berlin Wall so that customers can come and go without destroying their property!!

Congratulations you outwaited me. 4 months and I never rushed them. I just wanted it right. I don't think they have a paint booth.  Stick to working on tires.  See you in court.

The job will done right the first time..

text: This is the place to go for all of your tire needs! If I could give them 10 stars I would. The location is extremely clean, the staff are excellent, & the customer service is phenomenal. I recommend this location & I will continue to come to this location for all my car/tire needs! Thank you guys so much, especially Corey, y’all are the best!!!!

resp.text: Honesty is one of our core values and we take all customers feedback to heart. Thank you for alerting us, Jason. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concern. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? resp.text: Aww, group hug. We love having you in the TD family, Chris. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

Sam brought out car back and was very polite and professional. A+
- Tanner Armstrong

text: I would give zero stars if could, because that's exactly how much service I received. Had a 2pm appointment for oil change, showed up at 1:45pm. He said they would get right on it. At 3:20pm, over 1.5 hours later, I hadn't heard a peep from anyone. I got up to check on it, on crutches BTW, and see my vehicle sitting in the parking lot. I thought it was complete, and asked why no one let me know. He informed me that they hadn't even touched it yet. I asked for my keys, and voiced my displeasure. He handed me my keys, and never once offered any kind  of apology . Why take appointments if you have no intention of honoring it?!

resp.text: Thank you for the alert, Shaun. We definitely respect your time & take your feedback seriously. We do get backed up from time to time, but the team should be providing updates throughout to let you know of any unexpected delays. That being said, we'd like to connect & learn more. If possible, please send your preferred method of contact to support@tirediscounters.com. Once received, a member of the team will reach out. We value your insight and hope to chat soon.

text: These guys are awesome! They have always treated us right. My wife works next door and they will bring the car to her and drop it off. name: Daniel Webster
text: I purchased almost 2 thousand dollars worth of tires from this location for a 2008 dodge dually in September 2020. On February 15th 2021 I took truck in for a rotation and brake inspection. They did the rotation wrong and put two tires that were worn way down and put on outer tears which started skinning them fast. Less than 200 miles down the road and the rear brake pads were metal on metal yet they supposedly just did a brake inspection. Today I took truck back so they could address the issues they cause and they wanted me to pay for their errors. I was fine with covering costs of brakes but the tires was their error. They did want to take care of me the customer. I picked my truck up and will leave this same review on every site I can find and contact an attorney Monday morning to address this matter.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, Daniel. We've got an open ticket for ya in our system and we'll be in touch to get to the bottom of this soon. Make sure to send us your contact info if you haven't already done so to support@tirediscounters.com. Talk soon.

name: Stephen Youngblood
text:
I made an 8 am appointment to get one tire changed. I learned don’t ever make an 8 am appointment. It’s 830 and my truck still hasn’t even been pulled in so now I have to scramble to reschedule meetings this morning. Use discount tire instead they keep their appointment times and don’t have people laying out tire displays instead of taking care of customers. Then when they get it in and go to put the new tire on the guy stands there for 5 minutes texting instead of installing my tire....over an hour and a half for one tire as the first appointment of the day and first one signed in.

DO NOT USE FIND SOMEWHERE BETTER

We have pulled up your invoice and will be creating a customer escalation ticket to be reviewed by the Regional Manager who will be contacting you shortly. Thank you for being a valued Tire Discounters customer and we hope to see you again when you need us!

The service was top notch and they were very friendly and professional. The shop and waiting area was very clean.

name: Stan D
text: I brought a tire in to have a leaky bead fixed, and was told they couldn't touch it because it was older than 2007, and it was against the law. Also, their oil changes are wayyyy to expensive.  You can go pretty much anywhere else and save some cash.

resp.text: We take the care of our customer's vehicles very seriously. Thank you for informing us, Stan. We want to dig in to learn more about your experience and work to improve going forward. If you could, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon!

name: Swainer (swainer)
text: These guys are incredible. ALL OF THEM! I have always gone to Discount Tires ...up until now.  I have never met a bunch of guys with better customer service than these guys. We had a situation where we were traveling in our BMW i3 and had a blow-out and nobody- not even the BMW dealership in Huntsville had the tire in stock that our car required. Each and every one of them genuinely cared about our situation and never stopped trying to help us figure it out and get us back on the road. These guys went out of there way and took care of us and got what we needed done.  If I even lived in a 50 mile radius of this store and these guys they would have my business all day long. I cant say enough about these guys... it makes me feel really good that there are still people like this on this planet.  Don't go anywhere else, I can promise you that theres nobody else going to take care of you better than they can.

resp.text: Yeahhhhhh buddy! Glad we were able to take care of ya, Mark. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us. We love having you in the TD family.

name: Steve Zanussi
text:
After noticing at a road stop that there was a bubble on the sidewall of my tire while on a long trip, I went to the closest Tire Discounters I could find.  There I was told that it would be at least three hours to change my tire.  They referred me to this location--8873 Highway 72, Huntsville--several miles away.

Upon entering I was greeted by the General Manager, Tyler Thurmond, who assessed the tire, and notified me that they did not have my tire in stock.  (They did have it in stock at the first place, but they had never checked.)  Tyler told me that it would take an hour and a half to get the tire there, but that once they had it, it could be put on very quickly.

Tyler had the delivery of the tire expedited for us, because we mentioned that we had to get up north by a set time.  The entire visit took about 45 minutes, including the delivery of the tire.

Thank you so much, Tyler Thurmond, for your exceptional customer service.  If I find myself needing a tire in Huntsville again, I know where I will go.

resp.text: Wowzeritos! Thanks for the review, Steve. We really appreciate the 5 stars and hope to see ya again for any of your tire or auto care needs! Take a look at our full services at https://tirediscounters.com/services

name: Andrew Smith
text: BUYER BEWARE!  I would recommend to do research on any pricing they give you.  Here is what happened.  Called got a verbal quote of $139-189 per axle for a brake job with rotor's turned which is fair they are just below the dealer which was $200 per axle.  Went the next day to have services done to my car.  Before they began work they inspected it and determine I needed pads all the way and rotor's on the rear and a brake fluid exchange.  Estimate price was over $700.  I declined the brake fluid exchange and they offered some "competitive" discounts brought my total down to about $580.  Still more than it should be.  Asked for a printed estimate when I saw the estimate I knew something was up.  They had part numbers and prices on the estimate.  Quick Google search confirmed the part numbers and prices from a local part supply store that they would be getting the parts from.  They are marking up parts pricing 100+%.  Industry standard is between 10-25%.  Then they told me that the estimate was nearly at cost and if he went any lower he would lose his job.  Nothing but scam and scare tactics were used with me and I didn't take the bait.  Tried to email the address on the general managers card it wouldn't ever go through.  Called the corporate office gave them the info and the pictures I have attached here and they said a regional manager would get back with me still have not heard from that person either.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE AND THE CHECK ANY PRICES THEY GIVE YOU!

resp.text: We take pride in our craft and place a great amount of emphasis on pricing ourselves competitively. We are continuously evaluating. We want to dig in to learn more. If you are willing, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon.

text: Excellent customer service ! I was out with my daughter, and the tire light came on pulled in to another facility they said it would be a couple of hours they were busy. I then drove to tire discounters and pulled in to see if I could get air in my tires. The service guy filled up my tires, but informed me I had a nail in one of my tires. Jody and Sarah got my car  straight in to the garage and my tire being fixed.  The customer service that the two of them and there staff showed today helped turn a bad day into a BLESSED DAY. My daughter and I sat for a little bit and before I knew it the tire was repaired. Thanks  guys for helping us out ! We will definitely come back to see you in the future !

text: We have been here multiple times and treated badly every time. The last straw was when the manager promised to take in both of our vehicles in one day. When we came to pick up the first car, the same manager acted like we had two heads and told us he couldn't service our second vehicle since they were too busy. It really irritates me when people make promises they can't keep. When we explained why we were upset, we just got brushed off and told to have a nice day. Their customer service is very poor and I will be taking my business to Tire Engineers. I've been treated like a valued customer each time I have visited their locations.

text: Brought my truck to be painted 3 weeks ago. 3 full weeks. At drop off i was told 1 and a half weeks it would be done , maybe less. There is no reason  to come here at all. Driving your car damaged or with messed up paint is better than not having a car at all which is what i have gotten from here.

name: Kev Nelson
text:
*ATTENTION* PLEASE READ ALL REVIEWS. I wanted to believe these bad reviews were a result of difficult to please customers but no.

This companies bad reviews are well deserved. STAY AWAY IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR CAR. THEY ARE CHEAP FOR A REASON.

Let me begin with management. The store seems to be ran by two extremely incompetent girls Ashley and April. There were several issues with my car that I did not know about till I called.

They ordered parts for my car without my permission and thought I was gonna pay for it. Think again! They refused to give a contact for the franchise owner.

Only after I threatened file a police report they called and told me to get my car. Half done, half out painted. Car looks far worse than when it went in.

Ashley the so-called manager was especially snotty. I asked for a specific paint they agreed then used oem as if I wouldn't notice. Bottom line I'm far from done with joke of a company. I will be filling suit for damages.

I don't know why anyone would leave a business to 2 stupid girls they must be family.

text:
If I could give them 6 stars, I would but there are only 5.  The personnel in this shop are highly skilled - they fixed all model cars-  friendly, kind and thoughtful.

The belt to our Subaru Outback while traveling on I-10W broke or was torn. We got stranded and had to be towed to Bodiford Automotive by recommendation of AAA.  It so happened that the hotel nearby was sold out and we were traveling home for the Thanksgiving holiday. We spent the night in our car in the parking lot of Bodiford. When the first personnel showed up to open the shop, my husband went to talk to her to notify her of our predicament. My husband came back to the car and told me that she’s making coffee and that we could use the bathroom, and look at the car as soon as the shop opens.

They fixed our car emergency as soon as they opened.  We were backed on the road in two hours. If they were close where we live, Bodiford Automotive  will be our new service advisors.  Thank you very much!

name: Paul Mince
text:
Awesome shop and even better people…we were sort of in a bind and Mr. Frank Bodiford personally took care of us.  We were out of state visiting Alabama when the transmission went out on my SUV.  I didn’t know my transmission was bad or about to kick the bucket.  We called around to several nearby shops but no one seemed to have time to take us in.  We were traveling with our three young kids and the situation was getting grim.  We eventually made it around to calling Bodiford’s Automotive Service.  Frank Bodiford attempted to remedy the situation while on the phone. However, all attempts to get out of first/second or go in reverse didn’t work.  I tried putting an additive from AutoZone in the transmission but it was a no go (mind you I am not a car guy).  Mr. Bodiford agreed to look at the vehicle.  It took about 30 minutes to arrive because we could not go over 10-20 mph.  It was late on a Friday and he obviously had other vehicles to repair, which I know now is a testament to his service and crew.  We basically were at his mercy.

Mr. Bodiford immediately took in our vehicle.  His staff ensured we felt like family.  They put on a movie for the kids and made us comfortable as possible.  Although, I was sweating bullets because I figured we were about to get taken advantage of given our urgent situation.  I began searching online for transmission replacement cost, estimated repairs, solenoid issues, etc. and was shell shocked at the prices.  It became apparent we needed transmission work immediately or was not getting very far.  Mr. Bodiford soon emerged and confirmed our fears.  We were weighing our options about how to get back home, getting the vehicle serviced, paying for the diagnostics, paying Frank for the time he took to service the vehicle, etc.  It seemed a bad situation was just getting worse; I was ready to just pay up, get a rental, and be done with the situation.  Mr. Bodiford provided us with all the information needed to help get us situated.  To my surprise they were able to get the vehicle into reverse and the transmission was at least operable.  Apparently, they disengaged the transmission safe mode and used an additive the actually worked.  I stood there with credit card in hand and Mr. Bodiford declined.  He serviced the vehicle as much as he could at the last minute and we were ripe for the taking; however, he wouldn’t take a penny.  I stood there in disbelief and was extremely grateful.  I was thinking about the bad publicity some mechanic shops get and here Mr. Bodiford stood just as concerned, courteous, and empathetic to our situation as if we were his family.  We departed Bodiford's Automotive and traded in the vehicle that evening.  We didn’t want to press our luck with trying to drive home.  Although we took a hit on the trade-in value because of the transmission, we were just elated with Mr. Bodiford and his crew.  Hopefully I do not have any repair needs in the immediate future since I now have a newer vehicle but if so, I am taking it to Mr. Bodiford.  Enough cannot be said when you deal with good people. We sincerely thank them.

resp.text: Wow! Just seeing this great rating and comments. We appreciate your business and kind words.

name: Walt H
text:
My daughters '05 CR-V had a possible battery-drain/Charging system issue. Battery was dead after the car was sitting for 5 days. She got a jump and headed to Advanced-Auto. They replaced the battery (it needed to be replaced anyway) and then they did a charging system check - inconclusive...it *may* be the alternator .

This is when we  found Whitt's  - they confirmed it was not the charging system but rather a parasitic load on the system,  a 0.6A draw killed her battery over 5 days.  Whitt's found the offending culprit and we were out the door for less than $60.   Very pleased with their service.

resp.text: Thank You For The Great Review

They told me that this is a very hard job (lie) and they have some fancy $100k dollar machine that can read the engine light code. So I paid them $150 for reading the code. Until now I found that Autozone can do it for free with exactly the same machine which itself cost less than $150. Lol. Very bad experience. Very blantant lie. I wouldn't trust these guys with anything. Your car is very important and car accident can cost your life so don't let liars touch it.

But they tightened the cables so much so that it is IMPOSSIBLE to get them off to take the battery in for testing and even bent part of the battery cable. We tried forever to unhook it till the point that the cable broke with the nut still attached to the battery. So now we have to replace both the battery AND the cable. 0 stars for further breaking my car.

text:
If I could give them a negative rating I would. My car was rear ended a week ago, the police had Arnold's to tow it without asking me first and I was told by the tow truck driver I wouldn't have to pay anything because they would get it from the person's insurance that hit me. I was advised to let it stay there until the insurance adjuster looked at it. Well, she falsified the police report and didn't have insurance. I still had to pay to get my car from them. $460 for it to be there a week today. $35 a day plus the initial tow fee and gate fee.
Then when I went to pick it up, they couldn't find the key to it. Tried to say we took it with us that night. Finally, they found it in their rollback after about 30 minutes of looking for it. A place of business needs to be better organized when dealing with other people's property. Also, if their employees don't know the rules, they don't need to be giving advice on what they will or will not do.

text:
I just would like to say the people who work at this shop are amazing. I was traveling home after my memorial weekend trip to Huntsville. On my way home to Chattanooga my car started acting funny and then over heated right outside of Scottsboro. This has never happened to me and I was completely freaked out. While I let my car cool, I called around to the auto shops to try to get an idea on prices and to tell them I was on my way because it was nearing 5 when everyone would be closing.
Once I arrived at Arnold’s auto repair I explained to the mechanic, Clark, what had happened and he listened through me freaking out. He got my car to where I could get safely back to Chattanooga and they were a lot cheaper than everywhere else I called. If I lived in Scottsboro I would definitely send everyone their way. Fair pricing and amazing service. ❤️❤️❤️

name: Melia F.
text: I have been to this location 6 times and I will continue to come back! My mom just left this location about 20 minutes ago after my recommendation to her and she called me to tell me how impressed she was with the employees and their willingness to go out of their way, specifically Conlee this morning. I used to be one of those people who ONLY got serviced at the dealership but this Express is so impressive. The employees are mainly younger guys but they are all polite, patient, and personable! The managers, Tim specifically, are also patient, and helpful both on the phone and in store and truly take time out of their day to talk to you about servicing, previous records, dates of service, and HONEST recommendations. You will NOT wait in line here like you will at the dealership, the longest time I've waited for the entire oil change to be done is 15 minutes here, and that included the "wait" to begin. Everyone here has a great attitude and a willingness to help! I cannot say enough positive things about this Express location, you will always be treated like a human and not just the next car in line.

text: Breaks started scraping the night before on a trip home to DC. Showed up unannounced before opening and AJ took me right in and got me underway in under 2 1/2 hours for brand new rear breaks. Fair pricing and outstanding service. A very happy customer on his way home. Thanks!

name: Stu Man
text: Unprofessional and shady.  They wanted me to pay them $2300.00 for repairs and when I picked the car up to get another opinion they acted like the biggest jerks. They either had no idea what they were doing, or they were trying to stick it to me. Either way, that’s not the experience I have ever had at other locations. I recommend steering clear of the Homewood location, the location on West Valley is much better.

name: Holly Carr
text: Went to this location for an oil change, but my tire pressure light was on so I got them to check on this too.  One of my tires was entirely too low (pressure at 15 when should be at 35, all other tires were only at 30).  Any knowledgeable technician would have removed my tire to check for a leak, but he insisted the tire was fine.  After filling the tires & resetting, the tire pressure light was still on.  He told me not to worry and to "be careful" with that tire--incredibly vague.  Turns out there was a leak, which left me with a flat tire & stranded in Atlanta the next day.  It's clear that the technicians I dealt with had a blatant disregard for my safety and the safety of my vehicle.  I will never return to another Express Oil Change, nor recommend this location to anyone I know.

text: Quick service, friendly technicians, easy to understand options! Adam was very helpful with understanding what we needed and how long it would take/how much it would cost! I will be returning!

name: Matthew Tucker
text:
I noticed gas dripping near my fuel filter.  I didn't know for sure exactly where or what was causing it, didn't want to spend my only free evening of the week with my wife and kid trying to figure it out, but also didn't want to leave a leak overnight so I took off work early to go get it fixed.  My vehicle needed an oil change as well anyway so I took it in and explained it was likely the filter or one of the lines that needed replaced.

Sure they changed my oil no problem, but the guy came around and said he wouldn't fix the leak, that it was a "missing o-ring that they didn't carry in stock" and I'd need to take it back to whoever put the existing filter on and have them do the repair.  Now, I replace my filters every 40,000 miles or so and I've moved a couple of times since then.  I have no idea where I was exactly when I replaced my filter last, because it's a small fix.  I got there at 4:30 pm, close of business at 6, so it wasn't like I pulled up at quitting time.  I had to take more time off work the next morning to disconnect everything myself and find it was simply a hairline crack in the filter.  The mechanic that I talked to didn't even verify anything, except what I already knew that yep there's a fuel leak there.  He just spewed some bs that he thought sounded good because he didn't feel like doing his job... REPLACING A DAMAGED FUEL FILTER SO I'M NOT DRIPPING GASOLINE EVERYWHERE I GO.

I'll find somewhere else for auto service, and I'd recommend you do the same if it's anything other than an oil change.

resp.text: Hi Matthew. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

text: Had oil changed by Express and afterafter I noticed my car leaking oil. I took it back to Express and the guy said it was leaking from the drain plug and for me to go purchase one and bring it back and he would replace it. I take it back the next day and still leaking after replacing it and so the guy proceeds to say I need a new oil pan and they would email me the price for oil pan and installation. A week went by and I never received the email nor a phone call. I took my car to the dealer and and they replaced my oil pan. They said it was stripped and they (Express) had try to repair it with a repair kit but obviously didn't work. My car was not leaking oil before I took it to Express but was after they changed my oil and so they costed me $560+. I will not be going back to Express for anything.

name: phil lindley
text: I used to only drive big name brand tires$$$, which were usually put on at Sam's or Costo. After an issue with one of the $$$ tires purchased, I found out they are not a typical stock item and I'd have to wait for several days. Since I needed it repaired immediately, I drove directly to Pete Shirley and told them to get close on the orginal tires ratings (speed/trac/hardness) with something they normally stock and replace all 4. Not only did they drive the same,  they were significantly cheaper than the big name brands. The biggest plus, I was back on the road in about an hour. I've waited over 4hours at some places in the past. Since, I've replaced tires on my other 4 vehicles using Pete Shirley. Asked them to put on something they normally stocked on these 4 vehicles, and all road out great, and in and out of the store in a timely manner. They also don't sell the gimmicky road side warranty. But I'd bet they'd do all they could to help you out if something happens outside of the tires warranty.

text: I’m 60 yrs old; and have never enjoyed an oil change until today. I pulled up to the obviously vacant area. Guy came out immediately and asked about my needs. (All employees distancing or masked). Another directed me over the pit. One of 3 Kevins came to my truck window and managed my request. (I got Short Kevin; they have also have a tall Kevin and an ugly Kevin) They were very professional! It was like watching a perfectly choreographed dance. I never exited my vehicle; and observed the same superlative service being given to customers to my left and right. Short Kevin, AJ  and Clayton were very professional and consulted me at every milestone of their service (which I was watching!). They were also genuinely friendly!!

name: Heath King
text: The guys over at Express Oil in Muscle Shoals are unbelievable.  Lots of drive up oil change places have a faded old sign hanging up that lists their free 200 point inspection, but you end up leaving with no low fluid levels, a stripped oil plug, and nothing more said about the condition of your vehicle than "it's full of oil." Not these guys, they are in a league by themselves. They do great work, they are knowledgeable,  friendly, reliable and most important, Honest! Best of all they have another shop on site with techs that can do a wide range of repairs and diagnostics. Plainly put, you can rest assured that you, your wife, your teenager, etc will drive off with a well-serviced vehicle, Every Time!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Heath! We’re glad you’re satisfied with the support you received from our team and hope to do business with you again in the future!

text: While working out of town company truck broke down due to a fuel filter. Truck died pulling in parking lot. Shot starter fluid to get fired back up and was told they could not change filter unless a full diagnosis was run on truck. I asked if we could buy a fuel filter for truck and was told no. Asked where closest part store was, I was told and I quote "we have several around". Very disappointed in customer service. Will not be back to this place

Please visit us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and leave your contact information, as well as the details of your experience, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: Mary Hall
text: I usually use a different service, but they were very backed up so I drove down the road just to have my tires checked because my TP light came on. The gentleman looked at my low tire for about 30 seconds and told me there was a nail and because of where it was on the tire they wouldn’t be able to patch it and I needed a whole new tire. Also that the tread on all my tires was getting low so I needed a whole new set. The set he tried to sell me was almost $1,000. Luckily I had my dog in the back seat, so I had a good excuse to get out of there and tell them I’d come back later. I don’t know a whole lot about cars, but I know when my tire tread looks low and I’ve got at least until the end of this year or the beginning of next before I’ll need new tires. And as for the one with the nail, my cousin patched it and I’ve driven to Birmingham and back on it with no problem at all. Seems like to me they saw a single woman and assumed I wouldn’t have any sort of knowledge and tried to take advantage.

resp.text: Hi Mary. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

Coffee, a notebook and some small car part (not even sure what it was) were left in my car, none of which were mine, all of which I threw away. name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Jason Hughes
text:
Jaye at the front desk was very professional and courteous and the service was awsome so far, however I was charged 4 hours labor and it only took 2.. At over 100$ an hour labor, I had over 200 dollars stolen from me where service's were not performed... I have dealt with the public for a lot of years and in no way would my conscience allow me to do this to  my customers and then
try to  justify it by saying my computer says I have to.... This was my first and last time visiting Meineke...

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Jason. Our car care professionals are all about building trust and confidence. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: The service and this branch location was impeccable. Hunter the manager & my tech specialist Isaac were professional courteous and really went the extra mile to ensure that I was satisfied. They have definitely gained my business and I would personally recommend this location!

resp.text: Thank you for your wonderful review, Javan! Exceptional work and exceptional service are what it's all about. Thanks for shouting out Hunter, Isaac, and the team. You can count on our crew to go the extra mile. Happy to hear about the great work on your vehicle!

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: Let's see. I dropped my car off with no problems, just wanted a tune up. Get car back and check engine light is on. Cars run rough I was told I put bad gas in it. Find out they put bad spark  plugs on. Told they flushed coolant  but didnt.

name: Tia Wheeler
text: They were very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. As a woman, I felt respected. Good Covid19 precautions underway.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Tia! The safety of our customers and team members is always our first priority, and we are taking steps to protect the health and well-being of our team and customers. We have implemented a number of precautions based on the advice of the Centers for Disease Control, The World Health Organization and other health authorities to minimize the risk of transmission of COVID-19 for both team members and customers alike. You can continue to expect the same great level of service from us!

name: Alex Sims
text: Brought my car that was occasionally stalling out to get diagnosed and fixed up. They found the issue and fixed it. After a few hours, the work was done and they said they test drove my car to make sure it was working properly. I picked my car up right before they closed tonight and went on my way. Within 2 minutes, my car died in the middle of the street. The bumping and RPM fluctuations progressively got worse, and by the time i was able to get off the road, the car would only coast in drive. If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

resp.text: We understand your concerns, Alex. We want to make sure we are doing car care right. We are escalating your concerns internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to regain your trust and confidence.

name: Kathleen Mason
text: My radiator was leaking and I was having a hard time finding a place to fix it. They diagnosed it quickly and got a new radiator in the next morning (I first arrived 2 hours before close) and my car was fixed up before lunch the next day. They also did an oil change, replaced a filter, and looked at my tires. They had a shuttle also. Overall I was impressed.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Kathleen! We're glad to hear you had an easy and seamless experience. We're here to take all the stress out of auto services.

name: Robert Terry
text:
Absolutely stay away from this location. Do not trust them to perform a simple oil change. When you are charged for an oil filter that is not installed, it is called fraud. When you refuse to stand behind your work, You are not reputable. If you expect them to return your calls, you will be waiting till the cows come home.

Update-  Local store representative indicated "Corporate" would reimburse me for damage to oil cap housing.  "Corporate" called indicating any damages are the responsibility of the "Franchisee".  Once again, each is passing the buck but the customer gets hosed.  If the Franchisee is using the name "Meineke",  Corporate should be taking  more responsive action.  If you proclaim that you are customer oriented and responsive, just do the right thing and pay for the parts charged but not installed and the damage you caused.

resp.text: Meineke is all about trust, professionalism, and expertise. We're disappointed to hear you did not feel we lived up to this standard, Robert. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

resp.text: Earning the trust of our customers is paramount to our team, Richard, which is why it's so disappointing to learn you feel this way. text: Very nice staff!  Updated me with how much it was going to cost and had me fixed in less than an hour!  Quick service!

text: Took good care of me

name: P.s.T B
text: Great very helpful thanks

name: Cecillynn Shields
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. Worst experience EVER. They have had my car for over a week doing recall work to it. They have no concept of time. I have been given 3 different times of when my car was supposed to be ready and it STILL is not ready. This is NOT my first bad experience with them, but I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and give them another try. MY MISTAKE. They should not even be in the customer service business. Lack of communication between the workers is ridiculous. My car could be on fire and I would NEVER bring it here again.

name: renea waller
text: I took my Ford Explorer in for service today scheduled appointment might I add for a oil change and for them to check my back up camera and to please call me before he did anything to the camera and let me know how much it would cost me. I expressed this 3 times to him and he said no problem. Got a call from him and he informed me that the had filed a claim with my insurance and that it was going to cost me 400.00 plus the oil change, I told him NO! I just wanted to get a estimate and that I was not going to pay for the camera being fix right now, he was not happy and said he would get my car ready and I could come pick it up. I then ask did they even change my oil and he said,"oh not yet". They had my car from 7:00 A.M. scheduled appointment until 6:36 P.M. needless to say I had to call to see if it was even ready yet. He said," yes", and I ask for a total of my bill he states he needed to do another ticket but it would be around 150, no more. I get there and they have charged me 175.26 (WOW)! for a oil change and to look at my camera to tell me it needed to be replaced. Then I also noticed they decided to donate 2.00 of that to drive pink. I called to complain but of course it didn't matter, was told they did want to lose my business well guess what you have. It's a shame as a woman you can't go by yourself to get your car taken care of without men taking advantage of you. Well you might want to think twice before going there. My advice to you is to it to ask for Brandon, because when I called back to complain he was very helpful. And thanks for my courtesy vacuum and wash that I did not receive but was told ALL OUR CUSTOMERS RECEIVE THAT!!!!

name: Raj kumar
text: I've never had such a Bad experience from car service center , I was called for air bag recall , when I brought it in they made me feel like they are doing me a favour ,they changed my delivery time four times I had to take two days off work , they ignore you at the front desk and are very rude over the phone.They  asked my friend Who accompanied me to the service center to leave while she was waiting in the lobby cause it was a cold evening, finially when I got my car ,I asked for the paper work for which they were reluctant to give and then when  I go see my car it had food leftovers  and bottle caps in the front seat  it looked like someone ate in there ,the back seat had come off which didn't  any sense when it was a air bag recall , this is the  worst place to get your car serviced they don't care about coustomer's safety forget satisfaction. Wish I could give zero stars.

name: corrine Parrack
text: Had a nail in my tire but the tire would have to be replaced. Was on phone, the guy said I may need to get all new tires because of tread difference even though I had just told him my tires were only a year old. Told me tire would be their next morning. I dropped off car around 9am and was told the tire was already there! I almost waited but told them I would be back and left with my ride. Thank God I didn’t let my ride go. I returned about 2 hours later to pick up or wait in case they weren’t finished. Found out the tire was not in! Left again and finally got my tire replacement by end of day. As a business, always make sure you know what you say is true when you are dealing with your customers. Very frustrating. At checkout was not offered insurance on the tire either. Whatever. Just glad to have a new tire. Just question these people to make sure what they tell you is true. You know what they say about people that assume. Don’t assume talk to your customers. We take you at your word. Otherwise, friendly people.

resp.text: Hi corrine. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: JerryTeresa Vaughn
text: I'm impressed. Beyond the oil change, I needed a tune-up and a sensor repair (according to my engine light and readout). However, Jason and David suggested other things before changing the sensor - which may not be bad. In the tune up it looked as if an ignition coil was bad, which they changed. It did not solve the problem, so they took everything apart and replaced my coil - saying we will not charge you for what you do not need - nor charge you for the additional labor. They found a cracked sparkplug which caused the problem. My estimated bill of 526 ended up being 326. I expressed to them my gratitude for their integrity, along with their quality work. I'm sold on these guys and am making it my vehicle place. Thanks!

name: Chase Smith
text:
Came in for a full synthetic oil change on my Honda Accord. Ticket was $68.xx but they charged my card $76.xx. I asked why there was a difference and the tech said he didn’t know where he got that number. The manager overheard my complaint and said he would give me an $8 refund. Though it took the manager 15 minutes, I did get me refund.

Also, the tech who changed my oil bragged about Saturdays at this location they turn $8,000-$10,000 in business. Not sure if that’s because they are charging people more than their ticket states or if it’s a true turn around on vehicles. Probably won’t return to this business as it cost me $15 more here than my dealer charges.

resp.text: Chase,we are sorry to hear you are unhappy with your recent visit to our Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers store. text: I've been coming to this location for a while now since I moved to the area. The way I was treated today I don't think I'll be coming back. Waited in line 15-20 min never acknowledged once while waiting the employee working on the truck in front of me looked at me 3 times never said anything. The car beside me that was waiting as well got acknowledged but left due to the wait but a SUV that pulled up behind me was acknowledged asked to pull up to the next slot and got serviced while I'm still waiting. I left when another service truck pulled in to be serviced and was acknowledged right away. Never been treated that badly before and my issue was quick I just needed my maintenance signal reset make sure everything was ok nothing was missed from the last visit. Maybe it was a bad day for them I don't know

resp.text: Thank you, Tommy. We look forward to having you back!

name: Chad Stokes
text:
Talk about “Expect Excellence”, even Nick would be proud of these guys. They are very professional, kind, and pleasant to work with.

I had a blow out, on Friday, September 7th on I-459 while driving South @ 5:45 pm. I hit SIRI on my phone and located the closest tire store to my location and I sure am glad she steered me towards Darrin Gilliam and his team. I slowly limped my way to the store and got out at 5:55pm on Friday afternoon and Mr. Gilliam asked how he could help me. I told him I needed a tire that I just had a blow out and was traveling to Hale County and needed to get home. He checked his inventory, but did not have the tire size I needed, but went well above and beyond to find one for me. He had two other guys and himself on phones calling all around to different stores trying to locate one and I was worried about them closing the doors at 6 pm, but he stated they do not close the doors until all customers are taken care of and would not leave me stranded.

After locating a tire and having it brought there, Darrin Gilliam, Jasson Trammell and Matt Ramirez installed the tire and rim and helped me get back on the road. I have never ever been to ANY BUSINESS 5 minutes before closing time and especially on a Friday afternoon to receive great customer service like this. These gentleman stayed over with smiles on their faces just to make sure I was taken care of, regardless of the time.  While I was waiting, I did notice this location was very well organized and everyone there worked together as a team. This store definitely has their ducks in a row.

The management and workforce in this store is "bar none" the best I have ever seen. Unfortunately, I don’t live close enough to do business with this store, but I will recommend anyone in this area to make this your “go to place” for all of your automotive needs. I will check out the store in Tuscaloosa and see if their standards are as good as this store on 5036 Bond Blvd. Thanks again guys for all your professional and kind help on a short notice at quitting time on a late Friday afternoon. This store should win the store of the year award!

resp.text: Chad, thank you for taking the time to share your positive Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers experience! We appreciate your business and we’re glad we could be there to help get you back on the road safely.

text: The last two oil changes I had were done at this location. Part of the inspection process is supposed to be a check on the battery. However, after my car wouldn’t start today I find the positive terminal on my 2 year old battery severely corroded over. You would think this would be found during the inspection process. I think the technician was more concerned about selling me a cabin air filter that was replaced on my previous visit.

text: I can't give these guys a zero because apparently that's not an option. I went in to get my brakes changed as they were wearing out. We'll I got in my car and where there had been no noise before there was a loud grinding sound from the bearing he said needed to be replaced. This shop purposefully damaged my car, they too advantage of the fact that I was a mom with kids in a hurry. Awful business don't go here!!!
